story:
Story of My Book

The NonRecipe Book teaches you to write your own recipes - in the kitchen, sports and life. Woven with intentionally imprecise methods for creating nutritious, resourceful and fueling dishes for the active person, The NonRecipe book offers a new framework for approaching the kitchen, and our world - starting with our mind. These parallels found between the lessons I've learned in the kitchen - drawing from experiences across creating and working in food companies, coaching, consulting, startups, corporate - in athletic feats, and entrepreneurial endeavors offers a broad and unique perspective to approaching our plates. The NonRecipe Book is full of practical tools and the professional knowledge that connects these mindsets fostered in the kitchen, to stepping up in life.

My name is Amanda Presgraves and I am the author of The NonRecipe Book. What originated our of requests from friends begging me to document my strange food combinations into a recipe book, I quickly realized, I was the last person to write a recipe book. As I’ve never followed a recipe in the kitchen - it dawned on me - I haven’t in life either. What started as a way to give people my recipes, soon turned into the anti-thesis - taking the reader through a one-of-a-kind process to figure it out for themselves.

While conducing The NonRecipe Book Mindset Research interviews, I learned many people believe:
1. they can’t cook, especially without directions
2. that eating and living healthfully is boring, exhausting, confusing, time consuming and expensive
3. the only way to adhering to desired food behaviors is through strict willpower

4. there is a certain prescription of eating and living that we need to follow

I’m challenging these believes, and proving them wrong.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the kitchen is a mirror for teaching us about ourselves. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for fueling ourselves from a place of radical self-compassion, caring for the health of our mind, body, and the world, and that we can truly create our own adventure, and life. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you write your own recipes starting in the kitchen, and watching the self-belief unfold into every facet of your life.

In this book, you'll learn about to throw out the recipe book and listen to your voice. You'll hear heart-opening, research-driven, and uniquely-connected stories such as...

  • The experience growing up as kid with ADHD and how it taught me how to navigate the world on my own terms
  • An almost career-ending injury that forced me to face the dark aspects of myself, and the difficult reality that I could identify as more than an athlete
  • Groundbreaking emerging research on the connection between self-compassion and mental toughness; how food impacts our mood; and ways to drive behavior change
  • Stories of food access, systemic injustice in our food system, sustainability, nutrition and resourceful eating from my professional and personal life
  • The process of learning to listen to our body, trust our intuition and reconnect with our body even when it feels like it is betraying us
  • Overcoming cultures of burnout and hustle in competitive athletics and entrepreneurship
  • The courageous and empowering journey of NonRecipe-students who evolved from cooking with fear and a lack of belief in the kitchen, to ultimately realizing their potential to fuel themselves and their life
  • How the process of building a business is surprisingly similar to creating a meal
  • My experiences with body image and how seeing eating disorders in the athletic community influenced my approach to food
  • Connecting the NonRecipe approach to the principles and interviews from the the worlds top designers, business leaders, and innovative companies with human behavior, neuroscience, and sports psychology

You will love this book if you:

  • Are the athlete and on-the-go human seeking nutritionally and scientifically backed ways of fueling your journey, forging your own path, and taking the trail less traveled.
  • Are ready to change your habits and behavior with a refreshed, intuitive and compassionate way of approaching food that is simple, fun, approachable, realistic and EASY - so you can put that energy back into living and leading a novel life of adventure
  • Don’t believe yourself to be a cook and think eating optimally means boring, tasteless food - you will see it doesn’t mean sacrificing delicious tastes, a fun lifestyle or the special experiences around food. It only enhances it. Your food can look great, taste better, and be phenomenal for you
  • Are a young athlete, high school graduate, retired Olympian, or mom of 3 kiddo’s, realizing you need to care for your mind as much as they body - that is were we begin
  • Feel the weight of society’s perfection-focused pressure in how you eat, move and live (we redefine that)

What struck me the most in my research: the mindsets one took into the kitchen, was identical to their approach in life. If we can change our mind in our home with cooking, the possibilities are endless. 

The NonRecipe Book is a nonfiction book that speaks to young athletes and busy people who want to look at food and their mind in a new way.
 

THE NONRECIPE BOOK


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and book structure (ps: it’s a choose your own adventure)

It’s where my story begins - peeling back the layers on myself and how I learned to write my own recipe in life. We will begin taking a deeper dive into the many systems at play that impact how we eat (our brain/mind, food system, experiences).

  • This section takes research on how in sports, we are always told to be tough, and our hustle culture perpetuates these same messages. When writing this book and exploring these questions, I started to explore what happened when athletes approached challenges with softness, tending to themselves. The emerging research on self compassion, supported by research in somatic experiencing and mental health formed the basis in how this section starts in our mind and body.


Part 2 contains chapters 1-5 based on interviews and research studied, Part 2 takes the reader through the story of a developing young adult finding her footing in the kitchen, new career and post-athletics; unknowingly embarking on the process of self-discovery and self-compassion that comes on the other side of living the process of her testing her skills, starting new and growing in the kitchen.

  • This section will take the reader through the 5 fundamental steps using a Human-Centered Design lens and principles from Design Thinking. This unique NonRecipe approach in the  kitchen guides the reader through the foundational and iterative steps which we arrive at meeting our unique needs. When we begin to understand the power of our my mind when it comes to cooking we unlock the keys to our behavior, health and greatest powers. 
  • Each section has exercises, prompts, and tools - creating a workbook with the step-by-step methods for finding your own process in the kitchen


Part 3 contains all the highly-anticipated NonRecipes, resources and appendix of research and information.

  • The NonRecipes are built with three core principles in mind: resourcefulness, fueling nourishment, connection (to ourselves, community and food system). Each NonRecipe sets you in a direction, rather than give it to you.
  • You’ll find that most meals are based around plants (grains, nuts, legumes, seeds, vegetables, fruits). Taking into account human behavior change, nutritional health, and learning how to fuel optimally from sports as a competitive athlete, I built these NonRecipes with intentional small directions that lead your creativity to tailor your available resources, unique tastes and nutritional needs.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May 2022

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish next Spring (just in time for the Spring harvest - I can’t wait for the fresh life and food to inspire our launch cooking parties!)

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note. 
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

1. When I raise $6,000 then ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
2. When I raise $7,000, then I will publish a hardcover edition (this is how I imagine the book when held in your hand and displayed on your shelf!)
3. When I raise $9,000, then we’ll get an audiobook edition (would love to make this more accessible for all my on-the-go learners)

50% of funds raised over my final goal will be donated to a nonprofit focused on supporting the healthful growth and development of athletes and/or youth through mental, physical, and nutritional support, or financial assistance. 

 

 

About the Author

Amanda Presgraves is a former NCAA D1 competitive swimmer turned USA Triathlete, ultra-endurance athlete, food business entrepreneur, coach, community creator, and now author. Amanda is passionate about eating, moving and thinking in ways that mutually support our body and our world. She believes feeding and fueling can start with our plate and movement - and extends beyond to our inner and outer world, and the complex systems involved.

She is the Chief Innovation Officer at Spira Inc where they use algae as a healthier and more sustainable solution to artificial and animal-based proteins; as well as a freelance food business consultant, multiple food-startup entrepreneur and community builder located in Harrisonburg VA.

Amanda prioritizes engaging in outdoor adventures (in the water, on her feet, and two wheels) with her community, sweet pup Mistie and partner Andrew. Ideally, every adventure would end with creating food with friends (duh).

If you want to stay in the loop, follow along on Instagram (where she shares parts of her writing process, adventures, lessons, reflections and book snippets) at  @amandapresgraves and @thenonrecipebook. For more information, you can connect with Amanda at amanda.presgraves@gmail.com, or on LinkedIn. 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can financially support - I want to create opportunities no matter how you share your energy, gifts and support.

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. By using #nonrecipes and #nonrecipebook and tagging me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, we can help amplify your efforts!
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Word of mouth and genuine excitement is huge - simply by sharing my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media, helps incredibly!

Tag:
Instragram - @amandapresgraves/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - amanda.presgraves/ @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @amandapgraves / @NewDegreePress

​I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

 

Every ounce of your energy and support along this journey has made this possible. From interviews and surveys, to your sharing and encouragement - you keep me going! Step by step, you help me bring The NonRecipe Book to life.

With immense gratitude!
Amanda

story:
Hi! I'm Reidun. I'm writing a book. 

(the first of many)

Memoir and biography have always fascinated me. There's something humanizing in sharing our truths with others as we experienced them. It's a way of connecting with others and finding common ground in all of our unique life experiences. 

I've been writing for over ten years and never settled exactly on what to publish first as my debut title. As I expanded my repertoire, I discovered I had a talent for breathing life into nonfiction. Getting to the meat of a concept or event and deciphering it for others to enjoy and learn from is my passion, and I do it with words. I love teaching, sharing, and giving advice--and taking it, too!

Sharing our stories and passing them down to others is a critical element of developing culture and growing ideas. Each of our stories is important. Nordisco fills a space that right now is a little lacking. Alcoholism and its effect on families isn't a new topic, but some of what happens and the experiences I share are unique through the LGBTQ+ and mental health lenses.

What I Need

What I need: writing fuel! And that comes in two forms: coffee and money. I've got the coffee. (like I'd ever let myself run out)

Here's the breakdown of my budget. 

BLUE data represents a best-case scenario if I could scrounge up every cent I needed to get this off the ground on a 30,000-word manuscript. That is just over $5800. This includes a full team and extra room for revisions (and perfection!)

YELLOW data represents an optimized/adjusted budget, with a revised manuscript of 25,000 words. This settles around $4600. 

RED data also represents a 25,000-word manuscript where I skimp on some services and make do with what I've got. This is not ideal, but I can make things work. That's still around $3500.

 

 

 

Why the campaign goal is only $2,000

I want NORDISCO to be accessible to as many people as possible. There is value in the story I'm sharing, and I do not want it to be prohibitive based on cost.

Every single backing level is a simple quantity preorder, with one or two perks thrown in for good measure. (And maybe some surprises! You never know! ;)

The majority of the funding is to prepare the manuscript. Printing is the final step before marketing. For example, if 720 backers preorder the eBook and fund the entire project, then I know where to work the budget and can focus more on content, format, and marketing over design and printing.

At the end of the day, just like many of you, I also work a day job to support myself and fund as much of this project as possible. The reality is that I can only do so much of that on my own.

 

 

What Your Preorder Does

  • Guarantees a digital or physical copy of the book for you.
  • When possible, supports organizations such as RAINN (coming soon, once budget is finalized!)
  • Sends the message to your community that you support independent art and creative control.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have a firm publication date that I am set on: February 26, 2019. After reworking my budget and timeline, I know I am going to have to bust my butt to get this book ready for you. There is a lot of work to be done and fortunately, I love a good challenge and like many do my best work under pressure! 

The worst case scenario is that the publication date is pushed back, but my biggest challenge that the campaign can't resolve is time. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many campaigns here I would love to contribute to but I am limited myself. If that is out of your means at this time, I completely understand. I would appreciate any of the following:

  • Subscribing to this campaign or following my social media to get updates!
  • Sharing this on your preferred platform(s).
  • Shooting me an email just because. I would love to hear from you no matter what!
  • Dog pictures. Seriously...just send me pictures of your dog. Or any pet!

The worst case scenario is that the publication date is pushed back, but my biggest challenge that the campaign can't resolve is time. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are many campaigns here I would love to contribute to but I am limited myself. If that is out of your means at this time, I completely understand. I would appreciate any of the following:

Subscribing to this campaign or following my social media to get updates!
Sharing this on your preferred platform(s).
Shooting me an email just because. I would love to hear from you no matter what!
Dog pictures. Seriously...just send me pictures of your dog. Or any pet!

story:
The Man "Who had it all?"

On the outside, sure. John McInroy was the great South African change-agent, social entrepreneur, ultra-endurance athlete, philanthropist, social activist, international field hockey player, model, actor and public speaker. He founded Red Socks Friday, a movement that has connected people all over the world, and the Unogwaja Charitable Trust and the corresponding Unogwaja Challenge. This legendary 1,650 km annual 10-day bike ride (which John has done on FOOT) goes from Cape Town to Pietermaritzburg, and is immediately followed by the 89 km Comrades Marathon on the very next day. Add to that an MBA from the University College of Dublin’s Graduate Business School, awarded through the “Ideas for the Future” scholarship, and you have the man who

Had. It. ALL.

Epic, no?

Sure, except for one very small, five-year long massive act of self denial that would grind him mentally and physically into submission. On the inside it sounded like this -

In Butterfly Man, John shares his personal experience of having tried to embody the modern male corporate and social success story, and the HUGE physical and mental health costs he paid as a result.

Did anyone say, "erectile dysfunction?"

"Shhhh."

Or is that rather, 

                                                   

Butterfly Man is John's formula for identifying the mental and physical health effects of überculture and Feel f' Real is the health initiative that sprung out of that process.

What good is health if it's not shared?

 

Feel f’ Real was formed in partnership with Olive Retreat, a unique, top-ranked wellness destination dedicated to helping individuals discover the causes of illness and suffering in their lives and identifying healthy and realistic solutions and strategies and implementing them into the rest of their lives. Olive's partnership with John formed over the year following his first visit, and as his interest in sharing his healing experience with the rest of the world grew and eventually became embodied in Butterfly Man.

Olive’s success is based on an understanding of how the changes we need or seek in our lives almost always requires transcending the most familiar of forms, physical, social, and psychological. Olive's value proposition is its ability to synthesize knowledge from all disciplines and world views, with guests learning from the latest scientific research and most ancient wisdom, and how to incorporate this learning back home. Olive believes in health as a basic right for all.

     

                                          

$15,000?

It would be truly awesome if at this point in our work we had additional support for the basics of what we do, including things like printing, getting John around the world (always as cheaply as possible) admin and other bits and pieces required in the process of spreading the message and reaching those who need help in their lives, some of them urgently,

- It costs around $2000 for 500 copies of the book (enough have already been printed to satisfy orders (thanks PPK CAP), but often they go faster than we can keep up, (thanks lit lovers), and this requires logistics and entails upfront costs.

- formatting, layout, design, updates, etc., add up to a good $1000 here and there,

- flights (ZA > EU > NA > EU > ZA) around $2000, we always find the cheapest flights available, even if it means sleeping in airports (which we've grown to enjoy), trains and busses in between, and walking a lot, barefoot even. Mostly,

- we pay for websites and we do all our own admin, $1000 yearly, not including email providers and stitches,

- retreat infrastructure often requires handsome up front fees, occasional travel, huge amounts of logistics, and we reckon $4000-5000 before we begin to collect,

- we enjoy being able to offer hugely discounted (or even free) retreats for the needy but capital-free,

- in the meanwhile, there is the question of food and shelter, minimal as we all are,

- everything we do is inspired by transforming

into tangible acts of hope and peaceful social activism.

                       

into tangible acts of hope and peaceful social activism.

Risk-Free PERKS

We don't see any risk involved in our perks because the cheapest gives one a sense of having contributed to a proven good cause, and from those two up, tangible items, or many of them,     

Or, in the words of readers so far -

"I'm on page 123 started two days ago shit I can't stop and I'm not a reader!"

"I started and finished it in one day...it is one of the most honest autobiographies I have ever read. Poetic. Brutally honest. Painful and incredibly naked and just so in time."

"I read it cover to cover that afternoon and just loved it!  The first thing I thought was, how incredibly brave of him to share his story. It really hit home for me, the book made me laugh, cry, think and feel!"​

"A total game changer."

"An amazing, heartfelt, mind shattering epic adventure."

"Do yourself and possibly the world a favor and read this book. I promise you will not put it down."

"The most heartfelt and poetically written and truthful piece of literature I may have ever had the good fortune of reading and not been able to put down."

"Read it cover to cover today and you have nailed it!" 

"Really beautifully written."

“Just want to reiterate how truly amazing I found Butterfly Man! Your book is the ultimate emotional roller coaster ride – searingly honest, harrowing, almost cataclysmic, deeply touching, inspirational and uplifting, and in the final analysis life affirming and an absolutely irresistible catalyst for change!”​

"I had no idea what I was in for. I read it cover to cover in one afternoon and just loved it! The first thing I thought was, how incredibly brave for him to share his story. It really hit home for me. The book made me laugh, cry, think, but mostly feel! After reading it you'll think about yourself, your truth, your connection to this world and to others and feel the changes and creativity it encourages."

"Butterfly Man is a raw, honest, and highly entertaining story of a man breaking free from the chains of shame and letting go and trying to live up to the super man sign hanging over his head after years of over achieving and not listening to what his body was trying to tell him. It is an inspiration in discovering yourself as a human being."​

"WOW. It's like poetry. I'm feeling all the angst and shame as I'm reading it. Some parts feel chaotic and stressful, just how I imagine you must've been feeling. I'm loving it!"

"This is a beast my man!"

"Honestly I think I could read it a million times and still not be able to find the words."

"This book is a mess!! Just like many of us!!!"

"It's painful in every way and if the person reading it isn't able to feel the agony you were in they've reached inside to feel their own."

“A must read for anyone who wants to be a true to themselves and still perform! I both cried and laughed, a beautiful read.”

"The style is fresh and original I hear the voice clearly...it's going along with the ride!"

"Real and passionate and I was alongside you the whole way. It's almost like a huge verse of poetry."

“This is amazingly real you can feel the suffering! Fuck bru!"

"It's really beautifully written and done so in such a unique way. It feels like a stream of consciousness."

"You did a lot of amazing things with your words and I was sad when it was over. It felt so nice, getting lost in your craziness and so refreshing and grounding."

"You found a way, a portal, a path to us people and I promise to be one of the messengers. Your book will not sit on a shelf, it will travel around and get all tattered and worn out, that is a promise!!"

**By no means is this a complete list of reviews, but our admin time is limited**

PERKs, CONTINUED

The most expensive of our perks gives you or someone you love an epic week in either Spain or Thailand,, with a top-ranked and amazing retreat provider, Olive Retreat,, where John's journey began and continues. Please enquire also for the possibility of bringing a retreat to you or your organization.

           Check here to read what guests have said about Olive!

PERKs, CONTINUED

And yet another perk is an actual appearance of Bodhi John McInroy himself, worth almost every penny, kind of.

    

Check that oke out. Hectic, bru! (ten bucks says he isn't wearing shoes)

Rather than "impact" we prefer "effects"

The beauty of our lives is that we didn't set out from the beginning to be doing this, and yet, we are so grateful it has fallen to us to be here on the page together now, regardless of the outcome.

Promoting an amazing and compassionate work of literature with a humanitarian objective, and doing retreats and supporting creativity and helping people to heal from various illnesses (mental and physical) and become healthier and happier and more loving and compassionate toward themselves and other living creatures is a pretty cool karmentum to have, eh?

Effects

What you can say, if nothing else, when you look into the mirror or your lover's eyes or your children's or the sky is that out there yet another handful of people have invested their lives into saving other living creatures from suffering and abuse and certain doom. and have created a work of literary art, a health course and an online resource for supporting peaceful social activists,                  

Look, it's Karma,                    

we believe our project is valuable because mental and physical illness is increasing globally,

  • it has to do with how we are expected to live our lives,
  • that 150 billion animals are slaughtered every year,
  • that's 400 million a day, for food,
  • that half the world's population live on less than $2.50 a day,
  • that 5 (white) own half this world's wealth,
  • women still earn half as much as men,
  • 25% of those earning women are sexually harassed,
  • 75% of those who report it are punished,
  • age, disability, race, color, religion, nationality, are continued criteria for discrimination,
  • 16,000 children under 5 years of age die every day,
  • 21 million people are trapped in one kind of slavery or another,
  • more than 100 million people are homeless,
  • climate change is real,
  • each year, nations generate 1.3 billion tons of waste,
  • 8 million tons of plastic go into the oceans every year, for a total of more than 5.25 trillion pieces as of now,
  • we eat them,
  • 48 football fields of forest are cut down every minute,
  • sugar is the most dangerous and addictive drug in the world,
  • diabetes, heart disease, obesity, certain kinds of cancer, are the result,
  • 180,000 annual deaths from fizzy drinks alone,
  • do you get our point?
  • do you understand why the world is suffering?
  • can you imagine that we've been trying to do something about this suffering for years but would like to do it on a larger scale?
  • we used to live for income, and now we live for reviews, i.e., there are those mornings, often actually, when you ask yourself, "why I am I doing this?" And then the message comes,

and you grab your mobile, open it, and read,

"I am so lucky to have found you at the time of my greatest need."​

"I can't tell you how grateful I am for what you have given me, and how my life has changed as a result."

"Thank you for helping me remember to enjoy the journey as much as I feel the pain of awareness and a feeling of injustice for so many people.​"

"I'm pretty sure you saved my life."

"I have been writing for days and I can't stop!"

Other Ways You Can 

Maybe you don't have the dough to spare. That's cool. We really need help with social media, some editing, some admin, some of this and that. You see who we are and what we do, what looks fun for you?

And that's all there is to it.

And yet, we are happy to share our success. Maybe you want to invest your time in helping us develop our initiatives, and we are happy to share our resources and good luck with you, too, because that's just the way we are.

Peace from those who for so long didn't feel at all, but now, do.

"God bless, us, everyone." - Charles John Huffam Dickens.

story:
What's going on here?

We Are Cardiff is a Cardiff based project that's been telling the stories of Cardiff people for the past five years. We're excited to announce that our latest project - the We Are Cardiff Press - is publishing its first book this November!

It's an anthology of fictional short stories and illustrations, all created by local artists and writers. It's a beautiful, high-quality publication and we're very excited to share it with you.

How this helps Cardiff's creative community

The Press will be a small, non-profit collective, publishing literature and art from creators in the city. We’ll be crafting collectable, limited edition runs of beautiful books, from literature to photography, and illustration to personal storytelling.

Each book will be a special, high quality piece that you’ll want to keep and read over and again. We’ll be working with the city’s best writers, photographers and illustrators to tell you the stories that make up Cardiff. These gorgeous publications will be sold online and in local outlets.

All profits from sales will be put back into the Press to fund new books, and run creative writing workshops for local people.

We need YOU to help us get our first book printed! All the info about us and our debut book is below.

Who we are

We Are Cardiff is an online community that celebrates our city and its culture. We launched five years ago, and in that time we’ve published over 450 articles, racked up 320,000 views and we have 35,000 followers on social media.

The Guardian chose us as one of the best city blogs in the world. We won the People’s Choice Award at the Wales Blog Awards. We made a film. We made a radio documentary. We’ve had exhibitions and a stage at Swn festival. We even have an official sister site in We Are Chester.

The 42b

Our first book is a collection of short stories and illustrations called ‘The 42b’. Each story follows a different character as they get off the (fictional) number 42b bus and delve into their lives: from wrestlers to adulterers, and pensioners to murderers. 

They exist in a city of different realities, where ageing brings the threat of grisly mutation and citizens are bound by their occupations. It’s a kaleidoscope of the different versions of the city that we live in and how it is evolving around us.


Although self-contained, the plots weave in and out of each other to form a whole work. Eleven writers and illustrators created the book, and they will be very special things - beautifully designed and made with high quality materials  to ensure that each copy is a piece of art that you’ll want to keep forever. There will also be limited edition prints of the illustrations available. 

The books are being printed by the Cardiff-based, family-run company Abbey Bookbinding.

We will be launching the Press alongside our debut publication, and revealing future plans at a very special launch event on 5 November 2015.

Whether you can pre-order the book or not, we'd love to see you at the launch party: it's FREE! Information is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1058250014193697/


What we need and what you get

To fund the first print run of books, we need people to pre-order. 

We need £2,000 to get pay for the first print run and other things like ISBN numbers. We are not taking any profit from the Press - everyone involved has contributed their time and work for free. Any profit will be put back into the Press to invest in the next publication.

The only perk remaining is the Crwys Road stop - a copy of the book and invitation to the launch party (£12).

The impact

Cardiff is a little city with big culture. After five years of running We Are Cardiff, we know how many talented creators live in our city - writers, photographers, artists, and more. We want to expand our arts community from just being online into print, so people can own a piece of the city and keep it forever. These books will be the legacy of the arts in Cardiff. 

Risks and challenges

The risk is that we don't make enough money to pay the printers for the first run of books. We'll overcome this by just making the run smaller. 

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute, don't worry! You can help us out by spreading the word about the book, or buying it when it's on general sale after 6 November. You'll find copies in lots of places in Cardiff, and online. Keep an eye on our website and social media accounts for more info.

We Are Cardiff: wearecardiff.co.uk / wearecardiffpress.co.uk / @wearearecardiff / Facebook: We Are Cardiff Facebook 

For more information on the Press, get in touch with Hana  - hana@wearecardiffpress.co.uk

The only perk remaining is the Crwys Road stop - a copy of the book and invitation to the launch party (£12).
  The impact Cardiff is a little city with big culture. After five years of running We Are Cardiff, we know how many talented creators live in our city - writers, photographers, artists, and more. We want to expand our arts community from just being online into print, so people can own a piece of the city and keep it forever. These books will be the legacy of the arts in Cardiff. 
    Risks and challenges The risk is that we don't make enough money to pay the printers for the first run of books. We'll overcome this by just making the run smaller. 
    Other ways you can help If you can't contribute, don't worry! You can help us out by spreading the word about the book, or buying it when it's on general sale after 6 November. You'll find copies in lots of places in Cardiff, and online. Keep an eye on our website and social media accounts for more info.
We Are Cardiff: wearecardiff.co.uk / wearecardiffpress.co.uk / @wearearecardiff / Facebook: We Are Cardiff Facebook 
For more information on the Press, get in touch with Hana  - hana@wearecardiffpress.co.uk

story:
Hello my name is Matt Wright. I am a 29 year old man from Prince Georges county Maryland. I am a first time author, but I like to think that I am an experienced storyteller. I practically grew up in a hair salon/barber shop where both my parents worked. As a kid I spent more time at "The Shop" than I did in my actual home. Two things that I remembered as a kid was to stay out of grown folks business, but I also learned that everyone had a story. As a kid I wasn't privy to join the conversation but I was always allowed to listen and over time I gained perspective and learned the art of storytelling. 

RNPGLA is bigger than me! This book is for every person who has ever scrolled down their social media timeline and thought less of themselves, for people who have had dreams deferred, or for people who may feel stagnant in a 9-5p and are looking for ways to grow.  Your contribution to this campaign will not just help me finish this project, but also help others out there who may be needing some encouragement or an escape in form of a book!

This project is extremely important to me because there aren't enough voices in our community highlighting the idea that it's ok to be normal. Social media has made it extremely easy to lose perspective in 2018, and this has led to my own personal experiences where I noticed direct correlation between  the "problems" I went through in my life and my "skewed" perspective"  

I am looking to raise $7500 in order to start my initial wave of mass production for this book, The $7500 will go towards editing fees, publishing costs, promotion expenses, and any unknown expenses that a first time author may experience. Editing and the production of the book will be the primary focus in the event that we do not reach the goal of $7500.

story:
What do a yoga instructor, ESL teacher and Reality T.V. producer have in common? They are each in need of a ghost-to-human intervention to cure their Scrooge-like tendencies!

Read more at: writerblogue.blogspot.com

Update #3 -NEW PERK!

Every person who contributes to the start-up Campaign becomes a Founding Funder. As a Founding Funder, you automatically become a lifetime recipient of all future books published by my Indie Writer Forum: BooksEndependent!

Update #2

Meet Gabriel in the latest excerpt posted on my blog: http://writerblogue.blogspot.com/

Many thanks to all Funders! We have reached a level to fund distribution and cover design! Moving forward toward editing, proof reading, print copies and more!

UPDATE #1:

Read the opening of "I Believe" on my blog - http://writerblogue.blogspot.com/

 

Was Marley & Scrooge the only ghost-to-human intervention ever?

This is what I wonder.

Marley’s haunting, and the arrangement he made for Scrooge had a far-reaching and beneficial effect.  Surely, poor Jacob Marley’s ghost found some peace for being such a compassionate medium. I like to believe so.  I would also like to believe that attempts at intercessions such as this occur with some frequency among unfulfilled spirits. Even now. Even in Los Angeles. I Believe.

 This is that story.

The Wondering Author - Valerie Woods

After an eleven year career writing one hour drama for television, (Under One Roof, Touched by an Angel, Promised Land, Any Day Now, Soul Food), I have now turned to documentary films, screenwriting, memoirs and my first love, fiction. www.vcwoods.com

My goal is to build an eBook publishing library. The first project is this novella, I Believe. Next up, the highly fictionalized memoir of the adventures I shared in childhood with my elder sister: Katrin's Chronicles: The Canon of Jacquelene Dyanne (first in a trilogy), followed by the novella Crossroads the coming of age of a contemporary high priestess, prequel to the novel Avalon. 

Storytelling is life...we all tell a story in how we live and it's entertaining and sometimes rather profound to imagine other lives and other stories. It's a way to reach some of those intangible truths.

What is Needed and What You Get

Your contribution will support the beginning of a new eBook library by bringing this first story to light. Funds received will help bring together a team to:

  • Edit and proofread the manuscript
  • Design the book cover
  • Format the manuscript for eBook publication on Amazon, iBookstore, Nook and more.
  • Create a limited run of hardcover editions

Funds received over and above the target goal will be used to hire an Illustrator and publish more books!


And just think about the perks!

  • An eBook or hardcover will make excellent holiday gifts.
  • An original, one-of-a-kind Los Angeles Thank You postcard
  • Have a character named after you or anyone you designate.
  • Your name mentioned in the Acknowledgements
  • Receive an autographed (and hopefully illustrated) hardcover edition.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign! Gotta love social media!

Indiegogo has some wonderful share tools!

story:
The Book, I Love the Color Pink, the Adventures of Laci Macasey,  by Monica Hatley-Carr, is a great story that teaches kids about the importance of colors and appreciating people for who they are. We want to offer you the opportunity to be a part of this wonderful book that will continue as a series. This book also has a companion website, www.WhoIsLaciMacasey.com that comes with free classroom worksheets for kids to learn new vocabulary and color identification.

Your funding will go towards The Laci Macasey Education Program. I am an educator by trade so I have booked several schools in several different states, at no charge to the schools, to speak to children about my book, teaching them how I wrote the book, teaching them about colors, about words, and about the importance of reading. Your gratitude towards such a great service is greatly appreciated and you can be rewarded with one of our many perks we have available.

“I Love the Color Pink!” is specifically written to teach kids the different kinds of color and what makes each of them unique. It follows the adventures of a little girl named Laci Macasey who loves the color pink, in fact she loves it so much that she makes a wish that everything in the world was colored pink. Unknown to her, a fairy named Pinki makes her wish come true. At first Laci is ecstatic her wish came true, but as time goes on, she comes to realize that having only one color, even if it is a favorite color makes things pretty dull. Now, it’s up to Laci and her fairy friend Pinki to put things back to normal.

We appreciate your interest and we will make sure the students we teach to know how much you have done to assure they are excelling in reading.

For updates, follow us on www.Facebook.com/WhoIsLaciMacasey and www.Twitter.com/LaciMacasey.

We have already invested over $2000 of our personal funds to get the first printing of the book completed (which can be ordered through www.Amazon.com and www.BarnesAndNoble.com). The additional $5740 in funding we are hoping to raise will allow us to:

(1) Order 100 more copies of the book from the publisher to distribute to children who cannot otherwise afford to buy the book ($1310)
(2) Pay for registration and travel expenses to the Hudson Children's Book Fair in Hudson, NY in May 2014 ($900)
(3) Pay for registration and travel expenses to the Texas Book Fair in Austin, TX in October 2014 ($830)
(4) Create a prototype of a Laci Macsey dolls for distribution to kids as incentives for reading ($600.00)
(5) Create two (2) educational videos for distribution to schools for free ($1,000.00)
(6) Cover our marketing fee to our publisher Xlibris for them to help us market and sell the book to more metropolitan areas around the country ($700.00)
(7) Republishing fee to our publisher Xlibris so we can reprint the book with a "Thank You" page with the names of those who contributed to our campaign ($400.00)

As of the start of this campaign, we have completed many of the tasks required to get this book in the hands of thousands of children. To date, we have:

Completed manuscript
Completed the illustrations for the book
Signed with a publish on demand (POD) publisher
Started a Laci Macasey facebook page
Started a Laci Macasey twitter account
Published the initial release of the Laci Macasey website
Completed five companion workbook exercises for elementary school teachers (download for free from website)
Received first printing of the book
Started scheduling educational programs in Las Vegas elementary schools

Our Perks:

$5 Donation: Website high five
$15 Donation: Free copy of "Laci's Color Remix" MP3 rap song (great for children!)
$50 Donation: 8.5 X 11 inch Laci Macasey hand drawn picture with a personal message.
$100 Donation: Free copy of the book with your name placed on the "thank you" page in the second printing and Laci Macasey hand drawn picture with a personal message.

If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we will use the funds to buy as many books as we can (up to 100), pay for the reprint to add the "Thank you" page and distribute those in Las Vegas elementary schools and try to attend one book fair.

story:
On the photo (from top-right): our grandma (babushka Katya); Galina (Masha's mother); younger Galina (babushka's daughter and my mother); our grandfather, dedushka, Pavel (passed away a year ago) - all in their summer residence around the year of 1978.

Our Story

Our elders hold unique stories: both from the historical perspective and from the perspective of love - they are the ones who love us selflessly, wholeheartedly no matter what we do 

(a note from a friend)

 

Let us introduce ourselves and our grandma (babushka as we call her in Russian).

Maria (Masha) is my cousin, she is a graphic designer illuminating the stories. Have a look at her work here: http://www.mariaklochkova.com/ Masha got her MA degree at Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design and currently lives in London. 

Ekaterina (Katya) who is writing this text is an aspiring writer, an author of a few articles and a recently published family comedy (family members laughed to tears when reading:) I live in Moscow where I am taking a course on Russian literature and find inspiration for my stories.

When I recently got back to Russia after three years of living abroad I went to visit my grandmother (her name is Katya, and as you notice I was named after her) and found myself listening to my grandmother's life & family stories. In fact I have heard them for at least ten times already...

And it suddenly stroke me. All this time I've been a passive listener of her stories. Just sitting there, again and again, nodding my head. That's fine, yet - why don't I write them up and share so that next generations hear them too and be encouraged by babushka's life?

What if our babushka shares about her life in the village in the USSR? The hunger that she went through in 1930s, when all people could eat were fried sunflower seeds? The letters she wrote for many mothers and sisters who asked her write to their husbands (grandma says she used to compose them well:) The time after the war when she and her husband Pavel worked on construction sire to rebuild the entire town?

 

Since then, I've had a strong calling that I can't let those stories go and need to make them live long. With this, Masha and I started to explore the idea of publishing grandma's stories.

 

The Impact

Every grandmother holds enriching life stories, and our babushka is not unique in this regard. However I didn't notice that we often turn to the stories of the past and connect to our lineage. 

This book's immediate impact would be visible in my family. It will wonderfully unite them around their roots and help each of my family members find strength for their own life journeys. 

Secondly, I believe this book would become an inspiration for many young people to visit their elders and listen to them, and - by listening - to themselves become more whole and grounded individuals.

 

Then, most importantly what if we take those stories beyond our family? What could the world learn about life in USSR during babushka's youth years? 

 

Last but not the least, our babushka would be very happy to see this book as a gift for her 79th birthday :)

 


We believe that crowdsourcing the funds would add us confidence in the importance of this work for the world. Of course, we would write up and share all the stories regardless of the funding, but publishing a book is different. 

If we don't get the money through this campaign, the stories are likely to stay in our laptops and get emailed to our children in the future. It's fine, but not quite enough for the kind of stories our babushka holds.

If we exceed the goal, we will print additional copies and give them out to our funders.

 

 

 

The Need

 

Amount breakdown:

 

  • 550 USD - a cost for publishing 4-5 copies of the book in a good studio in London. That's enough to get started. If the book is great and/or we exceed the goal, we are happy to scale it up.
  • 30 USD - IndieGoGo and payment processors' fees.

 

We invite you to contribute any amount starting from 10 dollars. Please find details of funding on the panel from the right.

 

 

What We've Already Done

  • For this project: wrote up some stories (work in progress) and collected old photographs; contributed our bit for the funding.
  • Previously: published a family book together (Katya wrote the text, Masha designed the layout); Katya has taken dozens of interviews and written short stories; Masha has designed dozens of books and other prints.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial contribution is great, but there are other ways you can help and add value to the project:

 

  • Invite your friends to contribute by sharing this story with them - it's best to do it by clicking "Share" button under campaign picture on this page.
  • Share your opinion: how can we take this book beyond our family? What would you like to know about life of elders in Russia? 
  • Offer to be a copy-editor for English version.
  • You may also sign up to order the copy of the book (if the project is realised)

 

 

Thank you!

story:
Short Story

I'm Rodvé Lewis and I graduated from San Jose State University in 2011 with a degree in Business Administration-Finance, and a minor in Economics. My passion is writing and telling stories. I've been creatively writing since I was 10. 

I finally wrote my first book titled "Dreams or Degrees: How to Graduate from College in Four Years" after many years of contemplation. At first I had no idea where to start, but I just knew that this book would definitely help students and I just started outlining. 

My story is unique because I was behind in school, but I was able to make an underdog turnaround to get back on track and out with a cap. Now I feel compelled to share my story with students around the world.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is $3000 to cover mainly publishing expenses. Publishing is roughly $2000, the other $1000 will be used to get a short run of books printed so I can start selling them. The more money I have toward printing, the cheaper it'll be to print. 

It Just Got Real

The fact of the matter is that most schools graduate less than 50% of their students in 4 years. It's actually more like less than 30%. For example, when I graduated from San Jose State University, only 6.8% of the students did it in 4 years, while only 2.3% of the black males graduated in 4 years. It's not normal anymore to graduate in 4 years, so I'm giving you all the keys to success. I didn't write this book to try to make a lot of money. I wrote the book because I felt like what I did was special and if a lot of people agree with me I will be able to continue to write books.

Now don't get me wrong, some books are fun, but most "how-to" books are boring. Well this isn't your typical "how-to" book. I wrote it from my perspective and it reads more like a short story. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone isn't in the position to contribute cash, but you can still help. There are millions of students in the world that may need this book: transfer students, high school seniors, regular college students, etc. They might not see my video, but with your help by sharing this, more people may be interested in the book and will have the option to contribute to the campaign. 

The Book

Each chapter is self illustrated to give you an idea of how I think. The book will range from 100-150 pages in length when it's finally printed. I kept the typical college student's workload in mind and did my best not to write a text book.
story_txt:
Short Story
I'm Rodvé Lewis and I graduated from San Jose State University in 2011 with a degree in Business Administration-Finance, and a minor in Economics. My passion is writing and telling stories. I've been creatively writing since I was 10. 
I finally wrote my first book titled "Dreams or Degrees: How to Graduate from College in Four Years" after many years of contemplation. At first I had no idea where to start, but I just knew that this book would definitely help students and I just started outlining. 
My story is unique because I was behind in school, but I was able to make an underdog turnaround to get back on track and out with a cap. Now I feel compelled to share my story with students around the world.
What I Need & What You Get
My goal is $3000 to cover mainly publishing expenses. Publishing is roughly $2000, the other $1000 will be used to get a short run of books printed so I can start selling them. The more money I have toward printing, the cheaper it'll be to print. 
It Just Got Real
The fact of the matter is that most schools graduate less than 50% of their students in 4 years. It's actually more like less than 30%. For example, when I graduated from San Jose State University, only 6.8% of the students did it in 4 years, while only 2.3% of the black males graduated in 4 years. It's not normal anymore to graduate in 4 years, so I'm giving you all the keys to success. I didn't write this book to try to make a lot of money. I wrote the book because I felt like what I did was special and if a lot of people agree with me I will be able to continue to write books.
Now don't get me wrong, some books are fun, but most "how-to" books are boring. Well this isn't your typical "how-to" book. I wrote it from my perspective and it reads more like a short story. 
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that everyone isn't in the position to contribute cash, but you can still help. There are millions of students in the world that may need this book: transfer students, high school seniors, regular college students, etc. They might not see my video, but with your help by sharing this, more people may be interested in the book and will have the option to contribute to the campaign. 
The Book
Each chapter is self illustrated to give you an idea of how I think. The book will range from 100-150 pages in length when it's finally printed. I kept the typical college student's workload in mind and did my best not to write a text book.

story:
What is Writers Read?

Writers Read was born in Sitka, Alaska on September 26, 2012.  It began because one local writer realized there was no space in the Sitka community for writers to share their writing live for an appreciative audience.  She believed the small, island community was full of writers quietly working away at their craft, feeling alone with their art.  It turned out she was right!  Writers began to emerge from boats, cabins, homes, kayaks, tents, offices, the mountains, and the muskegs when she reached out asking for writers willing to read their own writing in front of an audience.  The first ever Writers Read was made of six writers who performed for an audience of over 75!  Since then Writers Read has happened once a month (with a month or two off) featuring at least four new writers at each event.

 

Why Does Writers Read Need Money?

Writers Read now wants to share local writers' work not just in live format, but in print, too.  To do this The Island Institute has offered to team with Writers Read to showcase Sitkan writers in the summer issue of "Connotations."  This special issue of "Connotations" will include writers who have performed in Writers Read, in addition to some Sitkan writers who have yet to perform live!

It takes a bit of money to print "Connotations," and while Writers Read has raised some of the cost already through generous donations from audience members at events, we still need a bit more in order to get this very special issue printed and in your hands.  ALL money goes to printing costs (no staff are paid for this project).

Some Perks to Donating

  • Donate $10 and receive a heartfelt "thank you" email from Writers Read and The Island Institute staff.
  • Donate $25 and get your name listed in the upcoming issue of "Connotations" as a financial conributor to the issue.
  • Donate $50 and receive a free copy of this special Writers Read issue of "Connotations."
  • Donate $100 and receive a free copy of this special Writers Read issue of "Connotations" as well as a public "thank you" at the special Writers Read event in September when we will make the summer "Connotations" issue available for purchase.

Some Other Perks to Donating

  • Help encourage Sitka writers to keep working away at their craft and consider sharing their writing publicly.
  • Help Writers Read become a sustainable part of Sitka's vibrant arts community.
  • Support The Island Institute's new focus on local writers and artists, and encourage The Island Institute to continue to showcase locals once a year in "Connotations."

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't actually donate money right now, and that's A-OK because you can still help!  Get the word out about this fundraising campaign by sharing this indiegogo link with your friends.  Also, buy a "Connotations" issue when you see one available.  And attend future Writers Reads; the next one will be in September and an appreciative audience is just as important as the writers willing to share their writing.  Thank you!

story:
Who I am

I am a novelist, short story writer, speaker, and essayist from Syracuse, NY. I am the author of Refuse- a 2011 LGBT Rainbow Awards finalist, a contributor to The Collection: Short Fiction From The Transgender Vanguard- currently up for a 2012 Lambda Literary Award. For more on who I am and why my writing is important, please go here: http://elliottdelineofficial.wordpress.com/about/

I published my second book, I Know Very Well How I Got My Name, on May 1st 2013. I am touring this summer to give readings- so far I have visited San Francisco and NYC. I want to go to Philadelphia next to attend the Trans Health Conference- I've never been! 

My Goal

I hope to have a table at the Philly Trans Health Conference (June 13-15) where I will sell & sign books as well as answer questions and hopefully have some great talks with lovely people (yourself included)! I am also giving a free reading with other trans writers on the evening of June 13th. More info on that here: http://www.queerbooks.com/event/readings-transgender-philadelphia-trans-health-conference

The conference itself is free, but paying for a room for 3 days, travel, buying the books to sell, renting a table, and compensating an assistant for the 3 days really adds up. 

I really want to meet readers who are attending! This would also be a HUGE opportunity for me, seeing as thousands of trans and queer people attend each year. I could potentially acquire hundreds of new readers for my books. Because I am a self-published author, reaching out to readers in situations like this means everything! I need to get the word out there about my new book.

It's also worth noting that books and readings are currently my only source of income, as I was fired from my job earlier this year for very sketchy reasons :(

My new book would not have been possible without your support in 2012 (see kickstarter: http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/57367316/new-book-from-author-of-refuse-about-transgender-y) and now I need some help again to make sure it is a success. 

What I'm asking for:

I need at least $800. 

-Bus, $100

-Lodging 3 nights, $300

-Table, $60

-50-100 Books to sell, $150-300

-Food, public transportation, other expenses- ??*

-paying an assistant to help me man the booth- ??*

*depends on how much I raise. I will be frugal.

Any left over money will go towards future events/readings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this project, even if you can't contribute, and tell people about my new book, I Know Very Well How I Got My Name!

story:
Babette Weblog Here...


Short Summary

"Babette: The Many Lives, Two Deaths and Double Kidnapping of Dr. Ellsworth" is the story of Ross Eliot's early years in Portland, when he stumbled upon an unusual living situation with an eccentric history professor. In exchange for living quarters in her pantry, Eliot served as companion, chauffeur, confidant and sometimes medic for the flamboyant and worldly septuagenarian. His account of these years pulls the reader through religious, cultural and historical tales laced with intrigue, felony, incest and mystery.

What We Need & What You Get

$2,600 will cover printing 500 copies of the book through Lightning Source Publishing. The more money raised, the better resources can be used to promote this unparalleled story. However, contributing won't only earn you Ross Eliot's undying gratitude. Check below to see what is available in return.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help out monetarily, please take the time to share this project with other people who might be interested. Feel free to subscribe to the Babette weblog or "like" the facebook page. Thanks to everyone who has already assisted over the years.

story:
I have been granted a full scholarship to attend the Writing & Knowing Workshop, led by Ellen Bass, Dorianne Laux and Joseph Millar at The Esalen Institute In Big Sur, California. Now all I need are expenses for travel, accomodations and meals. This would be a tremendous opportunity for me. As most of you know, I have been seriously pursuing my craft as a poet for over 35 years (I started at 18) and received my MFA in Poetry from Vermont College in January of 2005. My first collection of poetry: Closer,  was published in June 2011. I am widely published, and details of my career as a poet are available through my website at WIX and Facebook page. A great deal (though not all) of my verse addresses the struggles of gay men in American culture, which is a cause of key importance to me. Ellen Bass (my friend and mentor) believes this 5 day workshop will be of particular value to me, and my growth as a poet. Ellen was the poet who chose me as one of the 10 selected for The Lambda Literary : Emerging Writers Retreat in August 2010. I am also wait-listed for Yaddo, and apply for residencies regularly, so all funds raised will be put to good use. Any donation, $1.00 or more, would be deeply appreciated. 

****

Christopher Stephen Soden is a native Texan. He is a writer, teacher, critic, lecturer and performer. Christopher received his MFA in Writing (Poetry) from Vermont College in January of 2005. He's taught classes and guest lectured on the subjects of craft, theory, genre, literature and publication. He currently writes theatre critique for Examiner.com, PegasusNews.com, and A + C DFW. He has written poetry, plays, performance pieces, literary, film and theatre critique. His first poetry collection, Closer, was released by Rebel Satori/Queer Mojo : June 14th, 2011. His honors include: Full Fellowship for Lambda Literary Retreat: Emerging LGBT Voices August 2010. Distinguished Poets of Dallas, Poetry Society of America's Poetry in Motion Series, Founding Member, President and President Emeritus of The Dallas Poets Community. Finalist in Dobie Paisano Fellowship, 4Th Unity and LSU Outworks Drama Festivals. Finalist in Robin Becker and Refined Savage Chapbook Contests. His work has appeared in :Collective Brightness, Resilience, Assaracus, The Q Review, A Face to Meet the Faces, Ganymede Poets : One, Gay City 2, The Café Review, The Texas Observer, Sentence, Borderlands, Off the Rocks, The James White Review, The New Writer, Velvet Mafia, Poetry Super Highway, Gertrude, Touch of Eros, Gents, Bad Boys and Barbarians, Windy City Times, ArLiJo, Best Texas Writing 2.

story:
Order the ebook today!

You can now order the ebook on Amazon; click here to go there now.

Thanks for the support!

Praise for Haline

Haline is a mesmerizing story of a fallen world in which the characters struggle to cope with life after an environmental cataclysm. Not only is Sundeep's story told with a brisk pace and enveloping detail, it's also a call to act - to shape the future, before it shapes us. – Kabir Sehgal, Author

Incredibly engaging and a total page turner. I found myself still reading at 1am, and didn't stop. I haven't been that engaged by a book since Harry Potter or Twilight! – Lauren Weinstein (pictured)

I finished Haline in less than 24 hours - it was one of the most original and enjoyable books I've read this year. And when I say that, keep in mind that I'm only an occasional sci-fi fan, so I was initially skeptical about whether I'd enjoy it. If you like the sci-fi genre even a little bit, get this book. – Tyler Willis, Entrepreneur

For fans of "The Wind-Up Girl" and "The Handmaid's Tale" a cautionary story of a not too distant dystopian future, it serves as a hard slap across the face to wake from our collective apathy. – @thesubjective

Haline is a fantastic cautionary tale which embodies a simple but powerful idea: the sum of our individual choices can greatly affect our collective reality. I dare you to read it and not feel the urge to make a change. – Satyender Mahajan, Entrepreneur

Hi

My name is Sundeep Ahuja. I’m an entrepreneur (and former actor) who 19 months ago started the long journey of writing a novel. I’m incredibly excited to pre-launch the book on indiegogo...thanks for stopping by!

What's Haline?

Haline is a dystopian novel about a “post climate-change” future. The plot is suspenseful and fast paced (it takes place over just 4 days), and early readers tell me they weren’t able to put the book down. It’s just over 50k words, or about 210 pages at a 5x8 trim.

Like any great book (a-hem :), Haline is really about its main characters and their personal journeys: Natasha, who has something to prove; Aaren, who has something to hide; and Joaquin, who discovers something about himself that changes the course of his life – and all their lives.

The story revolves around an upcoming election in the city-state of Haline, where the charismatic President Gaven Jemmer is seeking an unprecedented third term in a resource-starved world licking its wounds after decades of war and famine following the shutdown of earth's thermohaline flow.

Why I wrote Haline

I care about our planet. And its people. But I’ve been worried that we people haven’t been taking good enough care of our planet (or each other, for that matter). Two years ago I started writing a non-fiction “update” to An Inconvenient Truth in hopes of raising awareness around climate change and corporate greed (news flash: they are related). Then one day it hit me: I should write a fiction novel about climate change and corporate greed...it’d be much more fun to read!

PRE-ORDER TODAY!

I'm pre-selling 500 special edition, numbered & autographed copies to fund:

  • ~$1000 to hire a professional editor. 

  • ~$500 to launch a basic website.

  • ~$250 to hire a cover artist. After all, most people judge books by their covers (the image above is my amateur attempt...don't judge! :).

  • ~$250 to format the book for publication.

  • ...and of course, money to fulfill the perks and market the book.

The novel is among the first of its kind in raising awareness around a possible “post climate-change future.” Pre-order the book to enjoy a good read and do a good deed :). 

FAQ

What does "free download (select days)" mean?
I intend to publish via Amazon's Kindle Select program, which allows me to give the ebook away via Amazon (no Kindle required) for "free" for a couple days. I'll email you several days in advance of the free days, and then again on the days themselves.

When can I expect to receive my perks?
My intention is to order paperbacks of the final draft by 11/30, and then ship USPS out of San Francisco by 12/13. 

How do I win a free perk by sharing on Facebook or Twitter?
I'll be watching Facebook & Twitter for people sharing this campaign with #haline; when it ends, I'll give away 10 'paperback,' 1 'stocking stuffer' and 1 'blissmo' perk.

What is the book "rated"?
Much like Hunger Games, the book is somewhere between PG and PG13 – making it the perfect holiday gift for almost everyone.

What's blissmo?
blissmo is a company I started a few years ago to introduce shoppers to healthier & safer products. Our award-winning service allows members to discover exceptional organic, non-toxic and eco-products; buy the blissmo perk, or join today and save $10 with code haline (or save $5 on gifts with hgift).

Share this campaign on Facebook or Twitter (use links up top) with #haline for a chance to win free perks.

story:
What's it all about!

My name is John Mierau. ENEMY LINES is a near-future adventure novel. It's built on mystery, danger, a touch of humor, and exciting characters you will root for... but they won't always win.


Now I want to make it available in ebook and Print. I created this IndieGoGo campaign to fund editing & cover illustration.


UPDATE: [Dec. 28,2011]

Every funder, big and small, is proving they believe in ENEMY LINES & putting their money where their mouth is. If this campaign is fully funded...


ALL funders will be included in a random draw for a Kindle Fire & all my ebooks!

(shipping extra outside USA!)


My fiction is available as ebooks for the Amazon Kindle & also as unabridged Audiobooks via iTunes, released as podcasts which have been downloaded over 400,000 times!


Like all authors, I'm worth exactly what you think I am...so I've made one of my most popular novellas, HARLAN'S WAKE, a *free* download on Smashwords, iBooks & Kindle. Please check out my work. I hope you'll want more, & help me write more by supporting this project.


I'm an Indie author. That means that in three years, I've never made an advance on a novel. I WANT YOU to by my publisher. My Patron... and a HAPPY READER.


What's ENEMY LINES about? Well now, that would be telling! In short, it's a near-future adventure about conspiracies, spies and aliens-where the lines aren't as clear as you think.  I don't want to spoil it by saying more, but if you like hints, you can check out the Book Trailer, or the transmedia campaign I put together with some of the top audiobook and podcast fiction voice around: 'ENEMY LINES: Transmissions'.


Here's where *you* come in!

I'm an independant artist. I've never had an advance, a publicity budget or an editorial staff. I do everything myself or I have to find someone who can help.


To me, IndieGoGo feels like the best way to reach out to my readers to fund what I'm creating *for* them. I don't believe I need a publisher to commission beautiful covers and pay for editng and printing costs. That just drives up the cost for you, and the profits for another company.

Please, crash-test my stories on your Kindle, iTunes & iBooks. Learn about ENEMY LINES via the video BOOK TRAILER & audio 'Transmissions'. I hope that makes you a fan and an IndieGoGo supporter.


So what do you get? You crowd-source the release of ENEMY LINES, book 1, and you get me working, creating new words for you.

Please comment on this campaign! 


...and then, PLEASE get in touch with me. I'm gonna want to thank you!

story:
What we are doing

I finally got the courage to live a dream. To travel and see as much as the world as I can with my 17 year old daughter. Although I am terrifed! I am not letting my fear stop me. I sold everything, packed and left my house, my haven, my security, my family, friends, my cat and dog. 

Now we are in Europe. We stared the 4th of July, independance day. We have been traveling for almost a month now, started in Berlin, Amsterdam and now we are in France. From here we hope to continue to Spain, Italy, Turkey and as far as we can get.

I want to travel with Zelina for 6 months. I feel this is the best education and gift that I can give her and myself. And inspire other to follow their dreams.

She is the reason I want to be a better person. I’m teaching her things I am now learning at 40. Learning together has made us both strong and good friends. I have to be an example of everything I believe. It's a priveldge to be her Mother.

We want to travel and meet people, and film and blog our journey. So far we have been couchsurfing most of our trip, which is a great experience. We have met great people and have been able to experience how people live in each country. Yes these are strangers that host us in their homes. I have hosted over 55 people in Mexico that were traveling. Please take a look at the site http://www.couchsurfing.org/profile.html?id=3XY...

I’m not worried about the destination as much as the intention and purpose. I love small towns and cities. There is still so much good and beauty in our world we don't see. I hope to share with you that beauty.

On my return I will be starting a travel clothing line, with comfortable fabric, with hidden pockets for money and passport. Clothing to wear while traveling that are functional, trending and practical.

Who is Super Chicken?

We are all full of fears, we are all chickens. I used to think that feeling fear was not a good thing. That if you had confidence the fear went away. Although that is not the case, the fear is still there.

Fear is a very uncomfortable feeling. EVERYONE feels fear, doing something out of our comfort zone. Fear with action is courage. The trick is not letting that fear paralyze you in life, feel the fear and do it anyway.
I design clothes, so I designed myself a chicken suit, a Super Chicken suit! What is a Super Chicken anyone that is scared or chicken, but is conquering that fear.
I am dragging this suit with me every where I go.  We are taking pictures to remind others that they can live their dreams. I'm still a chicken! 
 
 

Laugh and Smile!

When people see me in my chicken suit they laugh or/and smile.
There is a energy that shifts when you laugh and when you smile. You relax, and open up, it's a universal language.
There is a connection you make with others when you share a smile or a giggle.
This is a great way to have fun and getting my point across. All my life I have been concerned about my looks or about how I appeared.
There is a rigidness and shyness that I have developed. 
Well I think this is going to help me get out of my own skin. It's a freedom that I have not allowed myself, to be ridiculous and silly. I am still afraid to be ridiculous. I feel very ridiclous every time I get in this chicken suit, but I do it anyway.
My biggest desire is to inspire others to Live their dreams!, as I follow my own. Something I have always been too chicken to do, as so many are

I am grateful for everything in my life. I know I can’t do this alone. We need the support and help of others.

What We Need & What You Get

I have funded everything myself so far, I have used almost all my savings. We have spent $2,000 usd in one month in food and transportation and a bit of site seeing. This is on a tight budget in Europe I'm getting .77 cent for my us dollar. When we get back, we also have to set up a home again. We have no other income coming in.

We would love to travel another 6 months, but we need $12,000. If we do not get this we will only have enough for 2 more months, and then we will have to go back.

Since my house is packed and we have no home at the moment we would like to do all the traveling we can. Before we settle down again.

The money will give us flexiablity to meet more people and interview and film them. To do things and not to be on such a shoe string. We can take more time to work online writing and editing pictures to share with you. We would love to volunteer some place for a few weeks as well.

I am in the middle of writing a book on fear and facing it, and our journey.

If we can do this, anyone can. Everything is a sacrifice, we have given up a lot to do this. We can learn so much from each other. It's not always easy and it's often not comfortable. But when you get out of the box. you can see the circle we are in.

 Ways You Can Help

  • Please donate,
  • Laugh, share us with your friends, share our website and our campain! We post pictures and updates on Facebook daily.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Flying-The-Coop/...

  • If you know anyone that can host us in the city we are in, that would be a lot of help also. We love to visit people and share our project with them. Or if you have a place we can stay.
  • Share your story with us. Point us to interesting people or places.
  • Visit our website! www.flying-thecoop.com .
  • Enocurage us! We are alone and it's so nice to get encouraging comments. Even just kind words or a cheer are very welcome!
  • Support our mission. If you don't laugh you might be taking life to seriously and may need to relax and get in a chicken suit and dance around.
