story:
Hello!

 

My name is Thea Monyee´. I am a poet, a therapist, and a mother.  Most of you know me through Def Poetry, Verses and Flow, Da Poetry Lounge, or maybe I performed at your college.  But this is not about how we met; this is about where we are going.

 

Murmurs of a MadWoman is a collection of work inspired by several life-changing moments that occurred in my life between the years 2009 and 2011.  This collection asks the question, what happens after I break?  Imagine that an emotional bomb goes off in your life.  What happens next?  After the landmines have exploded and the landslides have wiped away everything you thought you knew?  There will be hysteria, pain, and anger. Eventually there will be consciousness and a return of your survival instinct.  There will be sacrifices that have to be made and unsung heroes that appear out of thin air.  And if all goes according to plan, there will be a resurrection.

 

For those of you who are not familiar with my work this will be a beautiful introduction and I look forward to meeting you.  For those who are familiar with my work, this project was largely motivated by the realization that I owe you something.  I owe you more than just the parts of me that I am comfortable with. I owe you my shadow and my light.  I cannot ask these things of you, be it as a friend, an audience member, a supporter, or a client, if I am not willing to give you the same in return.  So here it is, my heart on a silver platter.  Raw, bloodied, and strong. Thank you for your patience.

 

Your donations are more than money to me; they are a financial representation of your blessing to move forward with this project.  My goal is to raise $4000.00, which will cover the cost of self-publishing through an amazing company I have identified, and duplication for the first 500 copies of the book.

 

Here are the perks!

 

 $25 – Signed copy of a poem featured in Murmurs (50)

$50 – Signed copy of poem in Murmurs + In/Tuition CD (30)

$100 – Autographed copy of Murmurs + CD (20)

$250 – Autographed copy of Murmurs + CD+ Special Acknowledgement in the book! (4)

$500 – SOL Session © with Thea Monyee including book reading and discussion. Invite 4 friends! – (Via Skype if more than 2 hours away)+ Special Acknowledgement in the book + Autographed copy of Murmurs+ CD (3)

$750 – A one on one poetry writing session w/Thea Monyee – (Via Skype if more than two hours away)+ Special Acknowledgement in the book + Two Autographed copies of Murmurs+ CD (2)

$1000 – Whole Enchilada (All of the Above!!) (1)

 

All of the money will go into making this project the best it can be and everything you deserve as a contributor.  For those of you that have followed my work or supported me by purchasing In/Tuition, you know that I give 100% of myself to my work and I feel a strong sense of responsibility for what I create.  This project is another example of my dedication to creating and sustaining a place in this world where we can feel connected through our stories and our words.

 

There is one other way you can help!!

 

Share this link!

 

Facebook it! Tweet it! Talk about it! Write about it!

Help me to reach my goal by sending this to someone who has never heard of Thea Monyee´, but has struggled through the experience of a bomb blowing a hole in the middle of their life. Help me to lead them from the landmine to the resurrection with words, tears, laughter, and reflection.

 

Your support is invaluable to me.

 

All my love,

Thea Monyee

story:
Welcome fellow techo noir business thriller fans (I know you're out there)!

The Manipulator is a satirical techno noir business thriller about marketing, madness and the fast paced edge of our communications-rich society. It’s wrapped around protagonistJack Vance, a unique, dynamic anti-anti hero you will hate, love and then love/hate some more! Ever wondered how advertising agencies, TV networks and marketing campaigns really operate? Once you've read The Manipulator you'll be a cocktail party expert. 

This book is funny, fast, unique and has a story line that will leave you thirsting for sequel...or a movie. We're reaching out the the vast network of fellow thriller, satire, action, crime and (unorthodox) business book lovers!

Think Mad Men and The Hunger Games in the real world. Lundin combines all of the twists and turns of the business world via The Manipulator. A marketing thriller so close to the real world, it’s as scary as the guy who wrote it! 

-Jeffrey Hayzlett, NY Times bestselling author of The Mirror Test, and the host of  Bloomberg TV’s C-Suite

First and foremost - before I waste any of your time or money - I'd like to address the question that anyone backing anything on crowdfunding sites should be asking: who the heck are you (me) and what qualifies you (me) to do what you're asking me (you) to fund? 

I am a journalist who has written hundreds of articles for many national and regional newspapers and magazines. You can find my bylines in everything from International Wristwatch and Aviation History to the Chicago Tribune. I've covered the colliding worlds of technology, marketing, human behavior, social networks and all the high-end toys and devices that define modern life. And I have written and executed media strategies  for over 100 companies ranging from Fortune 500’s to two guys in a garage. In short, I’ve spent my career working with and writing about the kinds of people, things and businesses that have coalesced, like an acid spiked martini, into the world of The Manipulator. 

The biggest challenge facing any author - self published or "mainstream" is marketing. Getting the word out takes time (nightly), relationship building, research, more time, and a constant stream of trench digging and content generation. Believe it or not this takes money. Money to travel, hire an assistant, place ads, join groups, purchase promotional talent support. Money. 

To goose the process I have put together what I know are some terrific incentives. These include art developed specifically for the book by underground cartoonist legends Jay Lynch and Skip Williamson and cartoonist and illustrator Mitch O'Connell. Then of course there's the pub crawl. I'll leave it at that for now - details are below. 

The Story: Truth is overrated!

The Manipulator is a big intercontinental story, sprawling from newsrooms to boardrooms to bedrooms.

It’s 2018 and master media manipulator Jack Vance has just received a virtually unlimited marketing budget to launch the world’s first 24/7 all mobile un-television network. Vance’s solution to grabbing the nation’s attention against an impossible six week window rests on the development of Some Will Die, an intense reality show that guarantees the televised deaths of its morbidly obese contestants.

The scheme seems like a slam dunk unless Vance’s numerous vices and enemies curtail his bullet train into the annals of marketing history. Jump on board for a thrill ride through the furious over-the-top world of nouveau funded businessmen, trailer park con artists, bust out television stars, desperate news people, “made” men and slippery foreign government agents. And those are just the likeable characters.

The Manipulator is written from the perspective of a journalist telling a story for an audience with a ten second attention span. The fast paced action follows our protagonist's Lear Jet powered intercontinental adventures with superb Fleming-esque details. Readers will know what it feels like to be a turbocharged executive with the toys of the world at your disposal and the guts to put them to use. I guarantee a pulp-like cliff hanger ending with every chapter and enough snappy dialogue and mad characters to keep you flipping pages well into the night.  Fans of Elmore Leonard and Carl Hiaasen rejoice!


Our protagonist is a mixture of P.T. Barnum, David Ogilvy and Hunter S. Thompson, a man as cunningly diabolical as he is self-destructive. Vance is utterly honest with himself and his place in the world. He likes his drugs, his drink and has nothing to justify except results. He is not bound by conventional mores or ethics and lives by the mantra: “truth is overrated.” 

Meet Jack Vance now! He tweets under the handle BlowfishPR and will respond to all tweets - follow him and he will follow back. All book updates can be found on The Manipulator Facebook page.

Lundin shines a bright light on the crazy inside world of communications agencies and the media. If you’re a fan of the cutting satire of Terry Southern and the sharp tongue ofElmore Leonard, you’ll love this page turning business thriller.

-Jack O’Dwyer: Award winning publisher of O'Dwyer’s Magazine, one of the longest running publications in the marketing community

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There's more to life than money!!!

    Help me get the word out - are you a marketer? Please use the Indiegogo share tools to market this to your peeps. In broadcast, news production, a thriller lover, crime lover, satire lover - or maybe you saw Dr. Strangelove once and really, really liked it. That's all we need to go!  You will find something - or a lot of somethings to love in this book. So tell your like minded friends.

    Meet the art from the book!

    Jay Lynch (Playboy, Nard N Pat) 

    Mitch O'Connell (Newsweek, Marvel, the universe)


    Skip Williamson (Playboy, Snappy Sammy Snoot)

Vance’s solution to grabbing the nation’s attention against an impossible six week window rests on the development of Some Will Die, an intense reality show that guarantees the televised deaths of its morbidly obese contestants.The scheme seems like a slam dunk unless Vance’s numerous vices and enemies curtail his bullet train into the annals of marketing history. Jump on board for a thrill ride through the furious over-the-top world of nouveau funded businessmen, trailer park con artists, bust out television stars, desperate news people, “made” men and slippery foreign government agents. And those are just the likeable characters.The Manipulator is written from the perspective of a journalist telling a story for an audience with a ten second attention span. The fast paced action follows our protagonist's Lear Jet powered intercontinental adventures with superb Fleming-esque details. Readers will know what it feels like to be a turbocharged executive with the toys of the world at your disposal and the guts to put them to use. I guarantee a pulp-like cliff hanger ending with every chapter and enough snappy dialogue and mad characters to keep you flipping pages well into the night.  Fans of Elmore Leonard and Carl Hiaasen rejoice!  Our protagonist is a mixture of P.T. Barnum, David Ogilvy and Hunter S. Thompson, a man as cunningly diabolical as he is self-destructive. Vance is utterly honest with himself and his place in the world. He likes his drugs, his drink and has nothing to justify except results. He is not bound by conventional mores or ethics and lives by the mantra: “truth is overrated.” Meet Jack Vance now! He tweets under the handle BlowfishPR and will respond to all tweets - follow him and he will follow back. All book updates can be found on The Manipulator Facebook page.Lundin shines a bright light on the crazy inside world of communications agencies and the media. If you’re a fan of the cutting satire of Terry Southern and the sharp tongue ofElmore Leonard, you’ll love this page turning business thriller.-Jack O’Dwyer: Award winning publisher of O'Dwyer’s Magazine, one of the longest running publications in the marketing community  Other Ways You Can HelpThere's more to life than money!!!Help me get the word out - are you a marketer? Please use the Indiegogo share tools to market this to your peeps. In broadcast, news production, a thriller lover, crime lover, satire lover - or maybe you saw Dr. Strangelove once and really, really liked it. That's all we need to go!  You will find something - or a lot of somethings to love in this book. So tell your like minded friends.Meet the art from the book!Jay Lynch (Playboy, Nard N Pat) Mitch O'Connell (Newsweek, Marvel, the universe)Skip Williamson (Playboy, Snappy Sammy Snoot)

story:
Short Story

Isa spends many of her days with her great-grandmother. One day she gazed up into a climbing tree, sighed and said, "I wish you were a little girl too, Mima." which made Mima promptly climb the tree. When Mima was small a very long time ago she was called Bubl and looked exactly like Isa. They have so many adventures together that I want to capture their doings in an illustrated children's book. I have written, illustrated, and produced four Smart Cookie books that have not been formally published.

story:
Every year thousands of people come to visit the famous wild Chincoteague ponies that live in the Chincoteague National Wildlife Refuge on Assateague Island. They are often surprised to find out that the ponies have names and want to know how they can learn them.

In 2014 I developed a smart phone app called Chincoteague Pony Names for identifying ponies by their field markings. Over the years it's come to my attention that not everyone has a smart phone or feels comfortable using apps. I've decided to use the data collected in my app to publish a book for those people and anyone who likes books. It will be a 5 x 8 full-color 290 page hardcover book. The retail price will be $25.

Book publishing is a costly business. I would greatly appreciate your help in funding the publishing and printing startup costs needed to bring this book to market. To show my appreciation I'll be offering prints of photographs I've taken of the ponies. There will be a huge selection of photos to choose from.  Photos are cropped for 8x10 or 12x18/20x30. While many are available in both sizes, not all of them are. Some are only 8x10 and some are only 12x18/20x30. Other perks will include copies of the book, in printed or digital PDF forms.

Photos can be previewed at http://ginasfamilystore.com/campaign/campaign_8... and
http://ginasfamilystore.com/campaign/campaign_2...

I’d also like to ask a special favor. Would you also assist me by telling others about my campaign, by sharing my campaign link on social media.  Thank you so much for your effort and involvement.  I am deeply grateful for whatever support you can give.

story:
(Extrait gratuit disponible ICI)

[ENGLISH BELLOW]

« Il y a un temps pour vivre et un temps pour témoigner de vivre. » (Albert Camus, Noces)

La défaite du peuple, le peuple défait. Mouvements. Fragmentations. Éclats urbains. Chansons gaies, chansons tristes. Poings levés, contre-poings. Débordements. Corps brisés. Mains menottés. Violentes valses et débris du temps, etc., etc. Seuls les témoignages resteront : seuls, ils survivront à l’Histoire.

C’est à Tunis, du 24 au 28 mars 2015, que se tiendra la prochaine édition du Forum social mondial (FSM), l’un des plus grands rassemblements citoyens. TUNIS, MARS 2015 est un projet de documentation combinant l'image, le son et l'écrit. Il vise à offrir un(des) témoignage(s) personnel(s) de cet événement et de ses contours.

Inspiré par le livre-fleuve Constellations du Collectif Mauvaise troupe, TUNIS, MARS 2015 se veut être une quête de sens et une mise en abyme des luttes populaires contemporaines. « Comment naissent-elles ? », « À quoi servent-elles ? », « Qui en sont les protagonistes ? », « À quoi aspirent-ils/elles ? », « Que craignent-ils/elles ? » sont quelques unes des questions qui seront explorées et qui, espérons-le, trouveront réponses lors de ce Forum.

Le projet se terminera avec la publication d’un livre disponible en deux formats (électronique et papier) disponible sur un site web. N'hésitez-pas à vous inscrire sur la liste de diffusion du projet afin de suivre sa progression. 

À QUOI SERVENT VOS CONTRIBUTIONS

Les contributions serviront principalement à couvrir les frais suivants : 

  • Déplacements (billet d'avion et déplacements à Tunis) : jusqu'à hauteur de 40 % du montant total amassé. 
  • Impression des exemplaires du livre Tunis, mars 2015  : jusqu'à hauteur de 40 % du montant total amassé.
  • Promotion du projet (site web et lancement) : jusqu'à hauteur de 20 % du montant total amassé. 

À PROPOS DE L'ORGANISATEUR

Rémy-Paulin Twahirwa est candidat à la maitrise en science politique à l’Université du Québec à Montréal ( QC, Canada). Il est membre du Collectif de la société civile québécoise qui participe au FSM 2015. Vous pouvez le suivre sur Twitter et Tumblr. Pour toutes questions ou commentaires, vous pouvez le contacter par courriel. 

---ENGLISH---

« Il y a un temps pour vivre et un temps pour témoigner de vivre. » (Albert Camus, Noces)


The people are defeated, the people defeat. Movements. Fragmentation. Urban glow. Happy songs, sad songs. Fists brandished, counter punches. Attacks. Broken bodies. Handcuffs. Violent waltzes and the fragments of time, etc., etc. Only testimonies will remain, only they will survive.


The next World Social Forum (WSF) is taking place between March 24th-28th, 2015 in Tunis. It is one of the largest gatherings of global citizens. Tunis, March 2105 is a documentary project that will combined images, sounds and written words. It aims to provide a personal account of this conference.


Inspired by the livre-fleuve Constellations written by the Collectif Mauvaise, Tunis, March 2015 will be an exploration of the senses and a hall of mirrors reflecting contemporary popular struggles. This project will ask a range of questions at the WSF: “How do the popular struggles emerge?” “What purpose do they serve?”, “Who are the protagonists?”, “What are they aspiring to?”, and “What are there concerns?”.


This project will conclude with the publication of a book in two formats (electronic and hard copy) that will be available online. Please sign up on for the mailing list to follow its progress.


HOW DONATION WILL BE SPENT

The donations will be used primarily to cover the following costs:

-Travel (plane ticket and travel in Tunis): up to 60% of the total money raised by this project-Printing copies of the book Tunis, March 2015 : up to 20% of the total money raised by this project

-Promotion (website and launch): up to 20% of the total money raised by this project


ABOUT THE ORGANIZER

Rémy-Paulin Twahirwa is Master’s student at the Université du Québec à Montréal (QC, Canada) studying Political Science. He is a member of the Collectif de la société civile québécoise, a group that is participating in the World Social Forum. You can follow him on Twitter or Tumblr. For all other questions, you can contact him by email.

BOOK 38 Horror Anthology

38 Authors Tell Stories of 38 Haunted & Abandoned Places

The Book 38 Horror Anthology is a massive undertaking. The premise is that 38 Authors will write one story each about a requested location of the 38 most haunted and abandoned places on earth. 


Just a quick note on Contributor Mentions in the Perks Section
to your right>>>>>>>

Contributor Mentions are like movie credits.  To make this as easy as possible, I am going to have mentions Backer Mentions come in the following sizes, S, M, L, XL.  Large and Extra-Large include a one sentence shout-out. So would have your name and possibly, "I love Nelson W. Pyles." or "This one's for you Mom!"

SUPPORT YOUR INDIE HORROR WRITER! Be a Backer!

ALL THE MONEY GOES TO AUTHORS/EDITORS!

All the money we raise will go to the Authors and Editors of this book, equally. That means, they all get their very own printed copy and a payment! How rad is that. Hell, we might be able to get them coffee cups... if we get lots of donations! *winks!

The artwork will be given on the house by Maddie H. Von Stark! Not only that, if you are the top contributor to the campaign, she will take you out to lunch. As long as you don’t live in Siberia. Well, hell, that might be kind of cool as well.

Regardless of the success of this Indiegogo campaign, Book 38 Horror Anthology will be released in trade paperback and eBook format on May 1st, 2015. 

So, then why are we asking for money? We want to move this project beyond the "normal" small press anthology. The majority of funds from this campaign will be funneled back to the authors included in the project. If we go beyond our goal, that just means our Authors and Editors get paid more! And who doesn’t want to help out a Indie Horror Author?

story:
¿Qué?

Noir Francine es una novela capaz de estremecerte ante cada nueva página, cada nuevo giro, que te va sumergiendo en las cloacas de la naturaleza humana.

Paquita, una ama de casa condenada a una vida de soledad y hastío, el indeseable borracho de su marido Simón y un extraño personaje, un trotamundos sin nada que perder y con miles de kilómetros consumidos bajo la suela de sus botas. Tres individuos con poco o nada en común que verán cómo sus vidas quedan unidas por un golpe del destino. Un accidente de tráfico, delante de la huerta en la que malviven  Paquita y Simón, hará saltar su tranquila vida por los aires.

El inesperado hallazgo que vendrá de la mano del siniestro, despertará el instinto de cada uno de ellos. Sus movimientos solo podrán situarlos en un lado u otro en la historia. Cazador o presa.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a José Antonio García Santos.

Aunque formado en el terreno de la economía, lleva varios años ligado a la literatura, terreno en el que ha ido cosechando algún que otro éxito con el paso del tiempo. Su género podría calificarse de fronterizo, por encontrarse a caballo entre la novela negra y de terror.

En 2.012 resultó ganador de la sección de relatos del Fanter Film Festival (www.abandomoviez.com), certamen del que fue segundo clasificado en las ediciones de 2.014 y 2.015. También en 2.012, fue elegido finalista en el III Certamen de Relatos de Terror de la Editorial Círculo Rojo, por lo que su relato «Segunda Oportunidad», apareció publicado en la antología Pasos en la Oscuridad (Círculo Rojo, 2.012).

Gracias a estos y otros certámenes, ha colaborado en las colecciones de relatos Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 2 (Ed. Círculo Rojo, 2.012) e Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 3 (Bubok, 2.014). Así mismo, ha participado en las antologías El Idioma del Miedo, (Amazon, 2014) y Fuga de Muerte, antología de relatos sobre el mal (www.leyendohastaelamanecer.com, 2.015). Es autor, además, de la colección de cuentos Retales (Seleer, 2.012)

En 2.016, resultó ganador de la IV Edición del Certamen de Novela Corta de Terror Ciudad de Utrera. Como resultado del mismo, salió publicada su primera novela, Travesía (Premium Editorial, 2.016), nominada a los Premios Ignotus este mismo año. Cabe destacar que en la edición anterior, ya había resultado finalista con La boca del lobo, novela inédita en la actualidad.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Noir Francine que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Antonio García Santos vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Un accidente de tráfico, delante de la huerta en la que malviven  Paquita y Simón, hará saltar su tranquila vida por los aires.
El inesperado hallazgo que vendrá de la mano del siniestro, despertará el instinto de cada uno de ellos. Sus movimientos solo podrán situarlos en un lado u otro en la historia. Cazador o presa.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a José Antonio García Santos.
Aunque formado en el terreno de la economía, lleva varios años ligado a la literatura, terreno en el que ha ido cosechando algún que otro éxito con el paso del tiempo. Su género podría calificarse de fronterizo, por encontrarse a caballo entre la novela negra y de terror.
En 2.012 resultó ganador de la sección de relatos del Fanter Film Festival (www.abandomoviez.com), certamen del que fue segundo clasificado en las ediciones de 2.014 y 2.015. También en 2.012, fue elegido finalista en el III Certamen de Relatos de Terror de la Editorial Círculo Rojo, por lo que su relato «Segunda Oportunidad», apareció publicado en la antología Pasos en la Oscuridad (Círculo Rojo, 2.012).
Gracias a estos y otros certámenes, ha colaborado en las colecciones de relatos Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 2 (Ed. Círculo Rojo, 2.012) e Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 3 (Bubok, 2.014). Así mismo, ha participado en las antologías El Idioma del Miedo, (Amazon, 2014) y Fuga de Muerte, antología de relatos sobre el mal (www.leyendohastaelamanecer.com, 2.015). Es autor, además, de la colección de cuentos Retales (Seleer, 2.012)
En 2.016, resultó ganador de la IV Edición del Certamen de Novela Corta de Terror Ciudad de Utrera. Como resultado del mismo, salió publicada su primera novela, Travesía (Premium Editorial, 2.016), nominada a los Premios Ignotus este mismo año. Cabe destacar que en la edición anterior, ya había resultado finalista con La boca del lobo, novela inédita en la actualidad.
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Noir Francine que saldría después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Antonio García Santos vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
A New Experience

This anniversary rerelease of Pomegranate includes the following brand new features:

  • Eight full color, full page illustrations by local superstar artist Dani Liddle.
  • Full color interior and text, allowing themes originally intended in several poems to finally shine through.
  • Hardcover book with new wraparound dust jacket, featuring new art by Dani Liddle.
  • A new introduction, "Pomegranate Revisited," by novelist Andrew Kahler.
  • A brief collection of recently discovered poems, best described as the Pomegranate b-sides, collectively published herein as The Zheng He Sessions. These poems will never be published anywhere else.
  • An interview with artist Dani Liddle, and a brief gallery of her work. 
  • Only a limited run of 54 copies will ever be made. Each copy will be hand-numbered and signed by myself and Dani Liddle.

 

The Comprehensive Experience

This isn't just for fans of the book's first release. If you've never read Pomegranate before, this is the best way to do so: this is Pomegranate as it was always meant to be experienced. 

  • The addition of red lettering throughout several of the poems transforms the thematic lens of the work as a whole.
  • The Zheng He Sessions are made up of poems that would undoubtedly have been collected in the original release.
  • Dani Liddle's illustrations elevate the poems beyond what I could have ever imagined possible. The book is worth it for her illustrations alone.

 

Exclusive Content

As mentioned above, this is going to be a highly limited run. Dani's illustrations, Andrew's introduction, and The Zheng He Sessions will only ever be published in this version of the book. You might want to hop on this preorder train just in case any of us ever make it big. Just saying. 

 

Behind the Scenes Access

The book has only a few hurdles to get through yet: the finalization of its cover and the somewhat arduous proofing journey. If you contribute to the preorder, you'll receive updates to follow along with the self-publishing experience, as well as some fun sneak peaks into the artwork, poetry, and more.

story:
Short Summary

FlowerSong Press nurtures essential verse from, about, and through the borderlands. The voices of those from Latin America,the U.S,A. and all over the world. We are Literary, Lyrical, Latino, and we welcome allies that understand and join in the voice of people of color and our struggle, truth, and hope.

We will publish novice, emerging, and established writers of short stories and poetry. We are open to submissions all year long and will make it a goal to have a rapid response to every submission. 

We will continue to work with the City of McAllen and the Poet Laureate Anthology Series to publish the voices of the Rio Grande Valley Youth of south Texas. In 2020, we will be publishing Volume 3 in the series: “Still I Rise”

The money will help pay to create beautiful books by hiring artists that specialize in creating cover art and more...

Your Contribution Will Help These Titles Come To Fruition

FlowerSong Press: Forthcoming Titles/Authors

Rebozo of Love / We Have Woven /  Sudor de Pueblos / On Our Back,
by Juan Felipe Herrera

 

[Elegies], by Roberto Carlos Garcia

Vessels, by Michelle Otero

Reverberating Voices, by Ernesto Garay

This Is Our Summons Now: Poems, by R. Joseph Rodríguez

Edgecliff, by Angelina Sáenz

Huelga, by Jessica Ayala

When There Were No borders, by Raúl Sánchez

Early Works: ani'mal, INDiGENA, and furia, by ire'ne lara silva

women, depose, by Kristine Esser Slentz

A WOMYN’S PLACE UNCONVENTIONAL TALES OF HERSTORY, by Sarah García

La La Landia: A Journey Through my Frontera CD Shuffle, by Priscilla Celina Suárez

Drama in Plague Time- An Anthology, edited by Robert Moreira & Philip Zwerling

Good Cop/Bad Cop Anthology, edited by Edward Vidaurre & Vincent Cooper

About Face: Poems About Body Image, edited by René Saldaña, Jr. ( ¡JUVENTUD!, the children’s and young adult imprint of FlowerSong Press)

FlowerSong Press takes submissions all year long. We have a quick response rate.

We are currently reading poetry for 2021, prose, short stories, and novels for Winter 2021 and beyond

What We Need & What You Get

We had an aggressive 2019 & 2020 and don't plan on slowing down. We have our 2021 line-up set and are already looking into 2022 and beyond. Because the money to create all these come from just one source and income it sometimes slows the process. With your help we can continue with this important work and hire some help.

The Impact

The impact can be huge. FlowerSong Press have spread across the nation and internationally, publishing stories and poetry of border poets across the world.  

Risks & Challenges

With COVID-19 we've been having to reinvent the way we distribute and market our books. Through past ZOOM and future readings we hope to reach as many people and lovers of literature as we can. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the news about our campaign. Visit our page www.flowersongpress.com and buy a book from one of our published authors.

story:
Campaign Overview

Origins is a collection of stories, thoughts, and feelings about my racial and gender identity. I wrote it because I want others who have faced the same troubles and experiences to feel less alone, and to feel understood. My book will publish in February, 2020.

 

Story of My Book

Origins is about my experiences as an Asian woman in America in the past 8 years that I have lived here. Through short stories, essays, and poems, I share my own, and others', experiences with racial and gender-based prejudice in the United States. Some topics that I write about are different forms of racism, Asian under-representation, gender stereotypes, and sexual misconduct.

My name is Thy Nguyen and I am the author of Origins. I wrote this book because I want others who have faced the same troubles and experiences to feel less alone, and to feel understood. I also want to provide those who cannot relate a better understanding of the challenges that minorities and immigrants face in the U.S, and the tribulations of toxic gender norms and sexual violence.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the different forms of prejudice, and also gain a better understanding of the personal emotions of victims involved. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for race and gender in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be more empathetic towards victims of discrimination and violence.

In this book, you'll learn about people's personal feelings when they face such struggles. We hear a lot on the news about victims, but how do they actually feel? What are they thinking? Here are some of the stories that you will read about:
  • Asian-American underrepresentation in the media and Hollywood; dig deeper into the racial dynamics of some of your favorite movies and shows including Sixteen Candles and The Big Bang Theory.
  • A news article was published by ESPN, titled “A Chink In The Armor,” in reference to basketball player Jeremy Lin. See the problem with that?
  • Katy Perry allegedly sexually harassed Josh Kloss, and Kloss actually receiving death threats for speaking out against her. Gender norms and stereotypes are toxic, and victims of sexual misconduct sometimes do not get the appropriate support that they need.
You will love this book if you are passionate about, or are interested in racial representation and discrimination, and toxicity of gender roles and if you are an advocate against sexual violence.
Origins is a non-fiction book that speaks to marginalized groups, and hopefully anyone, who is looking at issues of race and gender in the United States.

 

The Book - Origins

The book is written in 3 Parts....
  • Part 1 contains the reason I am writing this book and my initial journey as an immigrant to the United States. I was a 12 year old kid living in Vietnam, and my mom suddenly told me that we were going to move to ~America~.
  • Part 2 contains chapters on racial discrimination — personal stories, secondhand stories, and news. On top of that, I also have fun and confusing experiences I have had as an immigrant to the U.S.
  • Part 3 contains chapters on gender norms, stereotypes, and sexual misconduct and violence. This chapter examines the effects of gender roles and stereotypes on media, advertising, mental health, and more. There will be several anecdotes from myself, and from friends on gender roles and sexual misconduct.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this coming Spring.
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Thy Nguyen is a junior at Babson College, concentrating in Entrepreneurship. She enjoys the arts and is passionate about social change for marginalized groups; she believes that Babson College is the best place to bridge her passions and pursue her goal of social impact.

Thy wrote this book because she reached a boiling point in experiencing racial and gender-based microaggressions. She believes that her story is worth sharing with everyone — sharing the pain, the joy, and the excitement. She wants to create a vehicle for others who feel the same as her to feel included, understood, and advocated for.

In Thy’s free time, she enjoys playing the ukulele, photography, bonding with her loved ones, researching interesting topics, and last but not least, watching her favorite T.V. shows. She is passionate about human connection and the arts.

For more information you can connect with Thy at tnguyen2@babson.edu and https://www.linkedin.com/in/dthynguyen/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thynguyenorigins and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again, 
Thy Nguyen

story:
¿Qué?

Me quedo contigo es la crónica de una relación condenada de antemano, inequívocamente avanzando hacia el desastre... aunque la duda es cuál de las relaciones es esta.

Mara trabaja de camarera en un garito madrileño para poder pagarse el conservatorio y su minúscula buhardilla luminosa, donde se evade del mundo tocando la guitarra para Rai. Porque Mara y Rai tienen un pacto. Ella le da lo que Bárbara, su novia, no puede darle, sexo. Y lo que parece una aventura sin compromiso, se vuelve una relación indescifrable que ninguno es capaz de romper. No querían, pero era inevitable; vuelven el uno al otro a pesar de que son conscientes de que su historia de infidelidad tiene fecha de caducidad. Pero mientras tanto, se besan, se acuestan, se divierten, se gritan, se cantan, se enfadan y se buscan. Ella quiere más y él se lo da sin darse cuenta, pero no es capaz de abandonar a Barbi, como él la llama, por la delicada situación que atraviesa. Así que Mara le da celos con el nuevo dj del bar, Ben, un rubiales de muy buen ver con el que consigue progresar en el mundo de la música, que no en la cama.

¿Y si «la otra» es la buena? ¿Y si «la otra» es la primera? Ellos están haciendo daño a otras personas sabiendo que lo hacen, pero sin poder evitarlo; y al final todo sale y les salpica en plena cara. Deberán ser valientes y afrontar las consecuencias de sus actos, aunque el corazón siempre les acerque. Porque los infieles también tienen su bonita historia de amor, a su manera. ¿Quién se quedará con quién?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Isabel Simal.

Nacida el 17 de Septiembre de 1985 en Toledo, es Licenciada en Periodismo y Graduada en Turismo por la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de Madrid. Ha sido redactora en la sección deportiva del departamento de radio de la Agencia Efe y, dentro del sector hotelero, ha colaborado en las diversas secciones que lo componen como recepción, administración, reservas y pisos en Madrid, Alicante, Girona, Málaga y Bizkaia. Recientemente, ha trabajado como dependienta en una tienda de moda y, actualmente, dedica su tiempo libre a hacer deporte, leer novelas e intentar escribirlas. Ha recibido numerosos reconocimientos por sus creaciones literarias, destacando el segundo premio en el II Certamen de Relato Breve Navidad Solidaria convocado por la Biblioteca de Castilla La-Mancha con su obra Aquellas circunstancias. Se define como un intento de muchas cosas y mientras trata de descubrir cuál es su aportación al mundo, está ocupada viajando. Sin ir más lejos, ahora mismo está escribiendo estas líneas rodeada de agua cristalina en la isla de Mallorca.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«―Llegas tarde, Rai ―le digo en cuanto abro la puerta.
          ―He venido, ¿no?
          ―Sí, has venido tarde ―me cruzo de brazos.
          ―¿Quieres que me vaya?
          ―La pregunta es si querías venir tú.
          ―Mira, estoy harto de esta mierda ―se frota la frente―. Vamos a hacerlo y punto.
          ―¿Y punto? ¿Punto y seguido? ¿Punto y aparte? ¿Punto y final? ―zarandeo los brazos cabreada por sus dudas.
          ―No lo sé, Mara, no lo sé.
          ―Mira, tenemos tres opciones. ―Enumero con los dedos―. Una. Te vas y se acabó. Dos. Follamos, te vas y se acabó. Tres. Follamos y hasta la semana que viene, como hemos hecho este puto año. Por una cuestión de estadística, creo que vamos a follar, pero tú verás qué hacemos después.
          ―A ti no te espera nadie, pero a mí… Ella es mi mundo.
          ―Claro, pero un mundo sin sexo no es un mundo perfecto. Por eso estamos aquí.
          ―Estoy aquí. Elijo la tercera opción ―se rinde.
          ―Buena elección. ―Abro del todo la puerta y le permito entrar.
          Acaba y se va, como siempre. Bueno como siempre no, ya no era solo sexo. Me quedo pensando en cómo empezó todo, cuando llaman al timbre. El corazón se me acelera. Abro y ahí está, él, apoyado en el marco de la puerta, ¿arrepentido?».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Isabel Simal vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Dear Friends and Amazing Readers!

Some of you may know me as a musician, but this time I am embarking on a new adventure as an author. I worked very hard on this collection of my writings and am very excited to visit your city to read and sign my new book, Don't Lose Track Vol. 1: 40 Selected Articles, Essays and Q&As! Please support this tour! It's been a blessing and I do all of this to serve and entertain my community!

.jordannah

Order Jordannah's New Book Here!

Baltimore & San Francisco based author, journalist, model, radio personality and feministand civil rights commentator, Jordannah Elizabeth will be embarking on the first leg of her book tour for her anticipated debut book, Don't Lose Track Vol. 1: 40 Selected Articles, Essays and Q&As due out January 29, 2016 via Zero Books!

Don't Lose Track named Independent Publisher Book Awards' Indie Groundbreaking Book of January:

"A great writer is more than what they have in common with you: a great writer is like a good friend, someone whose voice means something to you and whose opinions and viewpoints you can respect—even when you don't agree with them.

After delving into Don't Lose Track Vol. 1, an anthology from culture writer Jordannah Elizabeth, I think that she might just be one of those writers." - Craig Manning, Independent Publisher

Official Tour Dates for Don't Lose Track Vol. 1

Feb 8th: New York, NY - Bluestockings Bookstore
Feb 11th: Baltimore, MD - Red Emma´s Bookstore
Feb 16th: Seattle, WA - Left Bank Books Collective

Feb 17th: Portland, OR - In Other Words
Feb 19th: San Francisco, CA - Amnesia
Feb 20th: Los Angeles, CA - Private Event/Book Reading

Just added: 

February 27th: Pittsburgh, PA - Straybook TV

March 17th: Baltimore, MD - Maryland Dept. of Labor's Brown Bag Lecture Series

Here's an except of the book:

"Jordannah, herself an accomplished composer and singer of haunting songs, writes primarily about culture in general and music in particular. This is fitting, because she writes with beats and rhythms and a cadence that sweep the reader along like a really good song. Her music reviews, interviews and essays about life as we know it are as eclectic as her own artistic tastes, the result of a questing mind unencumbered by boundaries. It’s impossible not to both admire her work, and also genuinely like the person who wrote this stuff. The sheer breadth of her music reviews is dazzling; country, punk, hip-hop, psychedelic and pure pop are dealt with deftly, and Jordannah has an uncanny knack for drilling down into what seems like a perfectly logical analysis of the psyche of a particular artist."- An excerpt from Pulitzer Prize Winner, Mark Fritz' Foreword for Don't Lose Track

The book features reviews, essays and interviews featuring:

Saul Williams

Talib Kweli

J. Mascis

Shabazz Palaces

Alice Coltrane

Christopher Owens

Spiritualized

and more 

Special Thanks to Mark Fritz, Zero Books, the entire staff of Bitch Magazine, Sub Pop Records, SF WEEKLY, New York Amsterdam News, MTV and all the editors, publicists, publications and artists who helped make this book happen! -je

story:
Join Me on a Literacy Journey

My name is Debbie Glade. I am a journalist, small press publisher (Smart Poodle Publishing) and the author and illustrator of the award winning children's book, The Travel Adventures of Lilly P. Badilly: Costa Rica.  The book is about a plucky millipede girl who loves to read and play piano. She lives in the Miami Airport with her grandparents. One day they sneak aboard a plane and fly to Costa Rica for a really fun adventure. Lilly uses her brain and her music to save her and her family and friends from a millipede-chomping spider. Each book comes with a fully narrated CD, complete with voice overs, sound effects from the real Costa Rican rain forest and an original musical score with songs performed by me and my family. The story is both funny and educational, and the CD allows kids too young to read or those struggling to read to listen along with the book.

Why I'm Creating this Campaign

I visit schools, camps, libaries and charities in South Florida along with my reading, writing and geography programs. My passion is spreading the love of reading and teaching kids about geography, a subject greatly lacking in our schools. Many of the students I visit are in districts with some of the country's highest drop-out rates. What I find is that the children from the lowest income famies, who could most benefit from my book, simply cannot afford to buy the book. The high quality 64-page book/CD retails for $19.95, yet I deeply discount the book during all author visits - up to more than 50%. Even with the discount, many students' parents cannot afford to buy books. I give as much as I can, but I'd like to give many more books away to those who really need them.

Campaign Goals

My goals are straight forward. I'd like to raise $18,500, which is enough money to cover the production costs for 3,000 high quality, hard-cover, 64-page, full-color books with a CD. I will give every book away to needy elementary age students.

Where the Donations Go

Any and all funds raised, whether or not we meet, or even surpass our goals, will go toward providing free books to children who could most benefit from them. If we exceed our fundraising goals, we can always print more books.

About the Smart Poodle

Darwin is my gigantic and smart 3 yo standard poodle who seems to draw a lot of attention due to his size (5 ft. 3" from the bottom of his back foot to the top of his head) and cuteness. He's gentle and loyal and so smart that he has been known to push my cell phone with his nose closer to me so I can text the owner of his best canine friend, Joey, and let her know we're ready to go for a walk.

Perks

We are offering you a wide selection of donation levels and unique perks to match. Get your name put into books as the donator. Get a personalized autographed copy of the book/CD. Receive a phone call from Lilly Badilly. Or even choose the school or charity where you'd like the books to be donated. These are just some of the many perks we are offering. Please note that the delivery of perks is estimated in June, however author visits where books will be donated may take place any time from June through December, 2013.

The Impact

I often hear from teachers, librarians and parents that a reluctant reader really enjoyed my book, especially because that reader could listen to the entertaining and sometimes hilarious CD. I recently got an email from the dad of a 4-year old girl. He told me his daughter checked my book out of the public library 5 times because she loves the CD! This is big news, because a person's reading comprehension level is the greatest indicator of his or her financial success as an adult. There's no substitute for holding a real book in your hands, turning the pages, looking at the illustrations and wanting to learn. Your donation can make a huge difference in the life of a child; the gift of reading is one of the greatest gifts anyone can give.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are in a position to help out financially, please help spread the word about our cause. You can feel confident that it is a 100% positive, wholesome, feel good venture. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get started.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support!

story:
“The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself.”
― Albert Camus

 

Who We Are

Hello. We have been running a poetry publishing site for over a year now, and want to take our ideas to the next level. We want to turn our endeavours into a full-blown publishing house, not just poetry but literature also.

The world of publishing is changing rapidly, with the advent of self-publishing, and the increasing remoteness of the big publishing houses who are sticking with the safe titles. We feel that the time is ripe for dynamic, indie publishers to step up and help bring out the next generaton of writers.

We believe that the world always needs literature, to take away the dull and dim veneer that covers our lives. And we believe that we can bring the best new poetry and literature into the world with our endeavours.

And to make this possible, we need your help.

 

What your money will do

What will the money be going toward? Well, it will make it possible for us to achieve this goal. We need money for:

Marketing and advertising costs

Website Design

Costs of print runs

Advances for authors

ISBN purchases

Distribution of our publications.

Poetry events in the UK

And much more.

What you can do to help

Firstly, please consider helping to fund this campaign with whatever you can spare. We have a few incentives for you, so you get something back. And even if you cannot spare anything to help us, then the share button is just a click away. That way we can reach even more people, and increase the chances of making this a success.

Get involved. Be part of our future success.

Thank you for your time.

Firstly, please consider helping to fund this campaign with whatever you can spare. We have a few incentives for you, so you get something back. And even if you cannot spare anything to help us, then the share button is just a click away. That way we can reach even more people, and increase the chances of making this a success.
Get involved. Be part of our future success.
Thank you for your time.

story:
What it is, People

 

Everybody Wants to Rule(r) the World 

(or die trying)

Our goal is to create the 2nd illustrated Professor Blue book, part of a series, for kids aged 5-11, and use that to springboard into a TV pilot. 

We believe you can never have too much of a good thing.  A new children’s TV program, pre-teen, involving actors that’s filled with smart humor, a good plot and is educational is exactly what the nerds have been waiting for!  I mean, how many shows about policemen and lawyers do kids really need?? ;)

We add on board another collaborator, Mihai Dinelscu, to help us with a professional crew to film and edit the pilot.  

What is this Mihai person?  And, more importantly, what does he want with us?

  • Mihai served as Producer for the indie movie hit “Guy and Madeline on a Park Bench.”  
  • Guy and Madeline was recognized as one of the "30 best films of 2010" by The New York Times and one of the "Top Ten Movies of 2010" by The Village Voice, Film Comment, and Time Out New York.
  • Mihai is also a founding member of the CEMI Electronic Media Institute, an educational organization devoted to technological creativity.

 

Who is Professor Blue?

Professor Blue started as a microbe of an idea by Maria Laskar, an independent artist and theatre Director from the National Theatre School in Montreal. 

 Looking for new subject matter, Maria listened to the real scientists sounding alarm bells about the environment, and the state of science awareness (or lack thereof), and decided to create a character, Professor Blue, to explain basic science facts to children and the general public. 

Not just mired in the theatre, Maria also graduated from McGill University as an early childhood educator.  She knows how to speak to children using humor, education, and the arts, and so decided to incorporate all of these elements with Professor Blue to appeal to kids about science and the environment.

Maria secured funding and support from the likes of MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), the CALQ (Conseil des arts et des lettres du Québec), large corporations and smaller companies to write and film video podcasts.  The podcasts were shown in various film festivals and streamed online.  She was even invited to perform live at the Cambridge Science festival including the Boston Museum of Science.  Maria later researched and wrote capsules for the David Suzuki Report, a radio show hosted by David Suzuki, Canada’s most famous scientist.

Behind the Blue wig

Sheila Anderson

  • the actor who plays Professor Blue in the video podcasts
  • writer for the Bloog (Professor Blue’s blog) at http://professorblue.com,
  • writer for @profblue on Twitter & http://facebook.com/professorblue ->the Facebook page,<-
  • writer for those other places where words need wording for fluffing, primping, file documentation heretofore explaining merging and condescending.  

She also produces and writes pretend commercials and ad campaigns throughout the known hemisphere.

What’s so great about pretend commercials?

 

While studying writing at the Jack Kerouac School of Disembodied Poetics at Naropa University, graduate English at Harvard, and the MFA Writer's series at Bennington College, Sheila also worked in catering and restaurants before hitting the big tent, the big blue wig tent, collecting and perfecting many receipes for kids and other fussy eaters.  She offers the Self-Help Comedy Cookbook as one of the perks, having tested the recipes on she-herself-and-her, along with a few parents of insistently-trying-to-help-but-pooping-out-before-finishing Land Urchins (aka kids).

And then 

Next, Maria teamed up with the majestic and awesome Jennie Shipman Bonwich.

Did you know that Jennie drew official cartoons for the St Louis Cardinals?  The baseball team, and not the ornithological rock band, that is.

This is the cover to the first book, already published in English (Professor Blue Top Secret Lab Journal) and in French (Professeure Bleue Top Secret Journal de Bord).

Now available for sale at Amazon, Barnes and Nobles and throughout local Quebec bookstores, as well as from the trunk of Maria Laskar's car.

Accordion to Whom?

We’ve also scored the rights to use a song performed by Lynda Barry, artist/cartoonist and accordion player extraordinaire.  We shall be using this music in our pilot TV program to help us convey something very important about ... something sciencey.

What We Need:

The generous money you fork over will buy us some time to create and illustrate an awesome new book, as well as video and edit an energetic, creative pilot for TV.  

Some of the funds will be used to pay for the crew, rental of equipment (green screen, etc) pizza, sets, costumes and sound engineering for the best super duper video ever. We want to connect with kids’ inner nerds.

What do you get?

A headache!  Simply put, you get another reason to drive yourself crazy.  You know how your daughter or son or nephew or neighbor kid or favorite Girl Scout likes to harp on an on about Dora the Explora or Tonka Toys or whatever?  We want to add Professor Blue to that kid's repertoire.  

No, seriously (kind of), you get our best products  - book, tv episode in maybe 4-8 months - or sooner.  

The T-shirts, drinking glasses, and other stuff will be shipped out much sooner than the DVD and Book 2.  We’ll email you to let you in on our progress.  We’ll have a secret page on our Professor Blue website that only you can join so that we can keep in touch about very important stuff.  Secret handshakes too.

Please pass word of our fundraiser to all your People, and make noise about us in your circle of relations.  

PLEASE use the Indiegogo share tools.

And…curtain up, lights dimmed, Let's roll.

No, really, Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

In February 2013 we self-funded the production of 100 copies of Can't Understand New Technology and distributed it to London's creative community.  Design Week described the print-only publication as “energetic swearing with a fair bit of insight”. Wired called it "rather enjoyable". And one reader wrote to say his copy was now “wedged between 'Classic Porsche magazine' and the 'National Trust year book' in the loo”.

In order to keep Can't Understand New Technology free for our readers, we're now looking to raise funds in order to cover production and distribution costs. 

By contributing, you will help ensure that Can't Understand New Technology really is by and for the creative community, surfacing insightful commentary on the industry and the ways technology is affecting how we all live, work and think. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Each issue costs £1052

  • Printing (Newspaperclub) x 500 - £558
  • Biodegradeable Polybags - £44
  • Post (distribution) - £450

 

We'd be thrilled to receive support in any form, but for the big hitters, check out the perks to the side >>!

 

The Impact

We have the dedication to turn Can't Understand New Technology into a key reference for the creative industry. We want to keep producing relevant, irreverent content without being forced into the cheaper confines of the internet. There is a value in being print-only, and we are commited to this format. 

We appreciate not everyone can contribute but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please share our campaign using the hashtag #cantunderstandnewtechnology and the Indiegogo share tools!

Loves,

Camilla and Steve

story:
Short Summary

Hi Everyone, 

My name is Racheal O. Mack - I have been running a creative agency for several years and the most common element I see people having with getting more creative with their marketing is "Getting to Start"!. Thus the inspiration for my book. I have assisted all types of businesses and entrepreneurs and with my now seasoned knowledge and experience I feel more ready than ever to launch this book Sept 2012! 

Your help will afford me the ability to finish interviewing some very successful entrepreneurs and get them to share their "secret creative strategies". 

Also I will need help with online publishing fee's, advertising, public relations and buying enough books for my first in store signing locally. 

I am passionate about helping businesses and my hope is to help millions through this book. I will be updating this book 1-2 x a year as well. 

If I meet my goal I will create more books in the Getting to Start Series, if you have a need for a certain getting to start email me at contactme@rachealomack.com and I will certainly consider it for my next book! 

It's just a marker page now but my future Author/book site will be here, www.gettingtostart.com - find out more about me and my qualifications at: www.linkedin.com/in/rachealaokeefemack "check my recommendations section" 

What We Need & What You Get

Needs to Accomplish this Book Launch:

$249.00 for Premium Online Publishing and Distribution on Bookbaby.com 

$599 for printing 100 books, ( book signings, promotions)

Other remaining funds will be sent on Publicity, promotion, advertising on facebook, google, email lists, website fee's. I may need more $ but 2000 should be enough for launch, I made sure I picked a realistic goal. 

Chapter 1:

What is creative marketing?

Why you need creative marketing

The Five Keys To Great Marketing In 2012

Chapter 2:

How to start thinking outside the box with your business

How to get more creative with social media marketing

Chapter 3: 

Top 10 Creative Marketing Strategies you should try at least once

Chapter 4:

Creative ways and techniques to raise money for your business

Chapter 5:

Which creative marketing is good for which types of businesses

Chapter 6:

How to use creative web tools to your advantage

Chapter 7:

Insights and interviews from other creative business owners and entrepreneurs

Chapter 8:

How to prepare your own creative marketing plan (by business Type)

SPECIAL (1000$ VALUE Bonus) " A creative sample marketing plan made by me" Creative Marketing Strategy Plan Template (on CD through this campaign when you pledge 50$ or more.)

Any pledge of 100$ or more will get an audio version, pdf copy, printed book creative marketing tempate and CD Audio Version. 

Some links showing the fees of some things I will be putting campaign funds toward.

http://www.bookbaby.com/services/book-printing

http://www.bookbaby.com/services/ebook-publishing

The Impact

Helping businesses succeed and learn how to market more creatively. Help the economy thrive better with expert advice, templates and introduction to new ways to use web tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to local businesses or entrepreneurs that need some help with fresh ideas to market their business.

Share on Facebook, tweet and email to friends using Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all in advance!!!

story:
My Story

My name is Joshua Guess. For the last several years I have been writing as a hobby, then part-time job. Now I'm on the edge of going full-time, but I need your help. I ran a campaign previously for the first novel in a series, Victim Zero, which tells the story of how the zombie apocalypse began in my Living With the Dead universe. While that campaign didn't reach its goal, the success we achieved together gave me enough time to finish and publish Victim Zero.

That novel is doing well. Enough that I want to strike while the iron is hot and write the sequel I've been planning. So many ideas, so little time! 

That's where your help comes in. If you read and enjoyed Victim Zero and/or my Living With the Dead series, then supporting this campaign will help me bring you more of the same. My outlook right now is as positive as it has ever been, and when the royalties from June hit my bank account in August, I should be in a financial situation where I can write full-time, even if it means eating cheap and turning off the air conditioning. 

But to make it that long, I need your support. This campaign is intended to keep the lights on and let me spend the next six to eight weeks writing. The period of time between now and August is a bridge I need your help in crossing. It doesn't take much to help change someone's life. A few dollars here, sharing a link there. If this campaign is successful it will allow me to go for broke and be a full-time writer now. 

See? It's that easy to make a dream come true.

 

The Book

Victim Zero was about how The Fall began and the man responsible, Kell McDonald. The story follows Kell shortly before the outbreak and long after as he struggles to cope with his part in the end of the world. 

Dead Will Rise continues his tale. It's a smaller story told over a shorter time that chronicles Kell's effort to deal with his losses. With the zombie apocalypse as the backdrop, DWR is at its core an examination of how the weight of the world bends and distorts the man whose shoulders hold it. Victim Zero is the first leg of the journey and focuses on survival. 

Dead Will Rise is about learning to live.

What I Need & What You Get

Many campaigns get vague with where your money goes. Some are for things like board games that require a lot of cost for materials and the like. While a portion of the proceeds from this campaign will go to costs such as cover art, editing, fulfillment of perks and shipping costs, this is a campaign for a book. What you're doing by supporting Dead Will Rise is helping me afford writing full-time for the next few months while also getting unique, cool rewards for doing so. 

It's a total win-win. 

Rather than list the perks here, which are right there -------> in the sidebar, I'll just give you the action-packed synopsis of the kinds of things you can get by supporting this campaign. 

Perks start at five dollars, with everyone from that level and up getting an eBook version of Dead Will Rise as well as an exclusive short story written just for this campaign. From there it gets very interesting! I'll be doing a print version perk, another for personalized signed copies, a perk allowing you to beta read the book and give your feedback, making you a part of the process. I'll even write a short novella for you if, in the words of the immortal Bob barker, the price is right! Yep, you haven't gone nuts. For the top tier I will work with you to write an original novella using you as the main character, set in the Living With the Dead universe. The best part? When we're done, you totally own it. Publish it yourself, let it gather dust on your hard drive, sell it for charity, whatever you want. The rights are yours!

The Impact

This campaign will change my world. I'm modest, to be frank, and I don't think my writing will have the same effect on the world as success here would have on me. You, the fans, do seem to enjoy reading my books and I certainly love writing them. I like looking at this genre from different angles, telling stories you never really see elsewhere.

I get to entertain. I became a writer because I'm a reader. I read a lot and have since I was a kid. There is no feeling better than falling into a world and feeling your pulse pound as the main character struggles and triumphs. I want to write this book because enough of you expressed your satisfaction with Victim Zero and a desire for a sequel pretty much NOW. You asked, and this is me trying to come through. 

If this campaign isn't successful I'll have to pick up a full-time job soon. I'll still work on DWR but it will take longer. As a flexible funding campaign I will get your contribution shortly after you make it, allowing me to pay editors, artists, formatters, and my bills to keep on writing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of my most hardcore readers are, in an interesting slice of spectrum, college students and retired people. Two groups who generally live on fixed incomes. Because I will never ask any of you to spend money on me or my work if you can't afford it (been there myself more than once and recently, too!), please don't feel bad if you don't have the ability to do so. I say this because a few people backed the last campaign but had to scrape up the money to do it. 

That's super nice of you, but please don't feel you have to do that! 

If you want to help but money is a problem there are other ways you can show your love. On this very campaign page are sharing tools for Facebook, Twitter, and the rest. Share a link, write a blurb about me and my work, spend a few minutes chatting with a friend who might want to help out. These campaigns work because fantastic friends and readers like you take the time out of your day to share and spread the word. If you can't back in dollars, then simply backing me up with kind words (and word-of-mouth) is more than enough.

Share a link, write a blurb about me and my work, spend a few minutes chatting with a friend who might want to help out. These campaigns work because fantastic friends and readers like you take the time out of your day to share and spread the word. If you can't back in dollars, then simply backing me up with kind words (and word-of-mouth) is more than enough.

story:
Who We Are

The Rotaract Club of Annapolis is a civic organization comprised of young professionals dedicated to serving the local and international community. If you are unfamiliar with Rotaract Clubs, think of us as the Junior Rotary Club. Aside from organizing event fundraisers for many different causes, we also strive to have a hands-on approach in our volunteering. 

Members of our club have organized a 10-day, international service trip to the Peace Project in Nicaragua. This service trip is important to Rotaract because we want to make a international difference to those less fortunate. Two members of our club have already visited and volunteered with the Peace Project and returned to share their experiences and the needs of the Peace Project organization. They were so passionate about the Peace Project organization's mission, they've decided to organize this service trip with the club! 

If you'd like to learn more about the Peace Project, please visit their website- http://www.thepeaceprojectnicaragua.org/

What We Need & What You Get

We will be making a monetary contribution to the Peace Project during our visit along with our volunteer services. The majority of the expenses for Rotaractors to serve the Peace Project in Nicaragua are from traveling expenses (airfare, local transportation, and lodging). Our 4 volunteers have already booked their travel to Nicaragua, but are in need of funding assistance. Your contribution will be used to add to our monetary contribution and to help fund our traveling expenses. 

As a token of appreciation for your contribution, we have some great perks to offer at different contribution levels.

The Impact

Annapolis Rotaract has hosted other successful and fun fundraising events to help fund this service trip including a fun night at a miniature golf course and local happy hours. We realize the difference our contributions can make for the Peace Project, and hope to make the biggest impact possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a contribution at this time, please share our campaign with others. The more we raise, the larger impact we can make!

story:
Summary

Welcome to The Art and Science of Digital Music Distribution. This soon to be published book is a teaching tool for Music Artists, Labels, Media Engineers and anyone else with an interest in publicizing recorded music. Why write this book? After conversing with many people in the entertainment industry I have concluded that there are thousands of entertainment professionals who have no concept of what it means to accurately create an MP3 file or an audio CD and to populate the MP3 file or audio CD with Metadata Tags such as the Artist Name, Album Name, Tracking Numbers, Publisher Name, Et cetera. In fact many studio enthusiasts will simply mix their projects straight down to an MP3 file without any customization. This soon to be published book explains why creating a CD or MP3 file without any customization causes loss of advertising and revenue, and the book teaches artists how to use the same free software that is used by major music retail outlets to create and distribute trackable music.

What We Need

$10,000 is needed. Your financial contributions will be used to Print and Distribute this up-coming book to stores, and just as important, advertise! That way it does not just sit on shelves and only get sold to a few people. Hi Mom!Your financial contributions will be used to Print and Distribute this up-coming book to stores, and just as important, advertise! That way it does not just sit on shelves and only get sold to a few people. Hi Mom!

What You Get

  • Donate $75.00 or more and receive a free personally autographed copy of the soon to be released book The Art and Science of Digital Music Distribution.
  • Donate $35.00 or more and receive a discount towards a purchase of the soon to be released book The Art and Science of Digital Music Distribution.

Download

For your reading a short excerpt of the Book Introduction, Chapter 3, and Conclusion can be Downloaded Here.

 

The Impact

Plain and simple. I am tired of seeing artist pass out MP3's and CD's that are missing metadata information like the Artist Name, Song Title, Royalty Tracking numbers like the ISRC and much more. This book will teach any entertainer how to properly embed metadata into their music so that each song shows the artist information in your CD or MP3 player.

Risks & Challenges

Like anything else there is a risk. Luckily the risk for this book is rather small because the need for artist education is vast. Open Source Software was also exclusively referenced in this upcoming book. Open Source Software is noticeably copyleft instead copyright protected. The authors of each open source software mentioned in this book have also given their blessing for production and will receive print credit.

The author of this upcoming book is not only a literary author. He is also a musician that has released music singles, studied music theory, and performed in theater plays. In short, experience counts and with several years of experience in the entertainment industry, and access to outside consultants, success is almost guaranteed.




More about the author's artistry and body of work can be found at www.thewordsmith.info.

Other Ways You Can Help

Support the music @ http://www.thewordsmith.info

story:
I've been writing for an incredibly long time. Approximately 20 years. Mind you a large chunk of those years were spent writing things you sort of needed to write - things like your name, your address, a full confession as to why you chose to dress your younger brother like a hooker... the usual. 

In the past several months I have started writing something that is mostly new for me - fiction. If you ask my mother, I wrote a ton of fiction as a child and a lot of it was incredibly libellous and probably would have gotten her, me and all of our neighbours arrested. Chances are excellent that all of that writing has been destroyed. 

You're probably thinking "Okay cool, but why on earth should I contribute a solid $20 - $150 of my hard earned cash to a mentally unstable redhead" - to that I have several points:

  1. Most redheads are mentally unstable and you can't really hold that against me. 
  2. I'm actually most of the way through this novel (I seriously have no idea how) and I am going to try and get this thing published. Meaning I am going to spend some money investigating hiring an agent or self publishing in an e-book format. 
  3. If you contribute, I will try to share as much of what I've written as possible as quickly as possible with you. 
  4. I need money in order to continue to purchase wine. 

There are likely other, much better reasons to contribute to me, however my wine fund has run incredibly low and as such, so has my inspiration. I will try to add more reasons as they come to me.


You can check the progress of the book HERE!
