story:
Who I Am

My name is Christa Charter and I am the author of two crime novels set in the video game industry: Schooled (Lexy Cooper #1) and Pwned (Lexy Cooper #2). I'm in the process of writing the third book in the series. 

Before I wrote books I worked in the video game industry for nearly two decades. I spent 8 years at Microsoft's Xbox as web editor/community manager/video hostess Trixie360.

Why I Want To Go To Roswell, NM

In my third Lexy Cooper novel, the company Lexy works for--Xenon Corporation--is getting ready to launch their next-generation console to replace the Xenon 24/7. And to launch it properly into the world, Xenon is throwing a big party (much like the Xbox 360 launch event "Zero Hour"). The event will take place at a decommissioned air force base: Walker AFB, just outside of Roswell. 

The hitch in this plan is that I've never been to Roswell or New Mexico at all. For me, realism is important in my novels. My books are ripe with Seattle and Redmond details down to the menu items in restaurants. I want to accurately represent the sights, sounds, and smells of Roswell and Walker AFB in the most important part of the new book--and maybe even the series.

What I'll Do With Your Investment

It's pretty simple: buy a plane ticket from SEA to ROW and back. Rent a car, and stay two nights in a hotel. Just the basics so that I can spend a weekend soaking up Roswell atmosphere, taking lots of pictures, talking with locals, and making copious notes.

What's In It For You?

Being a patron of the arts? Okay, so maybe you're not Lorenzo de' Medici. I'm no Leonardo Da Vinci. To honor your part in writing Lexy Cooper #3, I'm offering different rewards. Everyone who helps fund this research trip will receive a digital copy of Lexy #3 when's it's released (February 2014) and will have their name in the acknowledgements. Give a little bit more and you could be a character in the book and receive your copy early. Check out the rewards. If you have an idea for something I haven't listed, let me know!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help in a non-monetary way read the first two Lexy Cooper books and tell your friends about them. Give them a review on Amazon.com or Goodreads. Word of mouth is free and valuable beyond calculation!

Thank you!

story:
Have You Ever Felt a Desire to Experience Life in the French Wine Region? What about in a Tropical Jungle, a Remote Canadian Island, London or Miami Beach?

Or do you have other exotic or adventurous destinations on your wish list like Peru, Ecuador, skiing in Colorado or diving in Barbados?

If you are hearing "YES" in your mind right now, then it would be our absolute pleasure to show you how you can have ANY or ALL of these Experiences for FREE... just like we have had this past year.

How will we do this?  Well, if you just watched our video you know that we are Nat & Jodie, and it's humbling for us to say that we have experienced (and are booked to experience) ALL of the above! Never in a million years would we have thought any of this was possible, and absolutely none of it could have happened...

If it wasn't for House Sitting!


House Sitting has completely changed our lives, and it came across our path at a time when we needed it the most! You see back at the end of 2012 we narrowly escaped being thrown into Dubai's debt jail after an unfortunate business investment zapped all our money and spirit and sent us into massive debt!  We were really struggling to make ends meet and 'thought' we had no hope of ever traveling the world, let alone staying in such amazing places. 

Yet by some miracle we were guided to House Sitting.  Initially we saw it only as a way to help get us back on our feet… little did we know that it would turn out to be the greatest gift of our LIVES!

So our intention here is to share this gift with you and the best we can think of is to produce and publish the interactive 'House Sitting World' digital Magazine!

And to make it happen as soon as possible, we really want to know how much You would LOVE to receive this informative, inspiring & entertaining digital magazine each & every month?

Where have you always wanted to go?

House Sitting is not just for the full-time traveller like us. It is also an incredible way to holiday and have very unique travel experiences. Some benefits are...

  • Find your perfect writers retreat at no cost
  • Take more vacations, because they are free!
  • Live in a fully equipped, sometimes even luxurious home
  • Indulge in the wonderful local produce & save on restaurant meals
  • Completely immerse yourself in the local culture & community
  • Experience unconditional love from the pets
  • Experience the trust and friendship that forms between sitter and owner, and make some new life long friends. 
  • Enjoy having Free accommodation all over the World as home-owners beg you to come back, and refer you… we have experienced this many times, and now have free accommodation lined up well into 2015!


Just a few short months ago when we were first hit with massive inspiration to create this magazine, we started researching for our potential contributors and were amazed at what we found...

There are already thousands of individuals, couples and families around the world house sitting each and every day. They are using it for a variety of reasons in a variety of ways, including…
  • To save on holidays
  • Have a new experience of a place or lifestyle
  • Try out a new place before they move or buy there
  • Variety in retirement
  • Saving money on rent to save up for a house deposit
  • As a full-time lifestyle

Of course there is the flipside to this – The home and Pet owners actually using the services of house sitters to look after their precious fur babies, save on pet minding services and provide security while they are away.

It is no wonder that this form of travel has now come into it’s own!

You may have already begun to realize that this is an experience you are ready for, so head over to the right of this page and choose the Perk that is calling your name!

This is an experience Magazine for House Sitters and Owners!

If you are an existing House sitter, or would love to be house sitting but not taken that first step, or a pet/home owner… then this magazine is for you!

Every month we will bring you the one-stop shop on everything to do with house sitting, saving you valuable time scouring through reams of websites and blogs looking for information and inspiration.   

We will awaken your desire to get out and see the world, as we give you a healthy dose of tips, entertainment and inspiration through:

  • Stories of international house sitters, global vagabonds and expats

  • Tips on how to make your house & pet sitting experience more rewarding

  • Pet Experts who specialize in Pet Care & Safety

  • Suggestions and lessons on how to make money & save money

  • Suggestions on what to do in between house sitting assignments that won't cost the earth

  • Insights into community based volunteering

  • Great deals on travel & potential bucket list experiences

  • Travel tips and suggestions

  • Tourist Visa and immigration updates 

For our existing house sitters we will give you entertaining stories of other travellers to inspire you on to new locations and experiences, and provide tips to constantly develop your knowledge and skills in house sitting.

For our new house sitters, we will teach you important things like, creating a successful house sitting profile, selecting a house sit and tips on how to fulfill the assignment.

For our modern nomads that are not tied to a location for work (and wannbees), we have contributors lined up to give you the latest and most successful ways to make money online so you can live and work where you please, just like they are.

For our pet owners we will provide you with the latest in all things pet care related AND to inspire you to pay it forward, go house sit somewhere yourself... we've had this happen to us twice so far - it's an awesome idea!

Plus of course the added bonus of our private community; ‘House Sitting World’ will be THE place where sitters can feel supported by their peers, have all their questions answered and receive referral assignments.


Are you a budding entrepreneur or a self-employed person who wants to be location independent? Check out the Perks that will guide you to becoming a Modern Nomad!

Despite the large growing numbers of those interested in House Sitting, this will actually be the World’s First Magazine dedicated to all things House & Pet Sitting... it's a Mobile Magazine and we're calling it ‘House Sitting World’!

We have already published a digital magazine previously and loved it!

We also love the fact that the digital App space is where the world will continue to head to… perfectly suited to travellers and modern nomads who ‘live’ on their tablets & phones! And the mobile magazine format is interactive which makes it even more of an entertaining read.



Your financial contribution through this campaign is undoubtedly invaluable to our project and in true fair exchange we want to gift you Perks that will be the most beneficial in having your own house sitting experiences.

And of course, this campaign is all perfectly timed just before Christmas & the Holidays!

WHAT PERK LEVEL ARE YOU?

The Perks from $2 - $97 are for You if you have little experience in house sitting and/or want to do it just as an occasional experience. These Perks will get you well and truly started on your journey.

The Perks from $47 - $497 are for You if you are more serious about house sitting and want to use it as a way to travel more often and more extensively, and even to do it Full Time.

So the question is what Perk appeals to you the most?

Head over and choose Yours Now!

If you cannot contribute financially right now but would still love to participate… no sweat!

Or maybe some sweat actually… how about helping us with some of your valuable time and energy to get the word out. Check out the social media tools that Indiegogo has so lovingly put together to help us. They are below our first video on this page.

Whatever way you choose to join in… THANK YOU!!! Champion effort!

Our campaign is to sell $7500 worth of subscriptions & products to immediately get going with the following:

·  Development of the App

·  Purchase stock images for the Magazine issues

·  Professional design of the Magazine templates, banners and logos

·  Engage social media and subscriber management

·  Assistance with the marketing of the Magazine

But more importantly, if we can reach just 500 people through this campaign, Apple will reward us with additional exposure time in the ‘New & Noteworthy’ Newsstand App section. This is an invaluable promo bonus for the Magazine!

We are originally from Australia and left our homeland late 2011.  Jodie’s background is resort management and internet marketing, while Natalie enjoyed 13 years in the Australian Federal Police and business.

We cannot wait to share our absolute love of house sitting through digital publishing with the world! 

Our previous Digital Magazine is Into-Me-I-See (Yes we have published before!)

Our blog is International House Sitting 

We have You Tube Channels for House Sitting World & Modern Nomads

As residents of nowhere and dwellers of everywhere, this is our ultimate lifestyle, and have no end in sight of finishing on this journey as fulltime house sitters!

Heaven forbid!  :(

However, on the chance that happens we will firstly fund the App development. From there we will do whatever it takes to barter with a graphic designer, scour the internet for whatever free images we can find, and manage our own social media, marketing and PR in-house. Either way this Magazine will happen! This is us living our purpose here on the planet and sharing it with the World!

Yay!  :)

The first thing we will do is have our Magazine translated into other languages such as Spanish and French, so we can make 'House Sitting World' Magazine available to a wider audience of readers around the World.

Beyond that, we will be pouring excess funds into ongoing marketing and promotion to bring our readers the best possible experience including discounts on digital nomad & travel related products and services.

We look forward to connecting with you on your favourite social media platform and getting to know you better in our private G+ Community (Get Your $7 Perk for Instant Access)

We also love the fact that the digital App space is where the world will continue to head to… perfectly suited to travellers and modern nomads who ‘live’ on their tablets & phones! And the mobile magazine format is interactive which makes it even more of an entertaining read.Your financial contribution through this campaign is undoubtedly invaluable to our project and in true fair exchange we want to gift you Perks that will be the most beneficial in having your own house sitting experiences.And of course, this campaign is all perfectly timed just before Christmas & the Holidays!WHAT PERK LEVEL ARE YOU? The Perks from $2 - $97 are for You if you have little experience in house sitting and/or want to do it just as an occasional experience. These Perks will get you well and truly started on your journey. The Perks from $47 - $497 are for You if you are more serious about house sitting and want to use it as a way to travel more often and more extensively, and even to do it Full Time. So the question is what Perk appeals to you the most? 
Head over and choose Yours Now!

If you cannot contribute financially right
now but would still love to participate… no sweat! 
Or maybe some sweat actually… how about helping us with some of your valuable time and energy to get the word out. Check out the social media tools that Indiegogo has so lovingly put together to help us. They are below our first video on this page.

Whatever way you choose to join in… THANK YOU!!!
Champion effort!

Our campaign is to sell $7500 worth of subscriptions & products to immediately get going
with the following:·  Development of the App 
·  Purchase stock images for the
Magazine issues
·  Professional design of the Magazine templates, banners and logos
·  Engage social media and subscriber management
·  Assistance with the marketing of the Magazine 
But more importantly, if we can reach just 500 people through this campaign, Apple will reward us with additional exposure time in the ‘New & Noteworthy’ Newsstand App section.  This is an invaluable promo bonus for the Magazine!We are originally from Australia and left our homeland late 2011.  Jodie’s background is resort management and internet marketing, while Natalie enjoyed 13 years in the Australian Federal Police and business.

We cannot wait to share our absolute love of house sitting through digital publishing with the world!  Our previous Digital Magazine is Into-Me-I-See (Yes we have published before!)Our blog is International House Sitting  We have You Tube Channels for House Sitting World & Modern NomadsAs residents of nowhere and dwellers of everywhere, this is our ultimate lifestyle, and have no end in sight of finishing on this journey as fulltime house sitters!Heaven forbid!  :(However, on the chance that happens we will
firstly fund the App development. From there we will do whatever it
takes to barter with a graphic designer, scour the internet for whatever free images we can find, and manage our own social media, marketing and PR
in-house. Either way this Magazine will happen! This is us living our purpose
here on the planet and sharing it with the World! 
Yay!  :) The first thing we will do is have our Magazine translated into other languages such as Spanish and French, so we can
make 'House Sitting World' Magazine available to a wider audience of readers around the World. 
Beyond that, we will be pouring excess funds
into ongoing marketing and promotion to bring our readers the best possible experience including discounts on digital nomad & travel related products and services.


We look forward to connecting with you on your favourite social media platform and getting to know you better in our private G+ Community (Get Your $7 Perk for Instant Access)

story:
Short Summary

I grew up being a storyteller. I began telling stories when I was five years old. I would make up stories about my dolls and tell them to my mother. My first grade class journal was filled with stories about my cats and dogs, but I had none! In sixth grade, I started writing down my stories and bugged my literary teacher to read them and correct my mistakes. I had envisioned the world I was writing about as a movie in my mind. Every sentence I saw a new angle, and each paragraph became a new scene. As the years went on, I began to be interested in writing for the silver screen.

A Thorn is an idea I’ve been working on since my freshman year at RIT. But a lot has changed from then. This story was a challenge for me to write. I haven’t had a traumatic experience like my main character experienced. The main character is compelling to me because despite everything she has been through, she manages to make beautiful music; like creating beauty out of chaos. I wanted to tell a story that can be close to the truth as possible. Someone known to the victim commits approximately two-thirds of assaults and thirty-eight percent of rapists are a friend or acquaintance. On top of that sixty percent of assaults are not reported. Knowing these statistics, I created my story. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need funds to help pay for the costs of printing and binding my scripts for the actors to read at the table read presentation. I also have to print out a "playbill" to hand out to the attendees at my event. After this presentation, I will use whatever funds available to send my script out to film festivals so it can be picked up and eventually turned into a movie. That is my ultimate goal and I hope you can help me.

What you get:

$5 - electronic thank you note

$15 - handwritten thank you note

$25 - 1 page story with YOU as the main character & special thanks in my playbill page

$50 - 5 page story with YOU as the main character & special thanks in my playbill

$100 - 10 page story with YOU as the main character & special thanks & copy of my play bill

$125 - 10 page story with YOU as the main character & honorable mention & copy of my playbill & signed copy of my script.

The Impact

Sometimes trauma happens to an individual and nobody knows why or how to deal with a sudden change in their behavior. It can be mistaken as a phase. I wanted this story to raise awareness to behavior and how sometimes their outbursts might not be just a teen rebellious phase. They might seem attention seeking, but there could be a reason for it. So don’t be afraid to ask, to push them to answer you. Maybe that’s what they want you to do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's okay! Share this page and ask others to help! 


Thank you for donating and sharing!

story:
ABOUT WELCOME TABLE PRESS

"The world is everywhere whispering essays." --Alexander Smith

We are an all-volunteer, independent nonprofit press devoted to publishing & celebrating the essay, in all its forms. CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE.

The essay is a chameleon, at once formal and scholarly, lyrical and narrative, personal and political, educational and secretive, humorous and curmudgeonly, loud and quiet. It is endangered and dangerous, adaptable and perishable. Your contributions will help us put bold and provocative literature into the hands of readers, writers, students, and teachers. 

ALL OF THE CONTRIBUTIONS WE RECEIVE COME FROM INDIVIDUALS WHO BELIEVE IN INDEPENDENT PUBLISHING.

HOW YOU CAN HELP SUPPORT OUR WORK

All contributions collected from this Indiegogo campaign will be directed toward the printing and distribution of our second print book, ESSAYING THE ESSAY, edited by David Lazar.

ESSAYING THE ESSAY is a must-have compendium of essays on the essay, showcasing diverse meditations on the form  by a wide range of writers throughout history, including Michel de Montaigne, Samuel Johnson, Virginia Woolf, Cynthia Ozick, Phillip Lopate, Robert Atwan, Lia Purpura, and John D'Agata.

Your support will help build our self-sufficiency (pre-press, printing, and advertising are expensive; the larger the print run, the lower the cost per title; distributing books costs money too).

The more funding we secure, the greater the possibility for us to offer:

  • Discounts for students, teachers, and writers.
  • Letterpress-printed, limited-edition versions of our titles, whose sales will help futher support our publishing and educational activities.
  • Publishing internships to more students.

Our first Indiegogo campaign, Everywhere Whispering Essays, funded the printing and distribution of our first print title, You. An Anthology of Essays Devoted to the Second Person, edited by Kim Dana Kupperman, with Heather G. Simons and James M. Chesbro.


YOU. AN ANTHOLOGY is a first-of-its-kind collection, featuring essays that explore failure, planetary movement, and love, among a variety of topics. The up close and personal candor of these autobiographical, lyric, personal, and segmented narratives is tempered by the distance, intimacy, humor, and unsentimental tenderness that the second-person point of view affords both writer and reader.


OUR TRACK RECORD

Welcome Table Press has published (and distributed at no cost) ten electronic and six limited-edition, print issues of its periodical pamphlet series, OCCASIONAL PAPERS ON PRACTICE & FORM, featuring spoken essays derived from talks delivered at symposia, conferences, and other gatherings where friends of the essay might be found. Currently in production are six additional issues.

Two  co-sponsored by   Fordham University's Creative Writing Program and featuring Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.

                 Click HERE to download FREE PDFs of these important essays. 

Welcome Table Press is home to FOOD FOR THOUGHT, a hand-sewn, miniature/limited-edition periodical whose two volumes were published between 2002-2006 and featured lyric essays, poetry, and recipes for local, seasonal dishes. The twelve issues of FOOD FOR THOUGHT are preserved at SUNY Buffalo's Special Collections library.

We plan to re-create FOOD FOR THOUGHT NOTES as a series of video essays.

Because we are dedicated to spreading the word about the essay, our press has hosted and co-sponsored several low-cost or free educational events, including:

  • Two symposia on the essay, co-sponsored by      
  • Fordham University's Creative Writing Program andfeaturing Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.
  • Internships for creative-writing students: we have been working with editorial interns for several years 
  • and are currently working with the Fairfield University's low-residency MFA Program to provide internships in its publishing concentration.
  • A book arts workshop in a rural community.
  • Fundraiser readings by the literary touring group Three Genres in the Rain, which benefitted organizations devoted to the reading and writing.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE. Welcome Table Press was incorporated as a nonprofit organization in 2008 and granted 501(c)(3) status in 2009.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We know that not everyone can contribute to this fundraising campaign. But here's what you can do:

  • Whisper essays everywhere and then make noise about this Indiegogo campaign, via e-mail, social media, on your website or blog, in your community, classes, and at your office.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Buy one of our publications.
  • Consider partnering with us to co-sponsor an event.

MOST IMPORTANTLY: Please purchase our titles--priced well below the cost of producing the physical books-- through our distributor, Itasca Books (and spread the word).

To order the YOU Anthology ($20 cover price + 4.50 S&H minimum), please click HERE.

Welcome Table Press derives more income per book if you order through ITASCA BOOKS instead of through other distributors or chain bookstores. We’d also love it if you worked with independent and/or college bookstores near you to order our books. If you need a quantity of books for a class, workshop, or other reason please e-mail welcometablepress@gmail.com, let us know what you need, and we will work with you.

story:
I’m DiDi Hendley-this is all about my debut novel, WHIRLWIND LOVE: LIBBY’S JOURNEY. This book has taken four years from inception to completion. I'm thrilled that it’s about to be released into the world…but only with your help, of course! 


The Story:

One never knows when a cool breeze will become a whirlwind, change a course, and lead lovers down a path from which they can never return.

While 29-year-old Libby Morgan is fulfilling her ten-year-long dream: to witness and photograph a hot-air balloon “fall freedom festival” at the Grand Canyon, a spontaneous side-trip in her RV puts her in the path of 35-year-old Joe King, the disillusioned former country music headliner.

Weary of carrying his horn-dog, irresponsible, albeit insanely-talented younger brother, Chuck, Joe is trying to keep his anger contained for just two more weeks. Two weeks…to finish the humiliating opening-act tour his loathsome manager forced on him as TBK’s contract finally expires. Joe has sights set on change—but how will that change affect The Brothers King?

A chance encounter brings Libby face-to-face with a nightmare from her past, and shows Joe just how far into an abyss he's fallen.

Can they find their way…to each other and to their destinies?

The Inspiration:

Whirlwind Love came into being after I bought a download of the Christian Kane-Live in London CD—I was a fan of the TNT television show, Leverage, and when I found out through their website that Christian Kane also had a musical career—well, I don’t mind saying that I hungered for that CD. Money was tight--working part-time for a nonprofit, and music just wasn’t part of the budget.

On February 17, 2010, I decided I wasn’t waiting any longer…doing without a necessity if I had to. Long story short: I had a very vivid dream that night—which became the original story of Libby and Joe, and Whirlwind Love. It's my goal to have the book ready for the anniversary date of that dream: February 17, 2014--but I can't do that without our help.

My life changed, as a result of this CD. I never had an inkling that I wanted to be a writer, and one event gave me the courage to do it: The only person I shared it with--someone who wasn't able to comfortably do so--read it in the car--because she couldn't put it down. I'll share more about that later--but that's what brought me here. I've spent the last four years studying the craft of writing--EVEN so much as going to film school! The screenplay is in progress even now. I hope this is the beginning of a new career!

The book is Libby's story--told from her point-of-view. The script will be Joe's.

The Request:

I'm only asking for funding to produce WHIRLWIND as an ebook and a paperback. If there is enough demand (and geez, I hope so!) I'll be thrilled to produce a hardback version and folks above a certain level can choose the kind of book they want in their hand.  

MORE Inspiration (and the love!):

Because the inspiration for Whirlwind Love came from Christian Kane's Live in London CD,  Brand X Management and Christian would allow me to include a copy with certain levels--so there are THIRTY CDs set aside--and I hope you will not only support publication of my novel, but also Christian's CD--because it's fantastic! (And...thanks SO much Christian, Steve and Eric!)

I'd encourage you to put on your CD while reading...it'll make the music scenes come to life!

I've included a few levels that will include books to share--so I hope you'll consider those options!

Now...suppose on some unhappy planet I don't reach my goal...what then? Well...my ideal scenario will allow me to be my own pubisher--start my own publishing business, so that the two sequels that follow WHIRLWIND LOVE (namely, LEAD THE WIND and WINDWARD), will have a home and you...being the generous, thoughtful contributor will be the first to know about them (and know I'll do everything in my power to be as generous to you when that time comes!). If I cannot reach my goal, then I'll have to choose an option that puts others in control of my destiny--and none of us would want that, now would we? Seriously--I'll make sure you receive a book--even if I have to photocopy them. I'm aiming much higher, and I know that that won't be necessary.


The CD is included in certain levels of my campaign courtesy of Christian Kane and Brand X Management—for which I’m so thankful. It shouldn’t be interpreted as an endorsement—but I wanted to share my inspiration for anyone who may be interested in my story and its foundation.

Thanks to Christian Kane http://www.christiankane.com and Steve Carlson http://www.stevecarlson.com for the music, the memories and the inspiration that changed my path.

Please Note:

This is a work of ﬁction. All characters, dialogue, and scenes yield from the author’s imagination and are not to be construed as real. Where real, historical or public ﬁgures appear, the situations, incidents, and dialogues concerning those persons are entirely ﬁctional and are not intended to depict actual events or to change the ﬁctional nature of this work. In all other respects, any resemblance to persons living or dead is entirely coincidental.


The Gang

I have to offer my utmost gratitude for my actors: Sandra Smith (as Libby Morgan), Don Ciesielski (as Joe King), and Greg Austin (as Chuck King), as well as the RV loan by Lauri and Jim Bob Wiles.

I plan to produce a few more videos to share with you more of the story-but I don't want to delay getting started on my campaign--in order to meet my goal of 2/17/14. We also had Jim Shaylor as Buck, Lauri Wiles as Sue, and Crystal Ciesielski as Buck's Babe.

Also--be sure to check out http://GregAustinMusic.com -- because Greg offered just a wee-bit of inspiration for Chuck (just some of the good parts...really!), and he was gracious enough to play the part for my stills. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know a reader who enjoys romance fiction (not the super-sweaty kind), and drama (only on the pages), the please share my campaign.

Let's get this show on the road!

interested in my story and its foundation.Thanks to Christian Kane http://www.christiankane.com and Steve Carlson http://www.stevecarlson.com for the music, the memories and the inspiration that changed my path.Please Note: 

This is a work
of ﬁction. All characters, dialogue, and scenes yield from the author’s
imagination and are not to be construed as real. Where real, historical or
public ﬁgures appear, the situations, incidents, and dialogues concerning those
persons are entirely ﬁctional and are not intended to depict actual events or
to change the ﬁctional nature of this work. In all other respects, any
resemblance to persons living or dead is entirely coincidental.

The GangI have to offer my utmost gratitude for my actors: Sandra Smith (as Libby Morgan), Don Ciesielski (as Joe King), and Greg Austin (as Chuck King), as well as the RV loan by Lauri and Jim Bob Wiles. I plan to produce a few more videos to share with you more of the story-but I don't want to delay getting started on my campaign--in order to meet my goal of 2/17/14. We also had Jim Shaylor as Buck, Lauri Wiles as Sue, and Crystal Ciesielski as Buck's Babe.Also--be sure to check out http://GregAustinMusic.com -- because Greg offered just a wee-bit of inspiration for Chuck (just some of the good parts...really!), and he was gracious enough to play the part for my stills.  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you know a reader who enjoys romance fiction (not the super-sweaty kind), and drama (only on the pages), the please share my campaign. Let's get this show on the road!

story:
Help Make Truth Mighty and Prevail . . .

Crowd funding has revolutionized how worthwhile projects can succeed with the involvement of a larger team comprised of supportive, interested, and generous people. And Indiegogo.com is a leader in this area. Thank you all for your interest and support!

Your generous contributions to this campaign will help raise funds for the publication and distribution of the novel, Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project. The author, Daniel P. Douglas, anticipates the need for approximately $11,000 to help support pre-publication, publication, and post publication costs. These costs include, but are not limited to editorial services ($1,500); Website hosting and domain services ($200); e-book conversion, cover design, publishing/distribution ($600); initial print run of 500 copies ($3600); and marketing and promotional services ($5,100).

About Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project

Medically retired FBI agent William Harrison struggles against his own sense of uselessness while dealing with lies, deceit, and sinister assassins to discover the truth about a decades-old government cover up of alien contact code-named, the Saint Mary Project. With the aid of a few trusted companions – and the guidance of a mysterious informant – Harrison fights hired guns and an alien-human hybrid to end the cover up, and halt the unimaginable crimes that Saint Mary and its hidden leaders have committed in the name of national security.

Harrison’s investigation also reveals a powerful secret about himself and his family, one that may prove to be the key to ending Saint Mary’s cover up and crimes.

Finding the truth and fighting back before it is too late takes Harrison out of his comfortable yet unrewarding life as a private investigator in Tucson, Arizona, to his childhood home of Los Angeles, the bright lights of Las Vegas and beyond, into the infamous Area 51, and even to the dingy alleys of Moscow. Will he and his compatriots prevail, or will Saint Mary’s archaic overseers remain unaccountable and continue to insurrect the truth that belongs to us all? Find out in Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project in October 2014.

Read All About It!

Newspaper headline from July 1947 regarding a pretty amazing recovery. Of course, the story changed soon thereafter. ;) In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the Roswell UFO incident figures prominently.

Guy Hottel FBI Memo

Guy Hottel was a special agent in charge of the FBI's Washington Field Office. The memo he wrote in March 1950 and sent to the FBI Director concerned flying saucers recovered in New Mexico along with their occupants.

Why UFOs and Aliens?

To say the subject is controversial would be an understatement, but that makes it all the more suitable as the topic for a novel. For decades, perhaps even centuries, people have seen these unknown craft in the sky or even underwater. There can be a sharp divide between believers and non-believers, and controversy about what it all means, especially in the context of alleged government secrecy. That tension, blended with the fundamental question, are we alone?, makes for a great storytelling opportunity.

The Aliens Are Coming!

UFOs and aliens have long been an entertainment favorite and readers of Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project will definitely be entertained. And intrigued too! :)

Excerpts from Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project

Excerpt I - Encounter_at_Dreamland.pdf

Excerpt II - Meeting_at_the_Naval_Observatory.pdf

Excerpt III - Echo_Tango.pdf

Excerpt IV - Echo_Tango_Strikes_Again.pdf

Excerpt V - Covering_Their_Tracks.pdf

Excerpt VI - Systems_Normal_Tell_No_One.pdf

Excerpt VII - The_Bad_Guys_Were_Not_Supposed_to_Win.pdf


PERK UPDATE!! - Some Perks Now Include The Following Cargo Items!

High Resolution 12x18 Truth Insurrected Book Cover Poster

Truth is Mighty T-Shirt

Truth is Mighty Coffee Mug

Truth is Mighty Mouse Pad

No Trespassing!

One of the locations in Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project is the infamous Area 51, located within a large military reservation in the Nevada desert about 80 miles or so north of Las Vegas. A little trespassing occurs in the novel. Who reads those pesky signs anyway?


The Boneyard

A good chunk of Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project occurs in Tucson, Arizona. This is where the protagonist, ex-FBI agent William Harrison, lives and works as a private investigator. One of the key locations in Tucson that Harrison visits to collect evidence of the government cover-up is the aircraft boneyard on Davis Monthan Air Force Base.


Viva Las Vegas!

What happens in Las Vegas doesn't always stay there. An important secondary character in Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project is Nick Ridley, a cop in Sin City. He and the protagonist, ex-FBI agent William Harrison, cross paths in more ways than one!


FBI Seal

In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the good guys either work for, or previously worked for, the FBI. They're cool, cool like the FBI.


Wichita, Kansas

Now, I've never visited Wichita, Kansas, but I write about it in Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project. In the novel, an important secondary character, FBI agent Art Holcomb, aids the protagonist, ex-FBI agent William Harrison, by traveling to Wichita to recover evidence of the Saint Mary Project's criminal activities.


Moscow

In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the protagonist, Ex-FBI agent William Harrison, travels to Russia under an assumed identity to retrieve an item of some importance. :)


U.S. Naval Observatory

In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the Naval Observatory in Washington, DC, serves as the site for an important meeting of the Saint Mary Project's "working group," which is staffed by senior military officers, scientists, and civilian executives in the Department of Defense.


F-15

In the first chapter of Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, two F-15 fighters engage an unidentified flying object over the Nevada desert during a test flight of a rebuilt alien craft that crashed near Roswell, New Mexico in 1947.


Wright-Patterson AFB

In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the Air Research and Development Command (ARDCom) at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base near Dayton, Ohio, serves as the "above ground" cover for a subterranean operational headquarters for the project.


Crop Circles

Long a part of UFO lore, crop circles also find a place in Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project as a research topic of Professor Francis Moresby, a project scientist.


Colt .45 Model 1911

In Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, the protagonist, ex-FBI agent William Harrison carries this as his sidearm of choice. When pursued by the bad guys like he is, he needs a reliable and powerful means of defense.

About the Author

Daniel P. Douglas is a rising novelist specializing in conspiracy thrillers and science fiction. His first anticipated novel, Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project, is a conspiracy thriller set in modern times that centers around a decades-old government cover-up of the existence of extraterrestrial life.

Another novel in the line-up includes The Outworlds: Grey Frontier, a science fiction adventure story set in the 24th century at the fringe of human civilization. One other anticipated novel is Green Bird, a modern-day thriller about an FBI agent's struggle to stop a cyber terrorist before it is too late.

Daniel has studied Political Science, Geography, History, Aviation, Russian Area Studies, and many other topics. He is a veteran of the US Army and a long-term civil servant, having worked many years in the museum profession and federal government. Daniel was born and raised in southern California. With the exception of several years in the greater Washington DC area, Daniel has lived most of his life in the southwestern United States. New Mexico is where he makes his current home along with his spouse, kids, siblings, parents, and various pets and livestock. Daniel enjoys traveling and has visited many locations across the United States, Canada, Mexico, Europe, Middle East, and Caribbean.

story:
Get to Know Us...

The Alicia Rose Victorious Foundation is a non-profit organization committed to providing courage and comfort to hospitalized teens nationwide. We know from personal experience how isolated and bored teens can be during their in-patient stay in a “children’s” hospital. These brave and courageous teens let us know what they needed which led us to the design and implementation of an Activity Journal just for them!


Whether we are providing a teen lounge; providing teen kits and bandana pillows; entertaining teens with a unique one-of-a-kind Totally 4 Teens Activity Journals or even throwing a teen prom, we are passionate about making teens feel more like, well, TEENS!

The purpose of this campaign is to Update, Educate, but mostly Celebrate the importance of just how much these Totally 4 Teens Journals make a difference for kids with cancer and other life-threatening illnesses.

No doubt, with your help, we can reach more than 2,000 hospitalized teens and provide them with this much sought-after Totally 4 Teens Activity Journal.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Reaching our goal of $12,000 allow us to provide 2,000 journals to hospitalized children across the country. We are asking for half of the total cost of publishing and shipping the journals.
  • Because we are mainly in the business of ‘giving,’ we would love to give back to you for your donation. We have some awesome merchandise designed exclusively for the Alicia Rose Victorious Foundation. If we reach our funding goal, you will be rewarded with our “Purple Perks,” including hats, t-shirts, bandana pillows, and so much more!    

  •    


  • If the funding goal is not reached, no worries. ARVF will utilize all funds to update, print, and ship the Totally 4 Teens Activity Journals.


The Impact

  • Life threatening illnesses are scary enough for someone at any age, but put yourself in the shoes of a teenager; missing prom, missing your friends, missing school, missing getting your driver’s license, and sitting in a hospital bed hooked up to an IV pole.  The connections we make and the smiles our foundation gives to these teens is priceless. Wouldn’t you like to be part of someone else’s reason to smile?
  • ARVF strives to continue to support our mission of providing courage and comfort to hospitalized teens. Our mission alone stands out from other foundations. We respect those foundations dedicated to raising funds for cancer research, but we wanted to reach the patients here and now. This time in their life is extremely difficult and we feel as though teens shouldn’t be going through it alone.
  • Your contribution is valuable in so many ways. It will allow us to move forward by reaching a very vulnerable and under-served population of hospitalized teens with cancer and other life-threatening illnesses.
  • Studies have shown that there are many positive benefits of journaling that assist with the healing process.
  • The value of your contribution also allows us to honor survivors, and allows them to have a way of creatively expressing their emotions and experiences.
  • Our local community has successfully supported us. Our success record speaks for itself. but we have over 91 children’s hospitals, who can use YOUR support.
  • To date, we have had requests for the Totally 4 Teens Activity Journals grow from 500 per year to now, 2,000 per year. And it looks like the requests will continue to grow as more and more teens become hospitalized due to a critical illness. With YOUR help, every dollar will make a HUGE difference!


Risks & Challenges

  • Our biggest risk in not achieving our goal is simply that we would not be able to accommodate the requests for our journals, and that we will miss an opportunity to make a child smile, create, or just have a place to vent their emotions. ARVF has persistence in the goals and mission to be achieved. Because of our 12 wonderful years of success, and solid mission statement, we know how to overcome most hurdles we face.
  • Every charity faces challenges when it comes to financial support and fundraising, but we are dedicated to increasing awareness on this campaign by all areas of social media including our Facebook fan page, Twitter, Linkedin, and Instagram accounts, as well as our Constant Contact and e-mail blast distribution lists.


Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can contribute financially to this campaign. No worries. You CAN make a big difference in this campaign by simply getting the word out. If you are reading this now, you know how it works! Share, link, tweet, Instagram, the Indiegogo share tools, etc. Basically, SHARE if you CARE! 

And Thank you!

story:
My name is Noel A. Figueroa. I have been writing poetry for over 20 years. I'm endeavoring to publish a collection of poems called "The Journey Continues" which is a sequel to "One Man's Journey", a collection of poems I self published in May, 2007. The Journey Continues gives readers an even more intimate & personal look of my thoughts, emotions & experiences. This is an opportunity to pre-order "The Journey Continues".

Weather pondering cityscapes (“Love On The A Train”), battling discouragement (“Looking For Morning”), Romantic encounters (“Sands of Dubai”), Ministry issues (“The State of Your Church”), Connecting with God (“Fire Down Below”) or determination (“The Consequences of A Made Up Mind”) readers will be able to connect with the messages conveyed & will be guaranteed to pull something out that will make them think, be inspired & encourage positive dialog.
I desire to continue self-publishing, so my goal is to obtain funding so I can print this project on my own. Your contribution will help bring to life a project that has been delayed for over 5 years. I believe that many will be inspired & encouraged with this release. Both young and old will find something of substance in this book to draw from. Your support is greatly appreciated & I thank you in advance in helping me achieve this goal.

story:
The Last Martyr 

Before the 1st Coming of Christ,

God gave John

– the Last Prophet –

Whose Death Closed

The Old Testament Church Age


Before the 2nd Coming of Christ,

God gives another John

– The Last Martyr –

Whose Death will Close

The New Testament Church Age


The Manuscript for The Last Martyr Is Finished!

Projected Publication Date - April, 2015 -- Contingent On Campaign Success

Help make it happen

---- 000 ---

A Metaphor. 

It’s Beautiful.

Look.  On God’s Finger. Look.

A Butterfly.

---- 000 ---


Catch the Vision!  This campaign is more than publishing a book, or two! 

Its a Vision of touching people beyond pastoral ministry! 

Its a long-time vision of extending my pastoral ministry into the field of writing with multiple goals -- touching lives and strengthening families!


From The Book....

He was a strange looking man, shabbily dressed.  His dusty black jacket was fashioned like an old style drum major uniform.  It was threadbare and had a double-breasted row of dull silver buttons running down its front.  He wore a drab silvery-white cloak that had an insignia across the chest; an insignia that featured an eagle, a winged man, an ox and a lion, symbols of the four evangelists.

At the conclusion of the service the man emerged from the shadows and discretely pulled me aside, away from the congregation as they exited the sanctuary.  He seemed distracted, disturbed, somewhat agitated, and worried.  He also appeared to be frightened, yet keenly observant and decidedly sensitive to everything and everyone in the church building.  He constantly turned his head one way, then another, scanning the crowds of people as they exited the church.  He was looking for something.  Or someone.  He leaned close to me, placing his hand in the small of my back to draw me closer, and then he spoke, yet without ever really looking at me, his eyes constantly scanning the people as they exited the sanctuary.

“This is for you.  Put it in your suit pocket, quickly.”

He hurriedly pulled a manila envelop that contained what appeared to be a small ancient scroll, a rough, faded parchment, from under his coat and handed it to me.  His hands were trembling.

---- 000 ---

So begins the journey of John, The Last Martyr.  Readers will explore Extraordinary Places, including Christ Cathedral: The Church Of The Final Judgment; the Grand Library of Christ Cathedral with its Hidden Treasures and Ancient Artifacts; The Chapel of the Candle, plus mysterious Gothic Cathedrals, Ancient Chapels, Labyrinths, Bell Towers and the other-worldly site of the ancient Menorah whose majestic flames control the flow of time and history.

Through The Last Martyr readers will marvel over the powerful imagery of Towering Frescoes depicting the Great White Throne Judgment, the Judgment Seat of Christ, The Lamb’s Book of Life, and many more mysterious medieval motifs and biblical images.

---- 000 ---

Here’s more from the opening of the book…

Special instructions were given concerning the ancient scroll, titled A Psalm of the Apocalypse:  “I was to translate and eventually interpret A Psalm of the Apocalypse, written by a boy, John the Younger.  It was originally written in New Testament Koine Greek, with some stanzas written in Aramaic.  The translation revealed that the parchment was actually a sonnet, a psalm or psalter of the Apocalypse, comprised of a series of unbalanced verses and poetic stanzas.  In substance, it was a faint foreshadowing of the end of what is and the beginning of what is yet to be. “

About Me

A Call  A Challenge  A Commitment

Destiny is a fragile thing!  Delicate!  So too are dreams -- and choices!  It’s choice, and the consequence of our choices – not chance – that shapes and determines destiny.  Our choice can also hurt or help others fulfill their destiny.

 

I chose to publish my first book at the tender age of 4.  I drew and colored all kinds of stuff, mostly bull frogs and butterflies – and momma stapled the pages together.  My first book! 

My second book?  Fourth grade.  A book of poems and sketches of all kinds of stuff, mostly bull frogs and butterflies.  Momma three-hole-punched the pages and put them into a three-ringed binder.  My second book.

I’m only telling you about these two books because I thought you should know -- I have writing experience.

Then, something happened.  It happened to you too.  You grew up – and so did I.  And, well, many of those childhood dreams sort of fell by the wayside.

Destiny is a fragile thing!  Delicate!  So too are dreams!

I graduated.  Married (Yeah)  A lovely wife.  Three beautiful children.  A mortgage (yech!)  Two dogs.  Double car garage.  You get the idea. But here’s an idea -- the winds of destiny sometimes blow when we least expect them – and in ways we hadn’t anticipated. 

A Call.  God issued a Call to me. (salvation) He issues the same call to each of us.  “The grace of God that brings salvation hath appeared to every man.”  “Be ye saved all ye ends of the earth.”  Then, God sent me a Challenge (full-time ministry).  I responded by making a Commitment (to serve Him as a pastor). 

Now, many decades later I look back as a seasoned pastor and share that I have served three congregations and I’m still running the race in the 24th year of my fourth pastorate.

In the midst of it all I sporadically sensed stirrings that were impossible to ignore yet impossible to fulfill because of the demands and pressures of pastoral ministry– stirrings to write.  Stirrings!  I often suppressed them.  How often did I say, “I wish… I wish…”  But I never did.

I believe you understand.  I really do.

Destiny is a fragile thing!  Delicate!  So too are dreams!

“I wish… I wish… ”  But I never did.

A wish is a hope, a desire to do something that we haven’t yet done. We know how to wish, don’t we?  We know how to wish because we all have hopes, and dreams and desires -- wishes! But, sometimes, dreams, hopes and wishes sort of fall by the wayside.

Can I let you in on a little secret?  I believe sometimes God peeks at us and smiles through the unplanned moments of life!  He does this because He knows all about our forgotten dreams, hopes and wishes.

God peeked and smiled at me through the Walt Disney cartoon character -- Jiminy Cricket.  By Jiminy!  God has a sense of humor!  How do I know?  Imagine, God using a cartoon character of all things.  There He stood, smiling and peeking at me in the midst of one of those unplanned moments of my life.  He pointed his finger at me through Jiminy Cricket who was skipping and dancing across the screen of my television set – and here’s what he said…

When you wish upon a star;

Makes no difference who you are

Anything your heart desires will come to you.

Here’s the message I received -- "it makes no difference who you are" Anyone!  Everyone!  Any age!  Make a wish!  Dream a dream.  And strive to fulfill your destiny!  Do that which God has placed on your heart, and do it well1  By the way, Jesus in John 15:7 tells us to “ask whatever you WISH [theleo], and it will be done for you. [ESV -- English Standard Version]

Writing for me is a delicate thing.  It is a fragile desire, a small part of a larger dream… a destiny rooted in childhood and woven into the fabric of my life. 

One final note in this About Me section.  Every Sunday when I stand to share a message from God I see God’s people, the congregation seated in the Sanctuary.  High above them, near the vaulted ceiling are flags, flags representing 34 American states and the District of Columbia.  In the aftermath of hurricane Katrina our church and community were destroyed and the entire population was displaced.  People from across America came – gave time, money and effort – to build us a new church. 

Each Sunday I have a visual illustration, a reminder of the Grace of God and the Generosity of His people.  We couldn’t have built this new, debt free church without the help and generosity of His people from across the country.  In like manner, this aspect of ministry, this campaign can only be done through grace and generosity – to fulfill the dream.

Destiny is a fragile thing!  Delicate!  So too are dreams!

Sometimes God peeks at us & smiles through the unplanned moments of life!

Jesus is our Hope!  His People -- our Help!

Thank you for visiting my campaign.  I’ve been consumed for more than a year in writing and completing – The Last Martyr – and I’ve felt God’s guidance in many marvelous and mysterious ways!  I have a calm assurance that The Last Martyr will be published – I am convinced of that! 

The Last Martyr focuses on (1) the conflict between science and religion, (2) between atheism and theism, (3) between that which is secular and that which is sacred – from a biblical perspective – cloaked in the context of biblical fiction.

For More About Me….

Jeffries and Hurricane Katrina - PBS Tells Our Story



Why This Story?

Many, within the Christian community, have protested through pen and pulpit, the derelict state of the Christian mind.  This book  -- The Last Martyr  -- introduces and orients the reader to critical biblical thinking -- with a clarity that fosters biblical thought and facilitates Bible comprehension – utilizing the fascinating narration that details the final journey of The Last Martyr!

The Last Martyr  also touches upon other competing Classical and Contemporary ideologies, philosophies, theologies and scientific positions that are currently vogue and viewed as culturally relevant by contemporary thinkers  – while clarifying and contrasting their conflicts and compatibilities with the biblical revelation.

From The Book.... He was a
strange looking man, shabbily dressed. 
His dusty black jacket was fashioned like an old style drum major
uniform.  It was threadbare and had a double-breasted row of dull silver buttons running down its front.  He wore a drab silvery-white cloak that had
an insignia across the chest; an insignia that featured an eagle, a winged man,
an ox and a lion, symbols of the four
evangelists.
At the
conclusion of the service the man emerged from the shadows and discretely pulled
me aside, away from the congregation as they exited the sanctuary.  He seemed distracted, disturbed, somewhat
agitated, and worried.  He also appeared
to be frightened, yet keenly observant and decidedly sensitive
to everything and everyone in the church building.  He constantly turned his head one way, then
another, scanning the crowds of people as they exited the church.  He was looking for something.  Or someone. 
He leaned close to me, placing his hand in the small of my back to draw
me closer, and then he spoke, yet without ever really looking at me, his eyes
constantly scanning the people as they exited the sanctuary. 
“This is
for you.  Put it in your suit pocket,
quickly.”
He
hurriedly pulled a manila envelop that contained what appeared to be a small
ancient scroll, a rough, faded parchment, from under his coat and handed it to
me.  His hands were trembling.
---- 000 ---

So
begins the journey of John, The Last
Martyr.  Readers will explore Extraordinary Places, including Christ Cathedral: The Church Of The Final
Judgment; the Grand Library of Christ Cathedral with its Hidden Treasures
and Ancient Artifacts; The Chapel of the
Candle, plus mysterious Gothic
Cathedrals, Ancient Chapels, Labyrinths, Bell Towers and the other-worldly site of the ancient Menorah whose majestic flames control
the flow of time and history.
Through The Last Martyr readers will marvel over
the powerful imagery of Towering Frescoes
depicting the Great White Throne
Judgment, the Judgment Seat of
Christ, The Lamb’s Book of Life, and many more mysterious medieval motifs
and biblical images. 
---- 000 ---

story:
Berim is about getting people outside of Iran to advocate for policies that give support Iranian social entrepenuers.  Let me explain: 
 Over 60% of Iran's population is under 30 and are educated, tech savy. Everyday there are people in Iran are doing awesome things from job training for women, conserving the environment and advocating for clean air. 
Instead of standing by these everyday heroes the international community is enacting policies that make their lives harder.  Policies like sanctions are the economic equivalent of cluster bombs.  They don't discriminate. They make it harder for activists in Iran to get access to technology and cutting edge tools we enjoy in the west to run effective campaigns. 

We can change this.  There are politicians in Australia and the United States and all over the world that want to do better on Iran.  However as representatives they can't act unless we show that their communities are behind them.  By standing together and pushing for better policies in our countries we can help give the people in Iran the space they need to create change.  
 
Helping build a free Iran is a key step to creating peace in the Middle East.  The Iranian Government sends weapons to Syria so that Assad can eliminate his opposition.  Also when people in the Iranian Government make deeply anti-semitic statements they make it harder to have sensible critiques of Israel. 
 
By standing with the people of Iran we also safeguard our rights. When we allow our Governments in Australia, the US etc to trample over the rights of others we create the pathway for them to take away our rights as well.  That's why things like the patriot act and the anti terrorism laws passed.  Drones started as something that would only ever be used in other countries and now they can be used on us, no trials or due process necessary. 
 
Can you become a founding member of Berim and give us $100 help us bring together people outside of Iran to advocate for policies that give everyday heroes in Iran the space they need to create a free Iran? 
 
Where will my money go? 
 
Collecting stories about how sanctions are impacting everyday Iranians. 
 
Producing infographics and videos that explain why policies like sanctions are making it harder for Iranians to create change in Iran. 
 
Hold our governments to account by running campaigns that highlight the polices we are enacting that are hindering the ability of social innovators in Iran to be effective. 
 
Berim is based on a model that's used by GetUp, MoveOn and Avaaz and proven to be effective around the world.  The approach of getting people outside of Iran to advocate for foreign policies that give Iranians inside the country the space they need to organise for change is new.  It's exciting and has the potential to benefit not only the people of Iran but dramatically change our foreign policies.  In a few years when Berim has hundreds and thousands of members and has turned to into 'the next big thing' you'll be able to look back and say 'I helped start that'.

story:
A Second Campaign?

For those that don't know, I ran a campaign for this book last year to fund the high cost of editing, and to get a few initial copies of the hardcover and paperback as well. Well now I am seeing that there are a lot more costs I hadn't anticipated. So I am running another short-and-dirty funding campaign, same as the first, to cover the rest of what I will need to get the book published.The book is now written, and fully edited. The cover is designed and finished, the interior of all versions (ePub, paperback, hardcover) is finished. There is simply nothing else left to do now but publish. But I need just a little more help to do that.

About Me

I am a new author, and this is my first book, a labor of love that has taken ten years to complete. I am normally a full time professional artist well known for my werewolf and anthropomorphic artwork. However I have always loved reading, and I was writing from a young age, well before I began doing art. I have always wanted to be an author, however I never thought it was in me to be one. But this book has shown me that not only is it possible, it has awakened in me a new love for writing I've never fully experienced before. The world I am writing about, and the characters that have come to me, have consumed me whole. I am addicted to their story, and it is far from finished. I have a whole series planned, fully written in my head. I just need your help to get this first book published.
(I am going to be using a pen name—Christie Goldenwulfe—for my books, mainly because I want to keep my art and romantica (romantic erotica) writing separate from one another. I generally keep my art "G" to "PG-13" at the most, but my writing is where I express and explore other parts of myself, and for now my writing is a hard "R" or even "X" rating.)

About The Book

Hunger is a dark, paranormal romance bordering on the erotic (this is a mature, adult romance novel on the spicy side.  Meaning there is graphic sex scenes and profanities used.  Ohhh myyy!  18+ please!).  It is based on my werewolf race I have been developing for decades, the Kierrn, and is full of wildness, passion, eroticism, and darkness.  Yet there is also humor, moments of tenderness, joy, and genuine love and caring between the two main characters.  I love my characters and my story, and I hope you will too.

Please read the plot summary below, and if you are curious, I have made the first two chapters available to read for free to help you decide it you like my style, and my story.  If you are intrigued by the characters and enjoy where the story is going, please consider contributing to this campaign!  I am offering the book and some fun perks for your contribution.  While the book itself will be available via Amazon.com and other online sources, these perks will only be available through this campaign and may not be available in the future!

Plot Summary

Supernatural abilities, arcane magic, killer good looks, animalistic allure… what’s not to love about being a werewolf?  Kain Ulmer wouldn’t change what he is for the world. He lives a carefree transient life where the only thing that matters is the next woman, the next conquest, the next thrill.  The Hunger is the price he pays, the curse that demands he make a human kill every three moons or risk madness.  Yet he considers the cost worth the rewards of ultimate power and freedom.  Kain has everything he could want—until fate brings him to her...

Autumn Sullivan has the perfect life. She lives in the most beautiful place in the world, a cottage nestled in the sanctuary of an ancient redwood forest.  She has realized her dream of owning a beautiful little coffee shop in the quiet Northern California town where she grew up, and her life is free from the complications of men and relationships. Just her and her friends, her shop, her redwoods, and her safe, simple life—until a dark, dangerous stranger disrupts her world and send her passions flaming.

Kain is determined to win this guarded creature, but he cannot know the wild desires they will awaken in one another, nor the danger he will bring to her doorstep. An evil even Kain cannot fathom targets Autumn, and they both must race to find answers, and a safe haven, before the Hunger catches up to them both.

Want more? Read the first two chapters for free on my website!

Formats

Hunger will also be available in eBook format, both for Kindle and other devices.
Hunger will be available as a 5.25" X 8" Trade paperback and will be 330 pages. 
Finally, Hunger will be available as a 6" X 9" hardcover with cloth binding and a dust jacket.  It will be about 350 pages.  What is special about the hardcover edition is it will feature a ten page "Sketchbook" with exclusive drawings I have done in my own sketchbook of the characters, certain scenes, and maps of the area.

Design

From cover to the last page I have meticulously designed this book according to all the current book design guidelines. It is an easy read and is everything you would expect to see from a "big name" publisher.

What I Need, and What You'll Get

I now need to cover the costs of copyrighting, formatting costs, misc. publishing fees, and I want to get a few more copies of the paperback and hardcover to sell on my website and at the shows that I do. I figure it will cost around $3,000 to cover all of that.

I will be officially launching this book on all platforms on June 21, 2016. I am considering this campaign to be the pre-pre-orders, which means everyone that contributes to this campaign (and of course those who contributed to the original campaign) will get the printed book at least two weeks before the official release date (I am estimating I will get them in by June 8th or so). Also, anyone who contributed to my first campaign for Hunger, and anyone that contributes $8 or over to this campaign will get the eBook for -free-. Not only that, all eBooks will go out as soon as the campaign ends on May 18th, well before the official release date. And not only that, but you can contribute for perks that won't be available after the campaign! 

Perks!

As part of your contribution to my campaign you will receive the book and other neat perks!  All print books will be signed, and come with this two-sided bookmark of the main (male) character, Kain in his human and werewolf forms. There will be an additional shipping cost for printed books.

  • $8 - eBook.  You will receive a digital copy of the book for Kindle, Nook, and all other eReaders.
  • $15 - Paperback.  You will get the signed 5.25 X 8 paperback with a Kain bookmark and the free eBook
  • $25 - Hardcover.  The hardcover contains illustrations not available in any other format.  The hardcover will be signed, and will include the Kain bookmark as well as a Dragonfly Coffee & Espresso (Autumn's business in the book) vinyl sticker!  You will also get the free eBook.


  • $60 - Surprise Surprise! You will receive the signed, illustrated hardcover, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, a "Shift Happens" sticker, the free eBook and a little extra surprise (it's a pretty awesome surprise IMHO!)



  • $100 - Shift Happens.  You will receive the signed, illustrated hardcover, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, a "Shift Happens" sticker, the eBook, and I will draw a werewolf for you on the inside cover of the book.  This drawing will be exclusively yours and no two drawings will be alike!

Shipping

Shipping for printed books is extra and will be added to your perk contribution. All eBooks will be sent out just as soon as this campaign ends. Printed books will be ordered the moment the funds are disbursed to me, and I will begin shipping immediately once I have them in my hot little hands. Most everyone should have their books and goodies before the official release date of June 21st!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my book!

Thank you for looking at my funding campaign!

story:
¿Qué?

El silencio de las medusas es una mirada al pasado, a la infancia, de modo que el lector es capaz de identificar sensaciones, quizás olvidadas, siguiendo los pasos de Marina a través del recuerdo.

Marina mira hacia atrás y recuerda su infancia y su adolescencia en un intento de reconciliarse con su familia y poder aceptar lo que fue y lo que es ahora. Con ella nos vamos introduciendo en un mundo donde la ternura y la inocencia se mezclan con una visión irónica del mundo. La protagonista nos va presentando una sociedad  no tan lejana que va cambiando al ritmo de sus sentimientos y a una familia donde habita, como en casi todas,  la incomprensión y también el amor.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Pilar Tuero.

Nacida en Oviedo en 1964, estudió filología anglo-germánica en la universidad de dicha ciudad, donde se licenció en 1988. Actualmente imparte clases de inglés en un instituto de Educación Secundaria en la misma ciudad. Compagina la escritura con otras actividades como la fotografía, el teatro o su blog de cocina.

El silencio de las medusas es su primera novela  pero su segundo libro, ya que en abril de 2016 salió a la luz el  libro de microrrelatos  Primavera y otras estaciones. Pilar ha ganado diversos premios de relatos y microrelatos a nivel regional y nacional. Participa regularmente con artículos de impresión en  páginas web de Villaviciosa (Asturias) y su pasión por los libros le ha impulsado a crear un taller de lectura en dicha localidad.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El silencio de las medusas que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Pilar Tuero vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Who I Am:

I've been in the book business for years. I worked for an independent publisher for five years, doing ad design, contracts, editorial work, and cover layout. I spent 12 years at Barnes & Noble, eight of that in a management position. I currently work in a library.

I've also been writing and self-publishing for the past five years, with enough success that I've had other authors pitch really exciting projects to me that they want me to publish. 

I know the book business from just about every angle! 

It's been a dream of mine for decades to start my own indie publishing company, and a dream to help other authors realize their dreams as well! The business has been formed - kOZMIC Press LLC with two imprints, kOZMIC Kids and kOZMIC Classics -- and I have the experience I need to get it going, but my pockets aren't very deep, and I could use a little help raising some start-up capital! 

 

How YOU Can Help:

While all the basics have been achieved (business license, new equipment, new software, bank accounts, etc), I could really use some additional funding to help out in these areas:

  • Artwork Commissions - All books need artwork, right? Covers, interior illustrations, etc. One of my upcoming projects is a children's picture book called Lucy Can't Dance, and an illustrator (Stephanie Jackson) has already begun work. It's about a shy, awkward little girl who learns to come out of her shell. I'm really excited about this project and can't wait to get it out into the world. Don't let Lucy down! Help her and her friends come to life!  
  • Marketing - We have to get the word out about out titles! And every new book requires a new marketing strategy. Lucy Can't Dance will need to be marketed to bookstores, schools, libraries, and specialty stores. 
  • Other Authors - Some extra funds will help me get to a position where I can start taking on some of the other exciting projects that I've been pitched, which will help with advances and initial royalties. Plus, new authors writing new books need artwork, so that brings us back to the first point. And their books have to be marketed, so second point! 
  • Copy Editing - I'll need to hire professional proofreaders and copy editors to make sure every book is ready to be published! 
  • Accounting - I need to find someone to help me keep my books in order.

 

What Impact Your Contribution Will Make:

I firmly believe that art and expression are vital to human happiness and fulfillment. I want to be a part of giving other authors a voice and a stepping stone to bigger successes, and eventually grow my little business into a bigger success itself! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Whether or not you're able to donate, please share this link anyplace you think it'll find someone interested in it. That in itself would be a great help!
