story:
Short Summary

Generation Zinance: A Personal Finance and Investing Guide for Gen Z is an introductory book that explores the unique way that Gen Z interacts with money and invests, making financial matters not only easier, but also beneficial for them.

My name is Ella Gupta and I am the author of Generation Zinance. I wrote this book because I realized that there were not a lot of personal finance or investing books available that were specific to Gen Z. Millennials and Gen Z are often clumped together, but the two generations are actually radically different. Gen Z has a unique view of and mindset concerning money.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that finance and investing do not have to be complicated! I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for personal finance through this book. Ultimately, I want you to see this as a tool to help you take control of your financial future and feel empowered by money.

In Generation Zinance, you'll learn how the unique landscape in which Gen Z grew up and the wealth of tools and resources at our disposal can make Gen Z the most financially successful generation ever. This book will include:

  • Insights from financial experts whom I have personally interviewed, including:

- Jennifer Barrett, Chief Education Officer at Acorns

- Tim Sheehan, Co-founder and CEO of Greenlight

- Louis Barajas, CNBC Financial Advisor Council and Certified Financial Planner

- Andrew Ross Sorkin, Co-anchor of CNBC’s Squawk Box, New York Times columnist

- Jill Schlesinger, CBS Business News Analyst

- Lauryn Williams, 4x Olympian and Certified Financial Planner

- Neale Godfrey, New York Times #1 Bestselling Author

  • Stories from members of Gen Z who have found financial success
  • My personal story of how I have been fortunate enough to have made thousands of dollars investing

If you want a relatable and engaging guide to the world of personal finance, this book is definitely for you!

Generation Zinance is a nonfiction book that speaks to high school students and college students who want to look at personal finance and investing in a new way. Even if you are not a member of Generation Z, this book is meant to be an interactive guidebook for everyone.

 

The Book


The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. It introduces the aspects of Gen Z that make them unique, insights from the history of investing, and prepares you for the journey by teaching you how to develop your money mindset.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-8. This section will dive into personal finance topics, including saving, credit/debt, compound interest, taxes, and insurance.

Part 3 contains chapters 9-14. It introduces the stock market, discusses why it is necessary to invest, includes actionable ways to begin investing, and explores the unprecedented democratization and accessibility of investing.

Part 4 contains chapters 15-18. It includes information on unique topics such as investing apps, fractional shares, cashless payment systems, mobile banking, and socially responsible investing.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get
 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Ella Gupta is a student at Cary Academy in North Carolina.

She wrote this book because she realized that personal finance is a critical life skill that is not being taught in schools. She hopes that this book empowers her readers to take charge of their financial futures and allows them to make their money work for them.

She is a member of her school’s cross country team and debate team. She is also passionate about the environment and sustainability.

For more information, you can connect with Ella Gupta at ella_gupta@caryacademy.org and at @ellagupta on Instagram.
 

Risks and Challenges 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #generationzinance and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ella Gupta

Short Summary
Generation Zinance: A Personal Finance and Investing Guide for Gen Z is an introductory book that explores the unique way that Gen Z interacts with money and invests, making financial matters not only easier, but also beneficial for them.My name is Ella Gupta and I am the author of Generation Zinance. I wrote this book because I realized that there were not a lot of personal finance or investing books available that were specific to Gen Z. Millennials and Gen Z are often clumped together, but the two generations are actually radically different. Gen Z has a unique view of and mindset concerning money.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that finance and investing do not have to be complicated! I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for personal finance through this book. Ultimately, I want you to see this as a tool to help you take control of your financial future and feel empowered by money.In Generation Zinance, you'll learn how the unique landscape in which Gen Z grew up and the wealth of tools and resources at our disposal can make Gen Z the most financially successful generation ever. This book will include:
Insights from financial experts whom I have personally interviewed, including:
- Jennifer Barrett, Chief Education Officer at Acorns
- Tim Sheehan, Co-founder and CEO of Greenlight
- Louis Barajas, CNBC Financial Advisor Council and Certified Financial Planner
- Andrew Ross Sorkin, Co-anchor of CNBC’s Squawk Box, New York Times columnist
- Jill Schlesinger, CBS Business News Analyst
- Lauryn Williams, 4x Olympian and Certified Financial Planner
- Neale Godfrey, New York Times #1 Bestselling Author

Stories from members of Gen Z who have found financial success
My personal story of how I have been fortunate enough to have made thousands of dollars investing

If you want a relatable and engaging guide to the world of personal finance, this book is definitely for you!Generation Zinance is a nonfiction book that speaks to high school students and college students who want to look at personal finance and investing in a new way. Even if you are not a member of Generation Z, this book is meant to be an interactive guidebook for everyone.

 
The Book
The book is written in 4 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. It introduces the aspects of Gen Z that make them unique, insights from the history of investing, and prepares you for the journey by teaching you how to develop your money mindset.Part 2 contains chapters 3-8. This section will dive into personal finance topics, including saving, credit/debt, compound interest, taxes, and insurance.Part 3 contains chapters 9-14. It introduces the stock market, discusses why it is necessary to invest, includes actionable ways to begin investing, and explores the unprecedented democratization and accessibility of investing.Part 4 contains chapters 15-18. It includes information on unique topics such as investing apps, fractional shares, cashless payment systems, mobile banking, and socially responsible investing.

story:
Overview

This story was created by kids for kids!

This book is the product of a workshop by Jesse B. Creative to transform kids ages 8-12 into published authors!

A special thank you to this workshop's sponsor, Talent All-Stars Inc. (SF), who made this opportunity available to the youth. 

 

Story

This hilarious and unique story follows a Ghost Dog, Halloween Cat, and Christmas Bunny who live in a magical house that is equal parts Halloween-themed and Christmas-themed. Since these three main characters can't seem to play nice and get along, Santa bans them from the most anticipated party of the year until they learn to work together as a team. 

Will our heroes be able to work out their differences in time? Or, will they be doomed to sit outside and watch the fantastical creatures of their world prance past them into the party with big smiles, high energy, and presents?

 

Meet the Team Behind this Book

Anja W. | Author

Anja (8 years old) loves tacos and anything with lemon. She's a fan of drawing, playing piano, and planning parties for her cats. Her favorite part of making this book was drawing the scenes for the story.

*Stay tuned! Throughout the campaign as we share more of the brilliant young minds who co-created this story*

Jesse Byrd | Workshop Lead, Co-Writer & Art Director

Jesse is an award-winning children's book editor and writer whose family has been in publishing for over 31 years with New York Times Bestselling works to their credit. Believing so much in the book created by these kids, Jesse's helping to lead this campaign to assure the project makes the most of every dime raised and this book receives its deserved exposure.

Rev Valdez | Illustrator

Rev Valdez is a Filipino-American illustrator based in Brentwood, CA. He’s helped take this story, created by a group of kids, and transform it into a professional-grade children's picture book. Rev is passionate about infusing humor and heart into all of his artwork.

Serita Braxton | Campaign Manager & Editor

 

Serita Braxton is a professional writer and published author from Maryland but based in Spain. Her wanderlust carries her all over the globe where she writes for various publications. Serita has lent her vast expertise to editing this book and using her network and talents to help this campaign be the best it can be.  
 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

 

Distribution: Our biggest challenge will be placement in bookstores and libraries. Even with over 50% of book sales taking place via Amazon, we are passionate about having a local presence in small and chain bookstores. We have a growing list of ideal locations and will be updating you here as we add new libraries, bookstores, gift shops, and organizations partner to carry this book!

Being Evergreen: It is critical that we build a true and lasting community to expand the lifespan of this work. Book purchases for schools, libraries, and organizations will be incredibly helpful!
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

Every purchase, referral, and mention amongst your network truly matters. If you're unable to help fuel this mission financially, please help us out by sharing the word amongst your social and personal circles!

 

About This Program That Helped Create This Book:

This book is the first in a series by Black-owned children's book publishing company,  Jesse B. Creative, to transform kids into published picture book authors!

Jesse B's 10-session workshop takes a group of kids ages 8-12 through the fundamentals of storytelling, writing, and design via an interactive experience.  

We want to empower kids and let them know their thoughts, creativity, and words have weight. Every book sale helps drive home the message that what they make matters.

story:
Thanks so much for your interest in our project! 

Try reading the passage below.  The goal is to demonstrate what a student with spatial recognition problems might see.

 

Th        ey    k   heco     t      e k  tc       a     B     y      sheq t.

     enth   too  t          rn  oth     i    hen  nq  ets   wa         i

-F.A.T. City Workshop

 

Figured it out?  The sentence reads:  Then they took the corn to the kitchen and Betsy washed it.

Not only do you have to put the letters together on the same line, sometimes letter “d” could be letter “b,” or even letter “q”. 

Now imagine having to read it aloud in class.  What if the other kids complained when it was your turn to read?   What if the teacher said, “Look harder, sound it out.”   Or worse yet, what if you heard your teacher talk about how you are just lazy and aren’t really trying? 

As a teacher, I know, unfortunately, students with learning disabilities face situations like this more often than we realize.  Not all teachers act this way, but many can. 

 

How much would you like YOURSELF if this were your daily struggle? 

 

After several years of teaching, I began to realize that students who felt they failed all the time, had poor self-confidence.  Not only that, they had fewer friends, and suffered socially, more so than their peers.  This seemed especially true for students who struggled academically.  I finally realized that even in a supportive classroom, students who struggle needed a way to build confidence. 

That’s why I designed something that makes it easy for all children to do something they can be proud of.  I've given them attainable goals, that aren't just academically focused.  Being kind to others, keeping their work area clean, listening during learning sessions, and interacting with others are just a few goals every kid can strive for. 

Though positive behavior reinforcement is not new, what I have created is unique. 

Come see the beautifully illustrated children’s book about a fairy, named Clary Sage, that shows up to be the teacher's helper.  This fairy helps the teacher, Mrs. Pincushion, watch for all the positive things students do throughout the day.  This could be an act of kindness, or listening quietly while the teacher is speaking.  The fairy in the story leaves treats on student desks for clean work areas as well. 

It's a story every guardian could read to their child nightly!  It doesn't have to be used solely as a teacher's tool!

 

The best part is that I’ve included paper doll fairies in the back of the book!  Each book contains a paper doll fairy of both Clary Sage and Foxglove.  Kids can cut them out and play with them.  Or, if this is used with a group of children as a positive behavior experience, after the teacher reads them the story, she introduces their very own classroom fairy!  Use just one fairy, or use both.  The teacher is able to move the fairy around the classroom each day.  The book also includes a sticker chart that enables the teacher to keep up with students who earn rewards. I've also included some directions on how to implement the behavior system if used with groups of children.  The benefit also extends to students without disabilities.  A more positive behavior approach creates a better classroom environment for everyone. 

It's easy, fast, affordable, and all contained within one book!  And kids love it! 

 

This system isn’t limited to school classrooms. 

 

Anyone who works with groups of children can use this as a positive behavior technique.  It can be used in day care facilities, Sunday school programs, summer camps, after-school programs, and extra-curricular classes such as dance or martial arts. 

It also makes a great gift for people who work with children, or for children in general! 

 

Attainable goals throughout the day!

 

Here are some more rough sketches of our work in progress:

 

A complete positive behavior system is found inside a paperback children’s book.  It’s easy to carry, very affordable, and exciting for students.  The book is already written and the illustrations are already in progress.  They simply need to be printed and shipped to you.

 

Since I've chosen a flexible goal, you will receive your perk whether or not the project meets it intended goal!

 

Another benefit is that a portion of every purchase is donated to both Learning Disabilities Association of America and Autism Research Institute.

If you are looking for a good cause, I assure you this is it.  Though I have no learning disabilities myself, two of my three children have autism.  I’ve seen this struggle through the eyes of both a teacher and a parent.  My hope is not to change them, but to help them manage life better, and to obtain some level of confidence, in order to become more independent.

No one likes to feel like a failure at everything, all the time.  It's during these delicate years of childhood, that we must catch these false ideas and toss them aside.  Many children will only believe in themselves, if you believe in them first.  Let's work together to show them something we ourselves already know.

           They are worthy.

 

*Please share our cause with others*

story:
Story of My Book

Be A Learn-It-All is a book that explores the growth mindset and different strategies for lifelong learning .

My name is Jen Vermet, and I am the author of Be a Learn-it-all. I wrote this book because I wanted to inspire and encourage others to not give up their curiosity of learning new things after formal education ends. I want others to take the reins of their learning through being exposed to what other options are available.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover inspiring stories and research for the unlimited potential you can unleash during the longevity of your life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for lifelong learning in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you reach your educational goals through developing a strategy and tapping into your curiosity to ultimately be a lifelong learner within all aspects of your life.

In this book, you'll learn about up-skilling and experimentation:
  • My personal journey of discovering how to learn differently through shifting my mindset
  • An account of different mental tools and modes of learning through a better understanding of our brain
  • Inspiring stories of other’s learning journeys from applying what they discover to their life

You will love this book if you are interested in optimizing your learning or looking to be inspired about different ways on your journey to learn through reframing your mindset and become a self-directed learner, a Learn-it-all. 

Be A Learn-It-All is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults and business professionals who are looking to explore different learning options to take advantage of. I want to see this book being used as a proactive tool to encourage learning over the longevity of a lifetime. 

 

The Book - Be a Learn-it-all

The book is written in 3 Parts.


Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-5. In the introduction, I share how I faced a blind spot with an incorrect perception of myself, and how I started my own learning journey to develop my weaknesses. The science of learning, history of education, and defining what a “Learn-it-all” is will be described as well.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. These are based on different strategies readers can experiment with. They will learn about self-education, self-awareness, self-assessment, and experiential learning. The reader can discover starting points where they can start their own learning journey as I did with taking different assessments, creating mindful habits, exploring different mediums, signing up for courses, and finding inspiring communities.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-15. This part of the book will look to the future with a glimpse of the knowledge industry and how companies are looking for Learn-it-all attributes to hire. It will showcase how educating yourself is crucial for the future in this volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous world. The time relevance of skillsets keeps shrinking. The linear life path will no longer be the status quo in the future, instead there will be multiple stages.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall 2019
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Jen Vermet is a student of life. She is a young professional who graduated from Miami University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance and a minor in Management and Leadership. She is an advisory analyst in leadership development within Korn Ferry in Chicago, Illinois. In December 2018, Jen became a leadership graduate from the Dale Carnegie course and is an active member of Toastmaster’s International.

Jen wrote this book because she strives to keep challenging herself to continue learning. She became aware of her fixed mindset after reading Carol Dweck’s book Mindset The New Psychology of Success. She now strives to maintain a growth mindset. Jen wanted to pass on what she learned to others for their own benefit of self-growth.

Adventure and traveling abroad are some of the learning experiences Jen loves most while being immersed in a foreign culture. She attained a thematic sequence in Dutch Culture and Communication during her semester at the University of Amsterdam in 2017. She grew up living partly in the water on swim team and sailing. She was the marketing chair for the club swim team in college and has raced the longest freshwater sailing distance race in the world across Lake Michigan.

Some of her favorite things are journaling, listening to podcasts in her Mini Cooper, sharing stories, Dutch cheese, passport stamps, walking fluffy golden doodles, photography, getting lost in a new city, and long bike rides.

This book is a call to action to encourage continuous learning.

If you’d like more information, you can connect with Jen via email at vermetjl@gmail.com, on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifervermet/, and on Medium or Twitter @JenVermet.


My grandmother has been a role model throughout my life to be a Learn-it-all and currently struggles with Alzheimer's. Once my book's publishing costs are fully funded, I will donate the proceeds from the book's sales to the Alzheimer's Association.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LearnItAll and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support! Once my book's publishing costs are fully funded I will donate 100% of the book's sale to the Alzheimer's Association. 

Thanks again,
Jen Vermet

In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for lifelong learning in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you reach your educational goals through developing a strategy and tapping into your curiosity to ultimately be a lifelong learner within all aspects of your life.In this book, you'll learn about up-skilling and experimentation:
My personal journey of discovering how to learn differently through shifting my mindset
An account of different mental tools and modes of learning through a better understanding of our brain
Inspiring stories of other’s learning journeys from applying what they discover to their life

You will love this book if you are interested in optimizing your learning or looking to be inspired about different ways on your journey to learn through reframing your mindset and become a self-directed learner, a Learn-it-all. Be A Learn-It-All is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults and business professionals who are looking to explore different learning options to take advantage of. I want to see this book being used as a proactive tool to encourage learning over the longevity of a lifetime. 
 
The Book - Be a Learn-it-all

The book is written in 3 Parts.
Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-5. In the introduction, I share how I faced a blind spot with an incorrect perception of myself, and how I started my own learning journey to develop my weaknesses. The science of learning, history of education, and defining what a “Learn-it-all” is will be described as well.Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. These are based on different strategies readers can experiment with. They will learn about self-education, self-awareness, self-assessment, and experiential learning. The reader can discover starting points where they can start their own learning journey as I did with taking different assessments, creating mindful habits, exploring different mediums, signing up for courses, and finding inspiring communities.Part 3 contains Chapters 10-15. This part of the book will look to the future with a glimpse of the knowledge industry and how companies are looking for Learn-it-all attributes to hire. It will showcase how educating yourself is crucial for the future in this volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous world. The time relevance of skillsets keeps shrinking. The linear life path will no longer be the status quo in the future, instead there will be multiple stages. 
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October 2019
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall 2019
 When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

About the Author
Jen Vermet is a student of life. She is a young professional who graduated from Miami University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance and a minor in Management and Leadership. She is an advisory analyst in leadership development within Korn Ferry in Chicago, Illinois. In December 2018, Jen became a leadership graduate from the Dale Carnegie course and is an active member of Toastmaster’s International.Jen wrote this book because she strives to keep challenging herself to continue learning. She became aware of her fixed mindset after reading Carol Dweck’s book Mindset The New Psychology of Success. She now strives to maintain a growth mindset. Jen wanted to pass on what she learned to others for their own benefit of self-growth.Adventure and traveling abroad are some of the learning experiences Jen loves most while being immersed in a foreign culture. She attained a thematic sequence in Dutch Culture and Communication during her semester at the University of Amsterdam in 2017. She grew up living partly in the water on swim team and sailing. She was the marketing chair for the club swim team in college and has raced the longest freshwater sailing distance race in the world across Lake Michigan.Some of her favorite things are journaling, listening to podcasts in her Mini Cooper, sharing stories, Dutch cheese, passport stamps, walking fluffy golden doodles, photography, getting lost in a new city, and long bike rides.This book is a call to action to encourage continuous learning.
If you’d like more information, you can connect with Jen via email at vermetjl@gmail.com, on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifervermet/, and on Medium or Twitter @JenVermet.
My grandmother has been a role model throughout my life to be a Learn-it-all and currently struggles with Alzheimer's. Once my book's publishing costs are fully funded, I will donate the proceeds from the book's sales to the Alzheimer's Association.
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LearnItAll and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 
Thank you so much of all of your love and support! Once my book's publishing costs are fully funded I will donate 100% of the book's sale to the Alzheimer's Association. Thanks again,Jen Vermet

story:
Why Fables?

Not only are fables part of public school curriculum, but they have been a benchmark of didactic literature for thousands of years. The reasons are obvious. Tell a child a proverb and he or she may ignore you. But tell it through the mouth of a lion or a dragon or a cute little field mouse and all of a sudden you have a listening ear!  

After publishing six children's books over the course of three years, I have become convinced that while teaching children to love reading is a good thing, teaching them to love others is better. And I've discovered that fables can help in that endeavor. 

 

The Book and the Mission (what you get)

There are hundreds of campaigns, charitable organizations, and products you can support financially. There are also hundreds of books you can buy right now in a store. But here's why I think you'll benefit from partnering with me:

  • The Big Cat Spat blends the old-school comic wit of Dr. Seuss and Bugs Bunny with the sharp proverbial wisdom of Aesop and Solomon. In other words, you'll be pre-ordering a bookstore quality hardcover book that will make your kids and grandkids laugh hysterically while also teaching them a valuable lesson about pride and the need to accept others.
  • Furthermore, when you pre-order the book, you'll also be giving to charity in the process. 15% of all funds go directly to helping feed, clothe and educate orphaned children throughout the world and I'm privileged to partner with Carol Adams and her Non-Government Organization called Y.E.S. Uganda. Carol raises and serves orphaned children there in Uganda, so visit her website at www.caroladamsministry.com to learn about the wonderful work she and her team are doing there in Africa.

 

Why $3,000?

  • Writing, illustrating, and publishing bookstore quality children's books is an expensive endeavor and one that has placed me in debt over the past two years.
  • Illustrations for a 40-50 page book cost around $1,500 (and that is actually an inexpensive price compared to most professional artists). For this book, the illustrations are already paid off.
  • The Chinese printing press I use (that prints for hundreds of publishers and thousands of authors) uses standard "press printing" which is the highest quality. However, it also means that the minimum amount of books I can print is 250. To print that few, the price per book is high and leaves me no room for profit. In fact, when factoring in the cost of illustrations, shipping, and time spent, I actually lose money. Thus, it is only ever reasonable for me to buy between 500-1000 books, because the cost per book drops significantly. To print 500 books will cost me a little over $3,000. 
  • Ultimately, I would love to be able to order a thousand copies of The Big Cat Spat. As with my last two books, that would give me the ability to donate 100-200 books to various schools throughout North Carolina. I'll also be able to donate books to hospitals, day care centers, and literacy programs across the US. 

All in all, thank you for your interest in my stories! Thank you for your pre-order and partnership. Stories, like seeds, don't get very far unless they are spread by others.

God bless,

J.S. Davey

www.thefictionforest.com

story:
This autobiography will be a significant contribution to the literature of African-American spiritual traditions. Born in Pocahontas, Mississippi as Mary Robin Adams, the future voodoo priestess grew up on a sharecropper’s farm. From an early age she experienced visions and prophetic dreams and found her earliest spiritual connection in local Baptist revival services. In Chicago she became involved in African-American churches that practiced “Spiritism,” a melding of Old Testament and Christianity with divination, ritual contact with the Spirit World, and the making of potions and charms. Priestess Miriam devoted her life to Jesus Christ, but knows the dark side of Spiritism (in Chicago she survived a black magic curse). Having sharpened her skills as seer and healer, a vision compelled her to move to New Orleans, where she started her first church in the Ninth Ward and began ministering to the disenfranchised poor. Priestess Miriam recently celebrated her 25th anniversary in New Orleans, where her still evolving practice blends Roman Catholicism, Voodoo, and Native American spirituality.

I see this project as a return to my professional roots writing about religion and spirituality, such as my exclusive interview with His Holiness The Dalai Lama and a companion feature on the Tibetan refugee community in India for Yoga Journal, and my first book, Spirit in the Land: Beyond Time and Space with America’s Channelers, a cross-country chronicle of America’s “spiritual awakening.”

As the Spirit was talking to me will be a compelling portrait of one person’s amazing spiritual odyssey, a journey into the mysteries of one of the world’s most intriguing (and misunderstood) religions, and a celebration of what is, arguably, America’s most exotic “story book” city.

—Mark Cotta Vaz

 

And now Priestess Miriam would like to share an ancient prayer to St. Joseph:

O St. Joseph, whose protection is so great, so strong, so prompt before the throne of God, I place in thee all my interests and desires. O St. Joseph, assist me by thy powerful intercession and obtain for me all spiritual blessings through thy foster Son, Jesus Christ Our Lord, so that, having engaged here below thy heavenly power, I may offer thee my thanksgiving and homage.

O St. Joseph, I never weary contemplating thee and Jesus asleep in thine arms. I dare not approach while He reposes near thy heart. Press Him in my name and kiss His fine head for me, and ask Him to return the kiss when I draw my dying breath.

St. Joseph, patron of departing souls, pray for me.

If you're interested in finding out more about Priestess Miriam and the Voodoo Spiritual Temple in New Orleans, visit their facebook page here:

https://www.facebook.com/voodoospiritualtemple/

story:
1. Officially I'm C. Robert Cales, author of paranormal thrillers, but to some readers I'm ScaryBob. I'm also the Creative Director at ScaryBob Productions, an ebook publisher providing content to Amazon and iTunes. I'm seeking funds for a public relations and advertising campaign designed to introduce me throughout the United States and Canada and to promote my second novel, The Bookseller.  

My introduction to the world is the final step of a journey that began the day I was born with a triple dose of imagination. On my birthday there was an apparent failure at the cosmic pre-birth brain wiring and programming station. As a result my strengths were all downloaded to my imagination file instead of being distributed across the spectrum.

In the summer of my tenth year I became addicted to horror at the hands of Christopher Lee as Dracula. That experience sent me on a lifelong journey to find the next great scare, which proved to be somewhat elusive.

When I was sixteen that triple dose of imagination started demanding an outlet. I thought about making movies, but even to my teenage mind the start-up costs were prohibitive. Pen and paper, on the other hand, were dirt cheap and my decision was made. I was going to be a writer.

In retrospect the equation was pretty simple:

(imagination) + (horror addiction) + (need to write) = (horror writer), but it wasn't that simple. I dabbled in science fiction and political intrigue, but nothing was firing up the imagination that was demanding I write. During that time my feet were either on the path to the writing craft or in line at the movie theater where I stood, anticipating what awaited me in the darkness. There were so many disappointments. I was leaving one such poor excuse for a horror flick, grumbling to myself that I could write a better story. In that instant I witnessed a three-way collision between my imagination, my horror addiction and my need to write.

I selected two masters of the horror genre as unwitting mentors and began studying their works as I started what would become a labor of love.

Stories like The Shining by Stephen King became the standards by which I measured my own work. 

When Devil Glass was finished I was uncertain about my ability to create another masterpiece. My invisible companion laughed and started telling me another story.

The ScaryBob catalog contains two novels and a third one is approaching completion. It's time for readers to meet me and that requires a public relations campaign.


The funds:

$5,000:  Six week public relations campaign (Smith Publicity) 

$5,000:  Advertising campaign (providers to be determined)

$5,000:  Promotional opportunities and miscellaneous expenses

ScaryBob Productions, LLC earns a 70% royalty from Amazon and iTunes for each purchase, translating into $6.50 per download.

I'm ready to take my place alongside Stephen King, Anne Rice, Dean Koontz and others. A successful PR campaign would be the culmination of a dream that began fifty years ago and has never faded. Please visit my website where you will find the root of my nickname and multiple 5-star reviews of The Bookseller .

www.scarybobproductions.webs.com

story:
¿Qué?

Las sombras de la roca es un thriller que hará las delicias de aquellos deseosos de emociones fuertes; de boca del autor:

Esta historia surgió hace varios años, una de tantas noches de borrachera, en un café - pub de cuyo nombre no quiero acordarme (aunque muchos la recordarán con cierto cariño). Veíamos, cinco amigos, Conan el Bárbaro (pero la buena, la única, la inmortal), con música del maestro Poledouris que nos embriagaba (y nos embriaga) más que el mismo alcohol. Y por designio de las Musas, de los Hados, los Dioses, la Providencia Divina o por arte de birlibirloque, empezaron a surgir imágenes en mi cabeza a una velocidad pasmosa (no temáis, no eran de bizarros y gallardos gladiadores ni bellas guerras o temibles hechiceros). Y no pude más que coger papel, lápiz y empezar a escribir aquella baraunta de ideas sin ton ni son.

Una semana estructurando todo aquello, dándole forma a los personajes, a las acciones, los lugares, dires y diretes, y un año de revisiones para, finalmente, parir este humilde sueño que os presento hoy, aquí, esperando que disfrutéis con su lectura tanto como yo escribiéndolo.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Arturo Garralón.

Nacido en la Línea de la Concepción (Cádiz), es cantante de ópera, actividad que combina con la dirección de coros y la composición. Su afición a la escritura viene de largo tiempo, aunque siempre estuvo metido entre versos, saliendo de ellos solo para plasmar algunas críticas musicales en periódicos de su localidad, o firmar algunos manifiestos y artículos bajo el pseudónimo de Orpheo.

Tras probar en el campo del relato corto, y sentir una fuerte atracción por la narrativa, comenzó su empresa literaria más ambiciosa con la novela Las sombras de la roca. En la actualidad, se encuentra inmerso en su segundo trabajo de gran formato: Las Trece Torres, que verá la luz en breve.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Las sombras de la roca que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Arturo Garralón vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
I write science fiction and fantasy.

We've all got this same old world around us. Steel and asphalt, stucco and concrete, bright buzzing lights and greyed-out night sky. Wood and tin, dust and mud, acrid fumes and palpitating sun. Slender ash trees in cool mountain hollows. Olive groves on dusky Mediterranean slopes.

The alchemy of storytelling takes that familiar stuff and transforms it into fantastic new worlds, which become just as much a part of us. The wild things and their wild rumpus. A magic door in a wardrobe. Mrs. Whatsit, Mrs. Who, and Mrs. Which. Amber, Nessus, Middle Earth. The claustrophobic corridors of a dying battlestar.

I want to make more of those worlds. And this summer, I have a very special chance to make six of them!

I'll be writing six new original stories, as part of a long-running speculative fiction workshop called Clarion West. Every year, 18 writers from around the world meet in Seattle for an intensive workshop experience. Not only do we get to work with each other's input and feedback, but we also get six amazing mentors from the sci-fi writing community to help us hone our storytelling.

Mentors this year include Connie Willis and Cory Doctorow. Mentors in recent years have included George R. R. Martin, Joe Hill, and Neil Gaiman.

For a young writer, Clarion is pretty exciting. And this year, I got in! 


But I could really use your help.

I'm a freelance writer and editor. That means I don't get paid for hours when I don't work. And for almost two months this summer, I won't be able to take freelance contracts at all.

So I'll have two months of no money coming in, but there will still be pesky bills to pay. For example:

  • $350 for two months of health insurance. I'll need that, in case I write so hard I break my arm.
  • $425 in travel expenses: flights, trains to and from the airport, etc.
  • $145 to keep my phone working for two months. (This means I can send you fun pictures of Seattle, yay!!)
  • $200 for food and other necessities. Clarion provides some meals, but not all.
  • $900 to cover rent and utilities on my charming attic room while I'm away, so I still have a place to live when I get back.

If you felt like doing math, you might have noticed that those costs already add up to more than the amount I'm asking for. And that's not even counting the expenses of creating the perks, shipping the perks to you, paying the IndieGoGo and credit card processing fees, etc.

I'm hoping this campaign will raise a fair bit more than my goal, so I can write my six stories with a clear, unworried mind this summer. (The more I can immerse myself in what I'm working on, the better the end result!) But even the $1900 would make a huge difference. Seriously. So much.


Perks!

One of the backer perks I'm offering is these Muji notebooks, screen-printed by hand, with the following designs by artist Michael Norcross:

1. Music Makers

2. The Royal Library of Meret (long ago and far away, there was a city on a hill, and at the crown of the hill was the library...)

3. Dreamscape: The Desert of Pento (This is from the same world as the library -- it's still cooking, and not quite ready to be served yet. So consider this a sneak preview! :-)


Other backer rewards will include needle-felted critters like this handsome fellow!


Risks & Challenges

I already got into Clarion and decided to go, so this thing is happening! Minimal risk to you! It's real and legit! You can see my name on this year's class list!

Of course I can't guarantee the exact path of my writing career. No one can do that. I might have a bestseller out next year, I might toil in obscurity for decades before finally coming out with something totally genius, or maybe I'll only ever publish short stories that circulate among a small crowd of dedicated speculative fiction fans. But I can tell you this: I'm as stubborn as they come. And I'm never, ever going to stop writing.

By the way, if you want to check out a few things I've written recently, you can do that here!

I'll do my best to get all campaign perks shipped before I leave (the workshop starts June 21). But if an overwhelming wave of generosity comes my way and there are zillions of packages to get ready, I may have to ship some of them in August when I get back.

I know you'll be waiting with bated breath.

If you've read this far, you're my hero.

THANKS.


Video credits:

Special appearance & perk design by Michael Norcross (michaelnorcross.com)

Videography by Amanda Carlson Thomas

Music: Trent Reznor/Nine Inch Nails, "Ghosts" (CC-BY-NC-SA 3.0)

Photos: The Three Witches of Macbeth by John Downman (public domain, Galerie Bassenge via Wikimedia Commons). El Castillo by Daniela Bertienová (public domain), via Wikimedia Commons. Fat Cat by Allen Watkin (CC BY-SA 2.0), via Wikimedia Commons

story:
“Angels of the Apocalypse” is a novel in progress. It’s the story of a man in a post-apocalyptic world. He is a loner searching for a mythical elixir that will bring his cryogenically frozen girlfriend back to life. He doesn’t know if it’s even real but this quest keeps him going. Further complicating his quest is having to forage for fuel to keep the cryogenic chamber running… as well as fight off the madness that threatens him living alone with the frozen body of his girlfriend in an abandoned laboratory.

Along the way, he meets other survivors that he comes to care for and eventually he realizes he has to make a choice between what he has and what he wishes for.

If you’ve ever read any of my screenplays you know that I find it quite impossible not to infuse everything I write (and most of what I say and think) with a good dose of dark humor. So expect more of the same here. Heartbroken man, dead girlfriend, the end of the world. Laughs-a-plenty.

If I had to pitch it as a movie (and it would be awesome if I did), I’d say “The Road Warrior” meets “Moon” meets “Heathers”. Though, almost everything I write owes some debt to “Heathers”!

Anyway, that’s that. Get on board so I have to shut up and start writing. A lot.
Thanks!!

story:
Short Summary of Me...

I'm a sole parent and mother of 3 awesome kids. My first book was published in May 2010 and the second in November 2011.

Poppy Pretzel - Passage Into Puberty, published by New Holland Publishing

and

Levi Sprocket - what's in my pocket?, self published.

Levi Sprocket recently won a Bronze Medal at the prestigious Readers Favorite Awards in the U.S.A. in the category of Health/Wellbeing this year. Yeehah!

My books are called documentary fiction by many because I weave 'real life' situations into a story. For example, Poppy Pretzel is about a young girl who gets her first period at school but the underlying story is about friendships, self confidence and emotional connection. Unlike many books for kids this age, I add depth to the characters by revealing their emotions, how vulnerable they feel and how they get through their everyday lives.

I'm passionate about working with young people and one of my jobs has been as an Integration Aide, where I work 1:1 with kids that have special needs, so I'm in touch at a grass roots level how being a little 'different' can affect your life.

How do I know about allergies? Who doesn't these days! WIth 1 in 10 kids having an allergy, we are all interconnected somewhere with someone who has an allergy or intolerance to something. In particular though, my kids and I co-shared a house for some time with a dear friend, Suzanna who has two young children with allergies. Since that time, I've gained empathy about what it's like for a child to live day-to-day with an allergy and have seen first hand how others react when faced with a child who doesn't quite fit into 'norm'. Suzanna is in fact an author herself of the well known book Allergy Safe Family Food

This book will be between 10-12,000 words. Once Stella Cooke is written I will be continuing on with a series of other books for kids for ages 8+ on issues of health and wellbeing in the same format as Stella Cooke. The other topics that are drafted but not set in stone are:

  • Asthma 
  • Diabetes
  • Autism
  • Sadness

If you have ideas or suggestions of topics you think would be worthwhile covered, let me know. I love to hear what's on people's minds.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking for funding that will allow me to have the books professionally edited and a book cover designed. These books will be made into eBooks first and then into hardcover books.

If you decide to contribute, here is where your money will be going:

EDITING: I have a fabulous editor in the USA who does great work for me and in fact, edited my second book, Levi Sprocket. I'm able to do a good proof read but his touches make it magical and also readable for anyone, no matter what country they live in. So the first part of the funds will be going to the editing.

COVER ARTWORK: A dear friend Elke from Curlew Creative did the artwork for my second book Levi Sprocket and I'd like her clever artistry to create the cover for Stella too. This would be probably a larger cost than the editing but a cover can 'make or break a book'. There will also be some small line drawings inside the book which I'll have Elke do as well so a contribution will go towards her artwork here too.

FORMATTING: Stella Cooke will be made into an eBook on Smashwords, Kindle and other reading devices. Once edited, the manuscript needs to be formatted to suit these mediums.

TYPSETTING: If I'm fortunate enough to have generous contributors, the book will go into print and yeehah for you guys, because that means if you've donated $20 or more, you get a copy of the book. Part of the cost will go to having the book typeset, which is a fiddly job but my typesetter is efficient and detail oriented.

Perks For You:

Depending on how much you contribute will depend on what I'm able to supply you with your reward.

Every contributor will receive something for their generosity, even if only my undying respect, gratitude and good karma thoughts. 

Levels start with personal email of thank you and appreciation up to 3 copies of ALL my books + PDF's and book marks.

If I don't reach the entire goal, then the funds will be put towards the book going to eBook first.

If enough funds are raised, my goal is for every school library to have access to a copy - whether digitally or hard copy. Yeh, I know it's a big goal but why not reach for the stars. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

I understand that you may not be able to contribute money but if you'd still like to help, here are a few ways you can:

SHARE ON FACEBOOK/TWITTER: Share this campaign on facebook, twitter, or whichever social media site you frequent. Do you have friends who have allergies? Do you know of someone that could benefit from this book? Share it with them! You can also help by retweeting my Stella Cooke posts on:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/debislinger 

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Everyday-Life-Coach

You can also use the "share" feature on indiegogo to share this campaign directly from here!

If you're not able to donate money, I'm more than happy for exposure of my previous books as well as this current project. Radio interviews, print media, online blogs and so on.

story:
The Blurb on the Back of the Book:

There is a place where fabulous clockwork Devices fill Festival streets with color and sound.

Where the Gear Tourniers, in their places of high learning, keep alive the memory of the cruel horrors of an industrial past, now overthrown.

Where skill of the hand and grace of the body are markers of true belief.

Elena Alkeson has been on the run for six years. Wanted by the fanatical Duke of Melifax for witchcraft, nowhere in Devien is safe, as her gift for sensing impending disaster comes with a price: she can't keep her mouth shut.

…Until she meets Fen, who shares a similar gift: the gift of seeing inside mechanisms and knowing what they do. Elena and Fen must flee for their lives, going to the capital City of Helseve to seek asylum, and, perhaps, a life in which their gifts can be used for good. Amidst the machinery and brilliance of the Autumn Festival, Fen and Elena find friendship, danger, and some powerful allies.

But Melifax and his sect, the dour Browns, are determined to bring the people of Devien into a new age, an age of moralism, conformity and mass production, ensuring that the beauty and pageantry of Devien and its Devices will be lost forever.

What's this campaign about?

Songs for a Machine Age is a fantasy novel written by a Maker who believes in people making things.  It's an unusual blend: a Dumas-esque adventure that celebrates the making of beautiful things, thoroughly influenced by the author's fascination with clockwork, magic, and history.

Heather McDougal grew up at a summer craft school, has worked in the garment industry, and has an MFA in sculpture, and is now deeply involved in the Maker movement. She is the creator of the fascinating blog Cabinet of Wonders, a compendium of wonderful objects, thoughts, and ideas.

Her new novel, Songs for a Machine Age, is coming out from Hadley Rille Books and Heather is trying to collect enough money to put 100-150 free copies into the book bags given to the participants of the World Fantasy Conference at the beginning of November, just when the book is coming out, thus inspiring other authors, publishers, agents and reviewers to read and talk about the book.

What I Need

If I can earn $1000, I can cover the cost of the free books, the fees, and the books I give away here.

  • It costs close to $600 to print and ship 100 books to Toronto, where the convention is taking place.
  • With the fees for Indiegogo and prizes here, that figure comes closer to $900.
  • My goal is to send as many books as I can to the conference at the end of October.

What You Get

  • A donation of $10 will get you a postcard with a URL for a free copy of the eBook
  • $25 will get you a signed copy of the physical book (in trade paperback format)
  • $100 or more will get you a signed copy of the trade paperback, a postcard for the eBook, and a small clockwork sculpture created by the author.

Why should you help?

It's difficult for authors who work with small publishers to get the publicity they need.  Songs for a Machine Age is a fresh and imaginative book that deserves notice, and your contributions can help the world hear Heather's voice for the first time.  This is a small-scale project in the world of PR, but it would make a great difference in building her career. 

Even if you can't contribute money, you can help build awareness of Heather's efforts by making some noise.  Facebook, email, telephone calls, word of mouth -- these can all help get the word out about the book and about the campaign.  Or use the tools here at Indiegogo to let you friends know.

You can find out more about Heather McDougal on Facebook or at her website.

Thanks for your help!

story:
What Kurdish Matters is all about

Do you ever hear them? The stories of Kurds, sharing their hopes in life, their sorrows, their choices, dreams, pains? Probably, you never do. Because the stories that are usually in the media about Kurds in Turkey, are about violence.

Violence is part of the Kurdish problem, but not the root of it. The root is that people's human rights are being denied. With Kurdish Matters, I want to tell the story of the Kurdish issue through the eyes of average Kurds. Villagers and city dwellers, students, workers, housewives, activists, mothers, fathers, children. Their lives tell the true story of the Kurdish issue in Turkey.

I am a very experienced freelance journalist (more than 20 years experience!), originally from the Netherlands. I have been based in Turkey since 2006. Earlier this year, I moved to Diyarbakir, the biggest city in the predominantly Kurdish Southeast of Turkey. When I hear the stories of the people here, there is only one thing I want to do: share them.

I hope my project will increase the awareness of the situation of Kurds in Turkey. Maybe, maybe, it can even slighty contribute to solving the issue by creating more understanding.

Writing this book, requires money. I need money to travel, to pay translators, and to create time - every minute I work on this book, I can not earn my daily living. Time is money. Besides the book, that will be published in both English and Dutch, Kurdish Matters also involves a website: www.kurdishmatters.com. On that site, I blog about the book process and about what I learn investigating the Kurdish issue. I do that in three languages: English, Turkish and Kurdish. 

The budget of the whole project is some €40,000. While this campaign on Indiegogo is running, I also run a crowdfunding campaign on a Dutch site. Both of them together will hopefully fund half of the project. The rest comes from a journalism fund in the Netherlands, and from my own modest savings.

When I hear the stories of the people here, there is only one thing I want to do: share them. I hope my project will increase the awareness of the situation of Kurds in Turkey. Maybe, maybe, it can even slighty contribute to solving the issue by creating more understanding.
Writing this book, requires money. I need money to travel, to pay translators, and to create time - every minute I work on this book, I can not earn my daily living. Time is money. Besides the book, that will be published in both English and Dutch, Kurdish Matters also involves a website: www.kurdishmatters.com. On that site, I blog about the book process and about what I learn investigating the Kurdish issue. I do that in three languages: English, Turkish and Kurdish. The budget of the whole project is some €40,000. While this campaign on Indiegogo is running, I also run a crowdfunding campaign on a Dutch site. Both of them together will hopefully fund half of the project. The rest comes from a journalism fund in the Netherlands, and from my own modest savings.

story:
Congratulations on the Year of Talking Back! As of January 3, 2015, we have raised $2,000 due to activists and readers across the U.S. and Australia who want to make alternative voices and visions available to the public. And the campaign's not over -- the more that is raised, the more will be available for an ebook edition and an all-out promotional campaign to bring the words of these radical writers to the world! 

-----------------------------------

Amplify the voices of activists of color

Talking Back: Voices of Color is a collection of writings by a multi-racial, inter-generational mix of 25 Black, Latino, Native American, Asian American and LGBTQ community organizers. Written by strong feminists and radical thinkers, these insightful, accessible and personal essays address topics including organizing for quality education and environmental justice, indigenous land rights and international solidarity, film and book reviews, hidden histories of women of color, and tales of endurance and survival. Many of the articles previously appeared in the Freedom Socialist newspaper.

Contributors include esteemed Asian American poet Nellie Wong, the book's editor and author of the introduction; Mark Cook, who spent 24 years as a political prisoner and co-founded the Black Panther Party in the Walla Walla State Penitentiary; and Duciana Thomas, a member of Radical Women whose article addresses the current fight to save City College of San Francisco -- an issue she discusses in the video below.


Support a grassroots not-for-profit publisher

Talking Back is being published by Red Letter Press, a small press that is passionate about creating books that encourage dialogue, critical thought and grassroots rebellion. Previous titles include The Radical Women Manifesto, Viva la Raza: A History of Chicano Identity and Resistance, and Socialism for Skeptics. Our earlier, highly successful anthology, Voices of Color, was used in many classrooms.

As a largely volunteer, not-for-profit project, Red Letter Press publishes works that tell the truth about the system and advance hard-hitting solutions. We're too political to win literary grants. And we keep our prices low to make sure youth and low-income people can afford them.

Contributions for Talking Back  will be put toward printing and promotion costs in order to keep the book affordable and to bring it to the attention of reviewers, Ethnic Studies and Women Studies departments, and other grassroots activists. By giving generously -- $50 or more -- you will receive a free copy of the book when it is released on May 1, 2015.

    Have an impact

    Your donation will help bring Talking Back's affirmative, movement-building energy to young people around the country.

    In addition to contributing, you can help bring Talking Back to the attention of activists and readers by helping to make some noise about the campaign through your own networks and by using Indiegogo's share tools.

    Thanks so much for helping these activist writers bring their thoughts and visions to the world at large.

    P.S -- Prefer to make your donation by mail? Please send a check payable to Red Letter Press, with note the donation is for TALKING BACK, to Red Letter Press, 4710 University Way NE #100, Seattle, WA 98105. Thanks!

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign may have come to an end but we are are still working very hard behind the scenes to bring an important, innovative, and dynamic publication to our communities! 

Don't fret if you missed the chance to contribute! You can still join the here! magazine team by purchasing advertising space for your business, organization, or community event in upcoming issues. 

We have been touched and inspired by every contribution, whether you gave money, words of encouragement, or performed acts of extreme *social* networking. 

Each dollar the generous here! community has contributed will go towards the printing and publication of here! magazine. 

To our amazing supporters, your perks and launch party invitations will be winging their way to you over the next 3-4 weeks. We can't wait to thank you in person!

Official launch date in Victoria B.C., Canada:  November 8, 2013!


Editor Fiona Bramble tells the story of her Grandmother, Elizabeth, and her journey and early struggles as a newcomer to Canada in 1951 in "Belle of Belfast - My Path to Canada"

Welcoming digital submissions sharing your "Path to Canada" at www.heremagazine.ca starting September 1, 2013


Did you know?

  •  20% of Canadians are newcomers! In some areas - Calgary - almost 30% of the population are newcomers!(Stats Can)

  •  By 2011, newcomers accounted for 100% of the net growth in Canada's labour force. (Stats Can)

  •  Women make or influence 85% of all purchasing decisions, and purchase over 50% of traditional male products, including automobiles, home improvement products and consumer electronics.

 

a language and culture quarterly for women new to Canada is being launched by two writer-educators who have spent nearly twenty years teaching English to second-language learners in Canada and around the world.

 With our passion for language and our dedication to  understanding different cultures (and people's roles  within them), the motivation for here! was always there. As such, we have taken our backgrounds as writers and educators and created a quarterly publication for women who are new to Canada - a magazine, digital and print, that enables these women to work with the challenges of language, culture, and integration in an accessible, genuine way. 

This is not a standard ESL resource nor ladies' mag. here! magazine is for and about the women who come here to start a new life, maybe even a better life...perhaps it's someone you already know or are related to. Someone whose transition into Canadian culture can be both eased and celebrated by a publication like here! Rest assured that with your thoughtful contributions, however humble or grand, here! magazine will give women new to Canada:

  • a voice to share their thoughts and unique experiences, perhaps for the first time

  • a language resource to survive and thrive independently

  • cultural connectedness to their new communities

  • hope, confidence, and courage to take chances

What's inside here!

Everything about the content of here! magazine is designed to support, engage, and  celebrate women new to Canada. It is written in clear language to keep it accessible to non-native English speakers of varying language levels. Some articles reflect newcomer experience, like the profiles in "new here", "recipe card", and restaurant reviews in "eat here".

Other features support community connectedness, such as "community board", or "work here", an employer profile that includes employment and job interview advice. Some sections offer language and literacy support, including "learn here", a themed language lesson, and "read here", an introduction to a Canadian novel. Each issue features a story that impacts all newcomer women across Canada in a significant way.

In our launch issue, our first feature article looks at "The Shoe Project", helmed by acclaimed novelist Katherine Govier, which changed the lives of many female newcomers to Canada.

 

 We are also fortunate to have Dr.  Silvia  Schriever act as  a "word  mentor" and offer her professional  guidance  and appropriate  vocabulary to create authentic  dialogue for the doctor's  office.

 It's  an  incredible  start  to  an  important  publication!

 

 

 

 

What it costs to be here!

We're asking for the bare bones - $12, 203.93 - just to get here! magazine into the right hands. Print distribution is vital to our mandate of accessibility. All funds raised will go towards the cost of publication.

Our business model revolves around advertising sales, but as a start-up, it's challenging to find committed advertisers right out of the gate. Help us with this launch, and we'll take it from there. Choose a contribution and a perk on the right that makes you happy, and you will in turn bring education and inclusivity to Canadian newcomers!

Bringing here! magazine to the community is being done in partnership with Black Press, a significant provider of community newspapers across British Columbia, Alberta, and the Pacific Northwest. here! magazine's launch issue will be delivered alongside the Victoria and Saanich News to 20,000 households and businesses this Fall.

Printing and Distribution Costs: $12, 203.93

Research and Development Costs: $1,500

Writers' Salaries: $4,000

here! is how we make an impact:

As of yet, there is no publication like this in Canada, and here! is both a companion and guide for women to not just survive in their new communities, but become a part of them. 

There are countless magazines and websites aimed at women, all of them with their own purpose, but here! goes beyond the typical content of fashion / food / family, and into the very core of what makes us who we are: culture.  We not only give women the English language tools to deal with the practical issues of living in a new country (and of course, some of that aforementioned typical content, because it’s still important!) but also an ongoing forum to share their life experiences through their very own submissions to the magazine. 

The Future of here!

Our launch issue is being circulated on Vancouver Island, but the the goal has always been to bring here! to parts of Canada that are not quite so urban, and where many recently-arrived families are settling.  These smaller, sometimes isolated communities may not offer extensive language or integration services. here! magazine aims to bride the accessibility gap through both our print magazine and our digital issues. We are not just a “west coast” magazine, and would like to be a touchstone of familiarity for the women settling in these less-populated, unique pockets of British Columbia (and hopefully well beyond).

We aim to grow our content as well as our reach, steadily developing columns addressing cross-cultural relationships, business development, family life, faith and spirituality, and cultural/personal topics our readers require and desire!

Help us be here! in other ways...

We won’t talk about the economy. We know it’s rough so we won’t even bother.  If you can’t donate money right now to help with those start-up costs, but you want to help us somehow, you can.  And we would love it if you could.  How?

  • Throw our link onto your website.  “Like” us on Facebook.  Tweet about us.  Embed our campaign on your website or blog. Write a blog entry about us.  Casually mention here! in your daily newspaper column.  Tattoo our logo onto your clavicle.  You know...little things.

 

  • Word of mouth is one of strongest ways to market anything.  Talk about this magazine to people you know. If you have a homestay student, tell them that they might want to check us out online.

 

  • Buy some advertising space for your business or product, or a subscription to the magazine (click on media kit at www.heremagazine.ca for detailed info!)

 

  • You could also donate gift certificates or products to be used as perks or prizes for future reader-submission contests--a lovely and instant way to advertise your wares.

 

  • Stroll down your streets wearing a homemade here! sandwich board.  We will provide it for you. You would be a sensation.

 

  • Use the Indiegogo “share” tools at the top of the page!
