story:
Updates-

My Moon interview on Salt Spring Island: Green FM (March 21, 2014)

https://soundcloud.com/andrea-vriesen/green-fm-salt-spring-island


Launch 'My Moon' Into Schools!

The bigger goal of this project in the future is to educate girls about the magic and beauty of their bodies and send a free copy to each school across Canada. Into the hands of many.

About Me and My Moon

I’m Andrea, an educator and the mother of a 13 year old girl who is the illustrator of this brand new book celebrating periods.

My Moon is a period book for girls and young women. It is an earthy celebration of our nature seeing our period as a gift. The book includes a positive look at body beauty as the perfection of nature and periods as the end of an amazing reproductive story. Complete with colour illustrations.

I’ve been educating women and girls since I was 16 years old and have worked with dedication to educate myself and daughter on a journey into womanhood. There is so much to share.

If you help me finish and print this book I will be able to take my stories to as many girls as I can meet and leave one free copy in each public library and school library I visit. With your help, I will help many, many more people.

We can raise a generation of girls together.

"Never doubt that a small group of committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."

-Margaret Mead

On the right is my daughter Leighyah, 'My Moon' illustrator.

Illustration from 'Chapter 3: Flower of Life'

'My Moon: A period book for girls' so far! Isn't it awesome!

Plus, 'My Moon Companion Workbook' to show what you know.


Phase 1: Launch My Moon Into Schools

The aim of this project is to educate girls. Finishing the book, printing and getting it into schools!

It’s been a long a beautiful journey to write this book and it’s nearly past the finish line. With your support we can see this through even further than we ever dreamed.

$1500 To Finish the Book

EDITOR: To hire editor Coreen Boucher at www.lucentedits.com to polish up the book with a final edit.

BRAND NEW COVER: 'My Moon Cover Contest' held for best of the best with the help of a jury of de-lightful 8-12 year olds.

Printing 1000 Copies of My Moon

Right now per unit costs $23 w/tax making it virtually unavailable to mothers.

I'm looking to print 1000 full colour copies in preparation for a cross country book tour. Copies by the 1000 are much more cost effective at $5721 (including tax) and gives us the opportunity to hand over a copy in person.

At $5.72 a book, this makes the possibility of 'copies for sale' able to subsidize the free copies for schools.

FAQ: Why not print on demand?

As it is so simply shared in the Ted Talk below, you succeed far better being present and available with what people want, being present is part of what people need…

And I want to take the message to them, to share the experience with them.

http://www.ted.com/talks/amanda_palmer_the_art_of_asking.html

The Quest for a Traditional Publisher 

On our quest for a traditional publisher I want to get as much education out and into young women. After and maybe even during the printing and distribution of My Moon through this fundraiser and the My Moon Book Tour, I will be looking for a traditional publisher to make the book available in stores and attaining a wider audience with their help.

The Impact- My Moon West Coast Book Tour

$1000 for a TWO-WEEK MINI BOOK TOUR to take free copies of 'My Moon' to school and public libraries on the West Coast. This tour will prepare us for a nation wide tour we will and are working toward. 

This money is for ferry costs, gas, hotel/motel when needed and food for my daughter and I.

We hope to reach schools between this May and June 2014. Schedule dependent upon schools.

If full funding isn't raised...

I will buy a lower quantity of books i.e. 500 for $3724 and so on.

.....

If you're still interested in following us...

Coming Soon: Phase 2

100 SCHOOLS IN 100 DAYS

We Are Working On Tour Sponsorship to Take Us Across Canada

A bit more time is needed to find a car and sponsors to make the car move where we need it to go! A mini tour will help us be able to show potential sponsors what it will look like on the road.

In the spirit of 'Life is to short to drive a white car' (http://www.amazon.com/Lifes-Too-Short-Drive-White/dp/1491253819)  we will be adding sponsorship decals to our period car for the big tour! Making the private public in the spirit of My Moon.

Taking Time To Video Document Our Adventure

We would also love to do a pilot filming of our mini-tour.

We will put Leighyah's 'Documentary Video Production' course taken at the Gulf Islands Film & Television School to good use and share even further our adventure together. We're open to a good video camera.

In our preparations to take My Moon far and wide, Leighyah has decided to take next year off of public school to home-school on the road! We can cover so much more ground together.


THE ADDITION OF THIS FUNDRAISING IS NOT ACCURATE TO THE CENT, WHY?

THERE IS AS ASSUMPTION THAT WHEN YOU'RE A MOTHER YOU DO THE MOST WITH WHAT YOU HAVE, AND MORE.

I AM DEDICATED TO THE PATH I'M ON, SHARING, EDUCATING AND LIVING AND WILL DO MANY GREAT THINGS WITH AND WITHOUT HELP.

WITH HELP IS HAPPIER.

our preparations to take My Moon far and wide, Leighyah has decided to take
next year off of public school to home-school on the road! We can cover so much
more ground together.
THE ADDITION OF THIS FUNDRAISING IS NOT ACCURATE TO THE CENT, WHY?THERE IS AS ASSUMPTION THAT WHEN YOU'RE A MOTHER YOU DO THE MOST WITH WHAT YOU HAVE, AND MORE. I AM DEDICATED TO THE PATH I'M ON, SHARING, EDUCATING AND LIVING AND WILL DO MANY GREAT THINGS WITH AND WITHOUT HELP.WITH HELP IS HAPPIER.

story:
I'd like to introduce myself and my project. 

Unashamed. A memoir by Aziza Kibibi

Hello, my name is Aziza Kibibi. I am a single mom of five beautiful children that I am very proud of. Most men describe me as mysterious, free spirited and charming. Most woman say that I'm confident, smart and witty. But little do they know, is that from ten years old, I was raised as my father’s (Aswad Ayinde) sex slave. Oh, and the first four of my five children, are also my brother and sisters.

This book is the true story of my life; a tale of how surviving my childhood, adolescence and young adulthood, has shaped me into the woman I am today.

I am the eldest of 9 children by my mother, and including my children whom he fathered, the eldest of over twenty-five by my dad. Using events from the present as a vehicle,  history of my life unfolds. I take the reader on a journey through my sheltered life in a polygamous family where I was home schooled, molested, beaten and trained to satisfy my father’s every sexual desire. In addition, I invite the reader into my present life where I've triumphed over the setbacks and challenges from my upbringing.  



I describe how while growing up I watched my father turn from a loving, talented respected member of the community, into the abusive monster that God spared my own children from growing up with. Via my transition through adolescence the reader witnesses my failed attempts at protecting my younger siblings from the fate I had befallen; my father’s video directing career where we interacted with popular ’90’s music artists such as Lauryn Hill and Wyclef Jean of the music group The Fugees, and the events that led to the unveiling of our family secret. 


UNASHAMED is a tale of tragedy, growth, resilience, survival, faith and forgiveness.  

I want to share my story with the public because I feel I have a moral responsibility to other men, women and children (both victims and victimizers) that may be affected by child molestation and incest, to raise awareness and lend a voice to those that are and have been abused. Unlike the safety mechanism that other victims utilize, I have not repressed the torture that my father inflicted on me, yet I function normally in life love and relationships. I consider this unique because I believe that through my writing it is important to convey to the reader the thoughts and feelings of a victim while being abused. This is also what makes my memoir stand out from other books that have been published with this theme.


As for my personal successes in life; despite my limited homeschooled education, I am currently  pursuing my associates in Liberal Arts - Communications with a 3.7 GPA (my first classroom experience) at Essex County College. I have won three Woman’s Opportunity awards from Soroptamist International for my writing. I currently administrate two blogs and, I run a catering and dessert company called Sincerely, Z. I am also raising, and have wonderful relationships with my four talented children whom I love more than anything. 

Unlike what is and was available to me and countless others, my book will provide insight, support and inspiration to victims, survivors and those that love us via my voice shamelessly sharing the perils of  my victimization, as well as my triumphs as an overcomer. But this book is not only for those connected to incest or sexual child abuse.  I hope that my tales will encourage and motivate anyone going through troublesome times, to push forward and stay strong no matter what challenges life presents one with. Though themed in struggle, Unashamed is a beautiful tragedy filled with provocative scenarios, funny moments, exciting journeys and insightful thought provoking ideas. 

What We Need  

At 35 years in the making and 3 years in the writing, Unashamed the 410 page manuscript is complete. And now I need your help to get it published. 

Your gracious contributions will transform this project from something I am doing, to something WE are doing together. Our goal of $3000 will help prepare the manuscript for publishing.  

Funds will go towards the following:

  • Editing for grammar
  • Editing for content and continuity
  • Book cover and jacket design

What You Get

Because there is no other piece of literature of this nature on the market, you are helping to make history. I myself feel blessed to be a part of something that could prevent pain and suffering in others, and may even save a few lives. I want to offer you the same opportunity. In addition I will include you in the journey of realizing this project by acknowledging your kindness on my Facebook and Twitter and keeping you updated on the project. 

Support comes in all forms

Don't let lack of funds stop you from showing support. There are other ways you can help.

  1. Spread the word. Share my campaign on your Facebook and/or Twitter
  2. Suggest my speaking perk or catered event to your church, synagog, temple, business or other organization.
  3. Go to my blog, Unashamed An Open Book, and cheer me on. 
  4. Like my Facebook page and/or follow me on twitter

[img src="http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/file_attac..." >

The Impact

We did not reach our goal for the first campaign but all contributions have been put aside for editing.  In addition, through this process your donations will contribute to the development of my non profit organization Precious Little Ladies. 

The purpose of this organization is to strengthen the bond between mothers and daughters through information, education, empowerment, support and understanding. 

With these tools a family could better prevent, cope and recover from incidents of child sexual abuse. 

Unashamed is not just a book, and I am not just a victim of child molestation. What we are creating here is a movement that will invite change. Unashamed will provide something that I never had. A map to healing, encouragement to forge on and strength to make a change; from someone who understands. 

Join me in impacting the world and making a change. Join me in saving lives. Join me in inspiring over 3 million children and 76 million adults to be UNASHAMED.

Let's do this!

story:
Welcome to the North Pole. 

Santa's not the only one up here trying to run a holiday. The Easter Bunny, the Boogeyman, the Tooth Fairy and even a wet-blanket named Bill are conducting their business from here too, working for a company called Holiday Incorporated, where they are under the thumb and watchful eyes of the omnipresent Corporate Headquarters. When an unforseen event causes the company to lose an unprecedented amount of money, Corporate sends a pair of mismatched managers to spend a year getting things back on track. Personalities clash, hijinks ensue and Santa drops a bombshell that no one wants to deal with. Not to mention Bill! Will the famously mythical figures pull in the massive profits Corporate is demanding, or will their beloved holidays be shut down for good?

 A surreal satire about nine-to-five life and the commercialization of holidays, Holiday, Inc. reintroduces the famous legends of childhood to an adult audience in this comedic debut.

Hi guys!

Holiday, Inc. is a passion project written by two aspiring authors. An adult comedy (if it were a television show, it would be in the vain of Archer, Family Guy or The Simpsons), it's written as fourteen interconnecting short stories split up by the months/holidays of the year. 

A little bit about us - My name's Anthony, and I am an aspiring, twenty-four year old married author looking to break out into the world of writing and publishing. I am a huge literary, television and holiday buff, and enjoy spending time with my family and friends. In my free time, I do a lot of reading and writing.

My writing partner, Lauren, is thirty-one years old and married with a child, also looking to break out into the world of writing.

We've both been writing since we were really young and we became fast friends at work, where we conceived of the idea for Holiday, Inc.

Currently, a cover for the book has been drawn (by an amazing local artist named Kelly Campion - http://www.kellycampion.com/) and the entire book has been written and edited and is now being re-edited. We plan on finishing the last of the edits by the first week of December and plan on having the book itself available for purchase in the lead up to Christmas. In the meantime, we have a twitter handler - HolidayIncBill  (which will be written from the point of view of one of the characters in the book) - and plan on viral marketing the book via our own personal twitter handles, Facebook and by making copies of a memo written by the fictional corporate headquarters in the book and distributing it around where we live/posting it online. (The "memo" will include a finalized release date as soon as we have it, as well as a purchase link). We also have a copyright pending right now and are waiting for it to fully come through, which should be by the end of November.

What we're trying to raise our $750  for is an ISBN code (so that even though we self publish through Amazon, we can retain complete rights to our book), which costs about $100. The rest of the money would go into a fund on amazon so that we can get actual physical copies of our book printed and available to people who prefer that instead of digital downloads. 

Being unknown authors, we don't expect to sell a million copies of our book straight out of the gate, which is why we're asking for such a relatively small amount. If you pledge any sort of money to us and we reach our goal of $750, there are rewards involved for you guys too (See Below)!

Any contribution you guys make - no matter how large or small - will help two, talented, aspiring authors realize their dreams of being published! We know that our book has massive potential and will appeal to an audience made up of teenagers and adults.

If you can't contribute, that's fine too. But you can still help by following us on twitter @HolidayIncBill, as well as link this page to all of your friends, family and co-workers who may be able to help or may just be interested in our book in general.

Thanks in advance for all of your help! :-)

story:
Read some of the biggest names in the business in an anthology of original military horror novellas and short stories.

Time travel, bioweapons unleashed, mutations, ancient species unearthed in lost caverns deep within the earth… and the soldiers who fight them

When the going gets tough, the tough fight to the death in SNAFU. 
(SNAFU – military slang for ‘Situation Normal – All F*cked Up)

Contributors:

- James A Moore (a Jonathan Crowley story)

- Greig Beck (a brand new novella – 'The Fossil' – read synopsis HERE)

- Weston Ochse (bestselling author of Seal Team 666 and Age of Blood)

- Jonathan Maberry (a Joe Ledger tale)

- Joseph Nassise (bestselling author of the Templar series and Great Undead War series)

- Eric S Brown (bestselling author of the Bigfoot War series)


- And others...

FIGHT OR DIE in SNAFU!

Our Facebook HERE.
Check our website out HERE.

Buy it now, or miss out on the limited edition version of what will be the BEST military horror anthology of 2014.

What You Get

This is an opportunity to pre-order and receive a special limited edition of SNAFU.

There are some great bonuses available for pre-orders ONLY. 

  • Be one of the first to read this selection of tales
  • Unique cover art for pre-orders
  • Free worldwide postage for print editions
  • Each print edition limited to the number of orders. If we get 103 orders for the paperback, there will only be 103 paperbacks with that cover design, and so on
  • We are limiting the paperback special editions to 350
  • We are limiting the hardcover signed limited special editions to 250
  • All hardcovers will be signed by all contributors

Pre-order ebook editions will be sent out the same time as reviewer copies.
eBook formats available for pre-order:

  • Mobi (Kindle)
  • ePub (most other e-readers including ipads/iphones)
  • PDF


Stretch Goals

Once we hit $5,000, we will announce our first stretch goal, which will fall into place at $10,000. Stay tuned.


Challenges 

There are no risks involved. We've contracted the five main writers, and we're reading submissions for the remainder of the content. We've sourced printers and binders, and we've got the standard and limited edition cover art finished.

Here is the limited 'Indiegogo only' cover art. ALL IndieGoGo pre-orders will bear this cover art.


Delays are always possible in the real world, but there are only a few circumstances that will cause any problems, and most of them involve hospital or a mortuary.

SNAFU will be released by early-to-mid 2014, and this is your only chance to gain a very limited version with different cover art.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, fine. 
If you want to help, then spread the word.
Tell your friends; share on Facebook or Twitter, use the Indiegogo share tools, just get the word out.

Help us get this out to the world.

Geoff Brown
Editor-in-Chief, Cohesion Press

story:
"Once upon a time, there was.. me! And only a year and a half later there was the greatest gift my parents could give me, my little sis. A few (I mean it when I say a FEW) years passed and now the two girls of the story fight for another story, a sweet children's story about a dinosaur called Bongo...! "


What do we do?


      

Evi writes…

“I write for fun. I write for those I love. I write for the things that make me laugh. I write to create smiles. I write for myself. I write to remember. I write for my little ones. I write to my little ones. I write to myself. I write to fulfill my dreams. I write to create new ones. I write because I believe in fairies. I write to make a difference. I write to believe. I write to you.” 


    

               

Maria runs...

“I run for fun. I run for those I love. I run to remember. I run to forget. I run to escape. I run to find. I run to achieve. I run to believe. I run to challenge. I run to let go. I run to reach my limits. I run to exceed my limits. I run to feel strong. I run cause I am strong. I run to make a difference. I run to make dreams. I run cause I dream. I run for myself. I run for you. "


What do we need? 

To Bring Bongo to Life we need the minimum amount of 800GBP. 

The writing has been done. (Hooray!!) Big part of a children's book is the illustration which has been partially done but it needs to be finalized and may subject to change. 

The money will go 100% towards a Publishing company which will publish the book, promote and distribute it worldwide through thousand of online retailers like Amazon and various distribution channels to target bookshops and special markets while utilizing Print-On-Demand technology.

As it is only baby steps, we will work on an POD agreement which practically means that the book will be available on order only. 

Anything extra will go towards the illustration and the promotion of the book. 

If we don't hit our funding goal (cross your legs, bite your tongue, sing naked in the rain, eat some salt while hopping on one leg and this will never happen)  we’ll keep moving forward. In this unlikely event we will have to delay publishing the book for a few weeks and reduce our promotional activities until we reach our funding goal and proceed.

Children books have a higher publishing cost than any other book due to the high number of images and the full color printing but that is something we could not compromise as illustrations play a vital role. 

To run that campaign, we will literally run it to the full. Maria on Saturday, 9th of November flies all the way from London to Athens to run the Classic Marathon a day later. Oh yes! 42.195 klms (in British words 26 miles and 385 yards); first time runner, just a crazy one!

If it was to measure Maria’s faith to Bongo in klm’s that would have been a Marathon route! That kept her running early mornings, late evenings, lazy wannabe Sundays throughout the year.

Your love and support is her drug to the race and there is not a single anti-doping test in the world to detect that!

Check out the route and you will see why she needs her ''substances''



Why Bongo?

It is a children's story about a special dinosaur with a very unique name that has been discriminated against because of that, but at the end turns up to be everybody's hero and friend! Being a qualified educator myself, working with young children in early years, I have tried to have an educational approach to the book, from the font I chose to the meaning of the story itself and I do believe that now, more than ever before, in a multicultural society like the one we live in, the book embracing diversity, will be warmly accepted by both children and their parents.

Bongo targets children at the age of 3+ .

Uses an educational approach (font, fun learning activities at the end of the book).

The book has been market tested in children focus groups and has successfully met all criteria as it was well understood and well remembered.

Other characteristics: Simple wording and a concept that children understand and love.

Any profit will go straight back to Bongo project.

Vivid colorful illustration that grasps children's attention.


How Bongo can make the world a better place?

Bongo the Dinosaur is a story that aims to help young children understand and celebrate diversity. This fierce looking but sweet and kind dinosaur, was wandering alone and isolated, just because he had a funny name and a different appearance. He was never given a chance to prove who he really is. He is being bullied and excluded. Through a simple enough story for young children to understand, Bongo wishes to raise awareness about bullying, discrimination, abuse and to promote learning, understanding and respect towards others no matter how they look, dress, speak, where they come from or what they believe in. 

Below you can read a few statistics on bullying collated from government reports and research.

·  38% of young people have been affected by cyber-bullying.

·  31,599 children called ChildLine in 2011/12 about bullying. 

·  Almost half (46%) of children and young people say they have been bullied at school at some point in their lives.

·  38% of disabled children worried about being bullied.

·  18% of children and young people who worried about bullying said they would not talk to their parents about it.

·  29% of children and young people in England experienced bullying in 2009/10.

·  A survey of pupils in England estimates that 16,493 young people aged 11-15 (4.4%) are frequently absent from state school or home educated because of bullying.

Source: http://www.nspcc.org.uk/inform/resourcesforprofessionals/bullying/bullying_statistics_wda85732


Story Moral 

"Bongo never felt ashamed of his unique name again, he understood that he was as special as everybody else. As for the other dinosaurs, well they had learned a tough but important lesson, never judge anyone by his look, name, hair, talk, size or color." 

Never judge anyone  just because he is different to what you've seen, heard, felt. The world has too many melodies, flavors, smells and colors and this is the beauty of it. 

All it took was a storm, a shocking realization and an apology to Bongo. And it became crystal clear for everyone (Bongo included!) that..

                                  "  It was just a name after all! "




Other ways to help

Just share our passion and spread the news! If you are broke (I think I see something shiny at the bottom of your pocket, don't be shy to give a little something!), you love diversity as much as we do and still want to be involved tell your friends! We are sure that somewhere there will be another little fan of Bongo. 

All your love and support will be Maria's positive energy to run the Marathon for herserlf, for Evi, for Bongo, for you. It's impossible to thank you enough.
story_txt:
"Once upon a time, there was.. me! And only a year and a half later there was the greatest gift my parents could give me, my little sis. A few (I mean it when I say a FEW) years passed and now the two girls of the story fight for another story, a sweet children's story about a dinosaur called Bongo...! "


What do we do?


      
Evi writes…
“I write for fun. I write for those I love. I write for the
things that make me laugh. I write to create smiles. I write for myself. I
write to remember. I write for my little ones. I write to my little ones.
I write to myself. I write to fulfill my dreams. I write to create new ones. I
write because I believe in fairies. I write to make a difference. I write to
believe. I write to you.” 


    

                Maria runs...



“I run for fun. I
run for those I love. I run to remember. I run to forget. I run to escape. I
run to find. I run to achieve. I run to believe. I run to challenge. I run to
let go. I run to reach my limits. I run to exceed my limits. I run to feel
strong. I run cause I am strong. I run to make a difference. I run to make
dreams. I run cause I dream. I run for myself. I run for you. "


What do we need? 
To Bring Bongo to Life we need the minimum amount of 800GBP. 
The writing has been done. (Hooray!!) Big part of a children's book is
the illustration which has been partially done but it needs to
be finalized and may subject to change. 
The money will go 100% towards a Publishing company which will publish
the book, promote and distribute it worldwide through thousand of online
retailers like Amazon and various distribution channels to target bookshops and
special markets while utilizing Print-On-Demand technology.
As it is only baby steps, we will work on an POD agreement which
practically means that the book will be available on order only. 
Anything extra will go towards the illustration and
the promotion of the book. 
If we don't hit our funding goal (cross your legs, bite your tongue,
sing naked in the rain, eat some salt while hopping on one leg and this will
never happen)  we’ll keep moving forward. In this unlikely event we
will have to delay publishing the book for a few weeks and reduce our
promotional activities until we reach our funding goal and proceed.
Children books have a higher publishing cost than any other book due to
the high number of images and the full color printing but that is
something we could not compromise as illustrations play a vital role. 
To run that campaign, we will literally run it to the full. Maria on
Saturday, 9th of November flies all the way from London to Athens to
run the Classic Marathon a day later. Oh yes! 42.195 klms (in British words 26 miles and
385 yards); first time
runner, just a crazy one!
If it was to measure Maria’s faith to Bongo in klm’s that would have been a
Marathon route! That kept her running early mornings, late evenings, lazy wannabe
Sundays throughout the year. 
Your love and support is her drug to the race and there is not a single
anti-doping test in the world to detect that!
Check out the route and you will see why she needs her ''substances''





Why Bongo?
It is a children's story about a special dinosaur
with a very unique name that has been discriminated against because of that, but
at the end turns up to be everybody's hero and friend! Being a qualified
educator myself, working with young children in early years, I have tried to
have an educational approach to the book, from the font I chose to the meaning
of the story itself and I do believe that now, more than ever before, in a
multicultural society like the one we live in, the book embracing diversity,
will be warmly accepted by both children and their parents.
Bongo targets children at the age of 3+ .
Uses an educational approach (font, fun learning
activities at the end of the book).
The book has been market tested in children focus
groups and has successfully met all criteria as it was well understood and well
remembered.
Other characteristics: Simple wording and a
concept that children understand and love.
Any profit will go straight back to Bongo project.
Vivid colorful illustration that grasps
children's attention.
How
Bongo can make the world a better place?
Bongo the Dinosaur is a story that aims to help
young children understand and celebrate diversity. This fierce looking but
sweet and kind dinosaur, was wandering alone and isolated, just because he
had a funny name and a different appearance. He was never given a chance to
prove who he really is. He is being bullied and excluded. Through a simple
enough story for young children to understand, Bongo wishes to raise awareness
about bullying, discrimination, abuse and to promote learning, understanding
and respect towards others no matter how they look, dress, speak, where they
come from or what they believe in. 
Below you can read a few statistics on
bullying collated from government reports and research.
·  38% of young people have been
affected by cyber-bullying.
·  31,599 children called ChildLine
in 2011/12 about bullying. 
·  Almost half (46%) of children and
young people say they have been bullied at school at some point in their lives.
·  38% of disabled children worried
about being bullied.
·  18% of children and young people
who worried about bullying said they would not talk to their parents about it.
·  29% of children and young people
in England experienced bullying in 2009/10.
·  A survey of pupils in England
estimates that 16,493 young people aged 11-15 (4.4%) are frequently absent from
state school or home educated because of bullying.
Source: http://www.nspcc.org.uk/inform/resourcesforprofessionals/bullying/bullying_statistics_wda85732





Story Moral 
"Bongo never
felt ashamed of his unique name again, he understood that he was as special as
everybody else. As for the other dinosaurs, well they had learned a tough but
important lesson, never judge anyone by his look, name, hair, talk, size
or color." 
Never judge anyone
 just because he is different to what you've seen, heard, felt. The world
has too many melodies, flavors, smells and colors and this
is the beauty of it. 
All it took was a
storm, a shocking realization and an apology to Bongo. And it became
crystal clear for everyone (Bongo included!) that..
     
                     
      "  It was just a
name after all! "





Other ways to help
Just share our passion and spread the news! If you are broke (I think I see something shiny at the bottom of your pocket, don't be shy to give a little something!), you love diversity
as much as we do and still want to be involved tell your friends! We are
sure that somewhere there will be another little fan of Bongo. 
All your love and
support will be Maria's positive energy to run the Marathon for herserlf, for Evi, for Bongo, for you. It's impossible to thank you enough.

Binghamton Slam Poetry

The Binghamton Slam Poetry Club hopes to send a team of five poets to this year's College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) held at Virginia Commonwealth University March 25-28 in Richmond, Virginia:

We are a relatively new club at SUNY Binghamton (we just started last fall!) committed to creating a slam poetry community on campus. We hold weekly workshops and other events, like slams and open mics, to foster a sense of creativity and solidarity among Binghamton students. We welcome anyone interested in slam poetry, from newbies to seasoned slammers.

This will be our first year going to CUPSI if we are able to register, and we would love to give this amazing opportunity to our team. You may have seen videos from previous CUPSIs on Youtube channels like Button Poetry and websites like Upworthy. This incredible event gives slam poetry teams from colleges across the United States an opportunity to come together, compete for top honors, and share their work. 

It would mean so much to us if you could help us reach this goal! We hope to sustain this club and send future teams to CUPSI for years to come.

Where will your contributions go?

As a recently chartered club, our budget doesn't allow us to cover all the costs of the competition. Here's how your contributions will help:

  • The CUPSI registration fee ($750 before February 7, $950 after February 7)
  • Extra funds will go towards gas money, hotel rooms, and food for the team.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, our funding will first and foremost go towards the CUPSI registration fee. However, it would be great if we could also pay for transportation and board for the team!
Our perks are our way of thanking you for contributing. Any contribution helps, and your support of our poets and the club as a whole means so much to us. Going to a national competition will help our community grow and will make our club even more credible and present at Binghamton. As our club grows and as our allocated budget increases in future semesters, we can create even more opportunities and events for all club members to showcase their work and get more involved.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, even just spreading the word about our campaign means the world. We love sharing our poetry with you and extending the Binghamton Slam Poetry family.

Check out our Facebook page!

story:
Thanks for coming to our IndieGogo funding campaign for Resist! Against a Precarious Future. Can you help us keep our ebook free?

Resist! is the third book in the Radical Future series: publications written and edited by young* activists, journalists and artists calling for radical alternatives to the status quo. We're interested in social justice, liberation and collectivity, and the ways young people are organising to create change. If you think mainstream politics is a dismal failure and you still have hope we can do better, this book is for you. 

The first book in the series, Radical Future: Politics for the next generation, was written before the 2010 election (remember back when things were bad, but we had no idea how much worse they were going to get?). The follow up, Regeneration, was published in 2012, and received over 50,000 downloads.

Resist! includes chapters about youth activist movements, re-envisioning work, feminist economics, direct action against the housing crisis, alternative media and organising after the London riots, from contributors like feminist campaigner Polly Trenow, activist Wail Qasim and openDemocracy journalist Adam Ramsay. It is edited by journalist and openDemocracy editor Ray Filar.

We’re really excited about this next book and can’t wait to get it published. 

But to get there, we need your help.

Like the first two books in the series, we want to make Resist! as accessible as possible by also offering it as a free ebook (as well as a paperback version). But ironically, publishing a free ebook is expensive. The publisher, Lawrence & Wishart, is covering most of the costs, but we need help with the final £2000. And we need it sharpish to get it out before the general election. So that’s why we’re asking you to donate. Your money will go towards typesetting, copy editing, proofing, and promotion.

We’ve put together some amazing rewards. As well as beautiful merchandise designed by our talented cover artist Yoav Segal, we’re harnessing the talents, pub-debating skills and canal boats of our contributors. We're offering prints that you can put on your wall, and tote bags with our cover art on. You’ll also find a great selection of workshops, excursions and experimental fun, all there to encourage you to part with your cash.

If we get more money than our target, we’ll divide it up to pay everyone who has given their time for free. Anything over that we’ll put towards the next book in the Radical Future series. You can read the first two books in the series right now. For free! 

The full list of contributing authors to Resist! Against a Precarious Future are:

Sarah Allan, Craig Berry, Matthew Cheeseman, Rhiannon Colvin, Sean Farmelo, Ray Filar, Robbie Gillett, Deborah Grayson, Noel Hatch, Izzy Koksal, Ben Little, Wail Qasim, Adam Ramsay, Niki Seth-Smith, Mike Shaw, Polly Trenow, Matt Adam Williams.

*in some cases, at heart

story:
What is Dark Highlands?

DARK HIGHLANDS ANTHOLOGY is a collection of stories, art, and poetry, focusing on the darker side of the horror, fantasy, supernatural, and science fiction genres. We publish twice a year, October and April, and aim to give visual and literary artists who specialize in the "weird" and the "macabre" a forum in which they can share their work with a wider audience. Our focus is on works from Midwest creators (the works themselves need not be Midwest-focused), though we accept submissions from anywhere in the United States. While it is our hope to someday have a book made up entirely of Midwest-based writers, poets, and artists to showcase the talent from America's heartland to the rest of the world, we aren't there yet (VOLUME 1 was nationwide, and VOLUME 2's fiction and poetry were Midwestern, with the art being from around the country).


DARK HIGHLANDS started off as a random idea by JR Tschopp which he pitched to his friend, Brad Ellis, a designer with publication experience, in their local coffee shop on a February morning in 2010. After the release  of DARK HIGHLANDS ANTHOLOGY, VOLUME 1 in October of that year, we added designer Beccy Harris, and artist/librarian Karly Steele to our production team. DARK HIGHLANDS ANTHOLOGY, VOLUME 2 was released on April 30, 2011. Recently, the staff announced DARK HIGHLANDS: FAIRY TALES, FABLES, AND FOLKLORE, VOLUME 1, a second, fantasy-based book for release in January 2012.


Why We Need Your Help

None of the production team for DARK HIGHLANDS receives compensation for the work that we put into the ANTHOLOGY or FTF&F. It is a labor of love, as all of us are passionate about the arts. All funds that we make from sales of our publications and merchandise go directly back into paying for content, and covering printing and marketing costs. But as a small publisher with a volunteer staff, we can't do it alone (unlike PBS and NPR, we don't receive government money). Dark Highlands is looking to raise $3500 to cover the costs of operation for a full year's worth of publication. That would include the publication of DARK HIGHLANDS ANTHOLOGY, VOLUME 3 in October of 2011, DARK HIGHLANDS: FAIRY TALES, FABLES, AND FOLKLORE, VOLUME 1 in January 2012, DARK HIGHLANDS ANTHOLOGY, VOLUME 4 in April of 2012, the costs to market the three of these books, and, of course, paying the contributors for their works that appear in the volumes. By contributing to the Dark Highlands Year 2 Fundraising Campaign. you're not only helping Dark Highlands out, you're also supporting the arts!


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about Dark Highlands! Join our Facebook or Twitter page! Check out our website - www.darkhighlands.com - and purchase copies of our previous Anthologies! And most importantly, tell your friends about us!

story:
Bruce Harlen: the Artist, the Legendary Love

                                        


UPDATE: The Bruce Harlen: Retrogamer Legacy Project can help you fundraise for Christmas!  Simply login to Indiegogo, use their share tools, and when contributions associated with your unique id total $500 or more, you get 10% back as a donation to your school or charity!

If you're not inclined to fundraise, but still want a chance at a free book, doll and framed print, login to Indiegogo, use their share tools to invite your friends, and when contributions associated with your unique id total $500 or more, you win a free book, doll and print!

THE STORY:  You may not have heard of the late great Bruce Harlen before, but he was legendary to his friends, family and fans.  Bruce worked for many years as a barista in Auckland New Zealand.  A popular, handsome and spirited guy, the dollars flowing into the till would often go up when Bruce was on duty.  The Bruce Harlen: Retrogamer Legacy Project memorializes his awesome coffee "foam" art, as well as his incredible attention to detail in the designs and illustrations he typically drew on the bus to work.   You will be charmed by the sincerity and sentiment of his writing and poetry and we invite you to trace the amazing mazes he created to entertain the three lil' monsters he loved the most:  his children Ruby, Ari and Nina.  A gamer in his teens, he was known for finding the "glitch" in any game, spinning the win to walk away with all the points, winning hearts and minds with his romantic chivalry and genuine love for people.

Bruce died suddenly on July 6th 2014, while on his honeymoon.  The Bruce Harlen: Retrogamer Legacy Art project is all about establishing a viable inheritance for his three children from their father's artistry.   Monies we bring in over the 300K mark (which is a minimum for kids' expenses and education) will be directed toward the development of a computer game for kids featuring Bruce's beloved Bibibot character.  Based on Bruce's storyboards, drawings and script notes, Bibi the Bot has been born into the virtual world by the extraordinary artist Arcebus.  She already has taken on a life of her own!

Help us get the ball rolling and develop the Harlen Comic Kingdom!

                     You Give What You Get

CHECK OUT OUR REFERRAL PROMOTION!  Let your friends in on the game and grab all the perks in one go! 

We have wonderful perks so you can participate no matter what your budget.

  • $5 buys you downloadable mazes, $20 buys the downloadable romantic legacy, the afterlife collaboration between Bruce Harlen and his wife Lora Keyes.

  • If you're not keen on downloading and want a beautifully designed, graphically rich and romantic art book, buy a soft or hard cover edition of The Brulo Love Legacy Book, a compelling compendium of coffee art, thoughts, poems, stories, photography and Bruce Harlen's unique illustrations.  The first 100 books will be sold with a one-of-a-kind, laminated bookmark made of a redeemed coffee loyalty card with hand-drawn illustrations by Bruce.


  • The book is nearly finished so you won't have a long wait for the print version.  Here's some samples of the content:


                      

                           

 

          

                         

  
  
  • Mazes are also available in print form with plastic pages over them, so you (or some kids you know) can do them again and again! 
  • Buy a limited edition collectible 43 cm Bibibot Doll designed and produced to the highest standard in Germany with interchangeable faces and a magnetic head!




  • Five of Bruce's certified original drawings will be up for sale.  This is the very best of his work and there won't be more from this artist so tell all the discriminating collectors you know! (See the gallery for a closer look at each original art work!)

  

Ready to spawn:

Bruce had wanted his Bibibot character to be developed into a game for kids about the importance of setting a worthy goal.  He wanted an open-ended game that allowed for kids to determine their own goals and then share them and get feedback from their peers.  Imagine how much it means to have a worthy goal and how this can help kids as they wade through all the information and entertainment of everyday life!

Risk.  What risk?

And our 3-D developer has exceptional professional experience (12+ years with one of the top three animation studios on Earth).  We can easily facilitate the development of the game and there is no risk of non-delivery of any of our perks.  You are absolutely assured of getting the downloads, the print book in soft or hardcover, the framed prints and the original art.  We're not offering a free game if we build it, we'll only go ahead with the game if we far exceed our (worthy) goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not inclined to spend any of your own dosh but believe in our project, please do whatever you can to let the world know about The Bruce Harlen: Retrogamer Legacy Project.  Share our endeavour with your social network or tweet about us or even tug on the sleeve of a doll collector you know!

Buy a limited edition collectible 43 cm Bibibot Doll designed and produced to the highest standard in Germany with interchangeable faces and a magnetic head!






Five of Bruce's certified original drawings will be up for sale.  This is the very best of his work and there won't be more from this artist so tell all the discriminating collectors you know! (See the gallery for a closer look at each original art work!)


   
  Ready to spawn:
Bruce had wanted his Bibibot character to be developed into a game for kids about the importance of setting a worthy goal.  He wanted an open-ended game that allowed for kids to determine their own goals and then share them and get feedback from their peers.  Imagine how much it means to have a worthy goal and how this can help kids as they wade through all the information and entertainment of everyday life!
  Risk.  What risk?
And our 3-D developer has exceptional professional experience (12+ years with one of the top three animation studios on Earth).  We can easily facilitate the development of the game and there is no risk of non-delivery of any of our perks.  You 
are absolutely assured of getting the downloads, the print book in soft 
or hardcover, the framed prints and the original art.  We're not offering a free game if we build it, we'll only go 
ahead with the game if we far exceed our (worthy) goal!
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you're not inclined to spend any of your own dosh but believe in our project, please do whatever you can to let the world know about The Bruce Harlen: Retrogamer Legacy Project.  Share our endeavour with your social network or tweet about us or even tug on the sleeve of a doll collector you know!

story:
Why We Are Writing this Book

Andy’s “Why”

My ex-wife and I are friends. Our kids are whole. Our divorce cost us about $300. We still share the same mutual friends. My parents still treat her as their daughter. Based on what I see out in the world, we are unusual. We are the exception. But does it really have to be that way? Unfortunately, both of us have many friends, colleagues and acquaintances who are suffering through the divorce process. My ex-wife and I are often asked, “How did you do it? How did you guys have such a ‘good’ divorce? What was your secret?” The purpose of this book is to answer these questions.

Becky’s “Why”

Unlike Andy, I grew up around some very painful divorces. The kind of divorce where kids are evicted from their homes two days before Christmas, because some judge decided he wanted to give the house to the “other spouse.” The kind of divorce where ex-spouses stopped talking to one another and have never talked to one another again, despite 20 years of history and kids in the picture.  I didn’t believe there could be a better “model” for divorcing. Yet, I had hope. I was and still am passionate that a better way could be found. Then one day I became a divorce mediator. People ask me all of the time: “Is it really possible to have a ‘friendly’ divorce?” Just as Andy acknowledged above, many people are surprised that there is such a thing as a “good” divorce.

Call to Action

So we wanted to write this book to reveal the secrets of the “good divorce" as a real possibility for couples – an alternative to fighting, bickering over who gets the end table, and abusing their kids over who loves them more.

The money that we raise on Indiegogo will be used for 3 purposes:

  1. To help pay for the initial publishing cost

  2. To help pay for initial marketing of the book

  3. To fund the creation of a website where we can collect and share stories, information, and advice about what works and doesn't work in creating a good divorce. We will be asking all of you for your recommendations on lawyers, mediators, and counselors who support the "Good Divorce" process. The website will provide a place where you can find out what resources are available in your local area.

story:
Hi, I am Susan Letendre, an environmental educator, social justice activist, and a storyteller. 

My Bonnie The Backyard Bunnie is a children's story that was created through a series of accidents, magical coincidences, and the generosity of an amazing Cuban artist, Saulo Serrano and other Cuban people. Told from the viewpoint of a young rabbit, the story teaches children ages 3 to 8 that everything in the world has a place, and everything fits together. It is a story of gratitude to and for the world.

This is a tale that wants to be told, and I feel lucky to be able to tell it! And so fortunate to  be working with Saulo Serrano, a Cuban artist of magical ability and generous spirit (he and some of his paintings can be found on Flkr.com).

Your gift will turn this tale-that-wants-to-be-told into a book, and allow travel back to Cuba to work on publishing it there, so that it will be in the hands, eyes, ears, and hearts, of Cuban children as well.

What Is Needed:

graphic designer to put illustrations and script in publishable form
 3,000.00
copyright registration 35.00
ISBN number 99.00
upfront printer costs
179.00
upfront published copies for this campaign's gifts (average costs)
 891.00


TOTAL= 4,204.00
 If the campaign earns more funds, I will use them to travel to Cuba to work with the artist and other contacts to try to have the book published there. Everything in Cuba is about relationships, and, relationships require being there! If not, I will couple leading social justice delegations with brief visits to Saulo and Cuban publishing contacts. (This will take a couple of years, and may not be as successful as a dedicated visit.). However, no matter what comes, this book will be published in the U.S.!
A Challenge:

One of the challenges I face in the project is the difficult relationship between the U.S. and Cuban governments, By U.S. law, no business dealings can be conducted between Cubans and U.S. citizens. Fortunately, Saulo Serrano's only interest is to have this story available to a wide audience of children. He and the interpreters/translators in Cuba have donated all their time and work. My only interest is in bringing this book to life, as well. So, I will donate my time and energy to try to have it published in Cuba as well. I have faith in Cubans, and our mutual caring for each other and the message of this book, that it will happen! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools to help me generate Bonnie, The Backyard Bunnie buzz!

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK

Hi, my name is Alice Eckles and I need your help to publish my upcoming novel. The Literature Preferred By Wild Boar: An Optimistic Story About The Future is a humor filled post-apocalyptic novel about an environmental disaster that leaves humanity scrambling for new ways to live. Think JK Rowling meets George Orwell.  

In 2056 the world's population is down to a few thousands after The Great Wobble, a catastrophic weather event. Deb a middle aged woman rebuilding her life and suffering from the loss of her career creates a project for herself. She is going to seek out a story that will help humanity survive. To do this she researches her grandfather's life crisis, and how he came through it. Her interest seems to draw lost family members out of the woodwork. 

The trouble starts when a wild boar befriends her. Deb's neighbors-who have had their prestigious plants uprooted-  think the boar is her responsibility. They demand the Deb kill the boar, or else it's war. This neighbor, Alfred, is a French diplomat of sorts. Deb is an intuitive, nature loving person and doesn't want to kill the boar. Eventually she does decide to hunt the wild boar, under pressure from her husband, Charles, but also out of curiosity about hunting and this new hunger for meat that has come over the community. Eating meat had fallen into disrepute, but ever since Alfred's wife became pregnant the taboo seemed ready to break. 

As Deb hunts the boar she is led into a spiritual world seemingly annexed off the everyday landscape. After she kills the boar undigested letters are discovered in his intestines that help Deb with her story and unite the community. The feast of wild boar also has the transformative effect of giving everyone a boost of warmth and self-knowledge. Deb's family as well as the human family are brought together.

READ A SAMPLE CHAPTER

ABOUT THE AUTHOR


I am the author of A Phrasebook for Spiritual Emergencies My work has been published in the Seattle Review, Queen City Review, Back Home Magazine, Bee Culture, and Vermont’s Local Banquet. I am  a graduate of Bennington College and Antioch New England Graduate School, with a background as a visual artist, and art teacher. I have two grown daughters which I count as my greatest success.

I live with Ross Conrad in Middlebury, Vermont where we keep bees and grow shiitakes. As homesteaders, we live in a 20' round yurt without electricity or running water and we are in the process of building a cordwood house. This novel was a way for me to explore a haunting family story through fiction and is textured with experiences of all we have learned through our choice to live a lifestyle of self sufficiency. 

Learn more at www.alice-eckles.com.

REVIEWS OF PREVIOUS WORK 

"Alice's new work is terrific. She brings gravity and personality to every page, and remains one of the slyest wits out there. The work is concentrated and forceful -- she's on a roll." -Jonathan Lethem (for “A phrasebook for spiritual emergencies”)

"Alice Eckles has a gloriously idiosyncratic voice and a serious, hard-won vision of life; she writes amazing sentences." - David Shields (for “A phrasebook for spiritual emergencies”)

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

I started this campaign to self publish and market my first novel, The Literature Preferred by Wild Boar I believe in self publishing because as a visual artist I enjoy being able to complete projects in their own time and when they are done distribute the work independently.

I need to raise $2,000 to go toward the publication and promotion of The Literature Preferred by Wild Boar. There are many expenses associated with publishing and marketing a book from the ISBN number to buying  books to sell. I am fortunate to have the in-kind support of graphic and marketing professionals in my family. So all the money I receive from this fundraiser will go towards making this book as successful as possible. If I don't reach my goal I will still use the funds to publish my book and will produce it at a lower cost or raise the rest of the money another way.

The various perks include My first book of essays, A Phrase Book for Spiritual Emergencies, The Literature Preferred by Wild Boar when it is published, and gifts from our honey booth, Dancing Bee Art. Many I have created myself including herbal healing salve, beard wax, beeswax candles, beeswax ingots, and propolis tincture as well as other bee related items such as Beeswrap, and an 8 oz. jar of Dancing Bee Gardens honey.

THE IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Contributors will help me publish and market this exciting new novel! And thus will be helping me to build my career as a writer. This book may be very helpful to people in ways I cannot foresee. Consider making a contribution in support of this work.

I am confident I will be successful in this new project as I self published A Phrase Book for Spiritual Emergencies and have started to turn a small profit from it. I am known for my follow through rest assured your contribution will help get this book in print early 2015, thank you!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share this opportunity to get involved in publishing The Literature Preferred by Wild Boar, tell all your friends especially those who like to read! Use Indigogo's share tools to spread word,  thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Six Reasons to Eat Local

  • Personal Health--food grown organically near where you live has more nutrients, and tastes better than factory food.
  • The Health of the Earth--local food requires much less in the way of chemical and petroleum inputs. If you care about climate change, pollinators, and the environment in general than local food is the way to go.
  • Defeat Monsanto--It is the only way the average person can help defeat the plans of corporations like Monsanto. Seed saving, gardening, and buying local organic food is voting against Big Ag with your dollars. 
  • Builds Strong Local Communities--sharing in the growing and gathering of food is the oldest shared human activity. When people come together in the garden it grows deep ties with each other along with the produce. 
  • Food Security--The only way to protect our food supply is to control it ourselves by growing it ourselves. There are some very large private entities that would like to take that right away from us. We can't allow this to happen. Growing food is growing freedom.
  • Eating Local is Good for the Spirit-- anyone who has put their hands in the sweet earth will understand what I mean by this.

About the book:

I am writing this book so that every person in America can enjoy these benefits. Factory food is "easy". If you have enough money you just go to the store and buy it--maybe already cooked, or at least neatly packaged. Finding and obtaining the fresh and healthy local foods can be a lot harder. Impossible in some places, but never easy. Local food can also be expensive, which shuts out the poor and struggling middle class from the health and social benefits of eating local.

This book will help you find local food where you live, and discuss ways of making it more accessible. 

In order to complete this work it is my intention to physically visit and research local food system in every state and region in the country. Anyone can do Internet research on this subject, but to write a book like this it is necessary to observe conditions "on the ground". 

Here is a draft list of chapters:

What is Factory Food, What is REAL food?

Why Don't More People Buy Local Food? The Obstacles that Keep Us on Factory Food

The Elements of a Local Food System: CSAs, Farmer's Markets, Community Gardens, Home Food Gardens, Gleaning, Casual Barter, Organic Food Hubs, Local Markets, Artisanal Manufacture, and Home Manufacture

Affordability--How Can we Attain Food Justice and How Can the Poor and Struggling Middle Class Eat Real Local Food?

Animal Husbandry

At Home Manufacture: Bread, Ferments, Canning, Drying

A 50 State (Plus DC) Guide to Local Food with an appendix listing contact information for all sources

About the author:

My name is Annabel Ascher and I am both a writer and a food activist. I have two main blogs, The Frugal Goddess and The Scratch cook. In recent years I have become more and more concerned about the factory food supply and what it does to damage our planet and our health. As a cook I longed for good real foods to produce amazing meals. I decided to get off "factory" foods, and joined a community supported farm. There were challenges I never dreamed of, even in a place that is known as "real food heaven." I began to wonder how hard it would be in other places not so blessed, and then I decided to find out for myself, and share that information in the form of a guidebook.

What We Need & What You Get

Needs:

In order to write this book I will need to travel all across the country including Hawaii and Alaska. I will be staying mostly in hostels and taking trains and busses. But tickets will still be required and I will have to buy food and lodging.

The research phase will take one year of travel from 10 to 14 days out of each month, starting in September of 2013.

It is my intention at this time to self-publish, though I would be willing to consider a traditional publishing house if any should offer.

Transportation: $9500

Lodging: $4500

Food while traveling: $3600

Laptop for travel: $1400

Software for mobile writing and production: $1000

Accountability:

I will be doing regular blog posts to update the contributors on the progress of the book, from research to post-production. Check in and follow along as I travel throughout the country.

Tentative Schedule so far: Seattle July 30-August 3 Denver August 24-31 The North west in September, New England in October  The Southeast in November (DC, Virginia and West Virginia, Georgia, Alabama, and the Carolinas). 

What's in it for you:

I have perks for donations from $10 to $1000. First of all is the satisfaction of helping to create a book that fills a need among people who have to eat, as well as striking a blow against Monsanto and other Big Ag corporations. But that clearly isn't enough. So please look at the goodies in the Perks section! 

The Impact

There are more people every day that want to get involved with local foods. Some are foodies that crave the superior taste of local foods. Some are food activists that see the effect that food insecurity and poor nourishment is having on our communities. Some are seeking better personal health. But the situation as regards our food supply is murky at best. This guide will help show people in diverse communities how they can get involved in the local food system, or build a local food system where none exists.

This book will be especially important for those people that are struggling financially but still want to feed themselves and their families REAL food. There will be information to help the poor and struggling middle class make truly healthy food choices and get food security.

This guide will help people to feed themselves healthy REAL food and increase the prosperity of their communities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but can't spare any money at all, there are still some great ways to get involved. Do you know some one I should talk to about the food system where YOU live? Do you have some knowledge that would help me write this book? I will be interviewing hundreds of people before I am done. Maybe you or someone you know will be one of them.

You can also spread the word. Paste my campaign on your Facebook timeline, tweet the link, or do an email blast. If you are having a hard time financially but still want to eat well, this book will be especially important for you.

If you would like to help but can't spare any money at all, there are still some great ways to get involved. Do you know some one I should talk to about the food system where YOU live? Do you have some knowledge that would help me write this book? I will be interviewing hundreds of people before I am done. Maybe you or someone you know will be one of them.
You can also spread the word. Paste my campaign on your Facebook timeline, tweet the link, or do an email blast. If you are having a hard time financially but still want to eat well, this book will be especially important for you.

story:
Bref résumé

Je m'appelle Edith-Anne Murray et je travaille depuis plus de 20 ans dans le domaine des ventes et plus spécifiquement du réseautage d'affaires. J'ai suivi une tonne de formations et lu plusieurs livres sur le sujet. Mon constat : le message est assez redondant. On explique et réexplique comment serrer des mains et sourire poliment. Et bien sûr, on insiste sur l’importance d’avoir une stratégie, sans toutefois nous dévoiler la recette. Comme je suis resté chaque fois sur mon appétit, j’ai décidé d’écrire un livre qui approfondit vraiment le riche sujet du réseautage d’affaires.

Ce livre est une oeuvre de référence sur tous les « COMMENT ? » du réseautage:

-COMMENT monter une stratégie ?

-COMMENT faire la gestion du rendement ?

-COMMENT assurer des suivis efficaces ?

 

Le livre est déjà en cours d'écriture et je cherche du financement pour la révision et la publication de celui-ci.

Ce guide pratique permettra à tout travailleur autonome, étudiant, grande entreprise et nouvel arrivant de tisser des liens solides et pertinents.  Que l’objectif soit de trouver un emploi, des partenaires ou des clients, chacun y trouvera des conseils pratiques et une méthode éprouvée.

L'objectif est de récolter la somme de 5000 $ afin de faire réviser le texte (2000 $) et de mettre un dépôt pour l'impression du livre (3000$ min).

N'oubliez pas de partager ! Le réseautage, c’est aussi sur le web.

Et merci!!!!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am a retired art teacher, artist and writer.   My mission in starting this series is so young people of color can see them selves represented on the pages and be encouraged to continue reading.  The image of Peanut is one that little black girls can relate to.
      
  • This project is to raise money to fund the production of the first book in the proposed series titled "The Adventures of Peanut”.  Without the funds it will be impossible.  The money will go towards paying for the editing, illustration, production, and publishing fees.  The first book, Daddy's Girl - Her Name is Peanut, is already written and introduces Peanut and her family. 
  •  There is an enormous demand for this kind of content.  School librarians try very hard to put books with a wide range of characters on their shelves.  According to data from the Census Bureau, nearly half of today's children under 5 years old are non-white.  It's also important for white children to see characters of different races.  They will learn to appreciate the differences and see how they are the same.  The other cultures will be seen less as 'others'.
  • PEANUT, an energetic and spirited five year old lives in the country and loves to play outside doing just about everything except digging ditches.  She had a head full of wavy dark hair that surrounds her brown face falling to her waist.  She just started school and likes the new friends she has met.  Peanut likes to draw and does pictures to go with stories she makes up.  Since they live in the country her brother is her usual playmate at home.  She likes face-time with her school friends, her cousins and her favorite Auntie.
  • EXCERPT:  Peanut is her Daddy's baby girl.  There is only one like her and she knows she is special.  He calls her his little Peanut, like the nuts he loves.  Sitting at her Daddy's side Peanut eats the nuts as he shells them.  Her Daddy really loves peanuts and Peanut loves them too. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I will need $2500.00 cover the cost of editing, production, publishing fees and to contract an illustrator.   I envision the illustrations in water color. Though an artist myself, water color is not my strength.    I am a collage artist.
  • For a much appreciated contribution you will receive a magnet, print or limited Edition print of Little Girl with Braids, one of my collages.
  • Where will the funds go if I don't meet my goal? I will use the funds to begin the contract with the Award Winning Children's artist who will be illustrating the series.

The Impact

  • There are some books that have African American characters in them but not enough.  There are No Series built around an African-American girl. 
  • I have gotten  positive feedback as well as additional story ideas from friends and family.  Most are anxiously waiting for Book 1 to be published.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacles I may face on the way to achieving my goal are finding a publisher that has the author's interest at heart.

    • Traditional publishers don't take new and unknown authors seriously so most must self-publish.  Those publishers can be unscrupulous and predatory.
    • I have been diligent in my search and unwavering in my criteria expectations.  I eliminated two final publishers because they also engaged in some of the same predatory practices that are the norm.  A fellow writer told me about his publisher and vouched for their ethical and fair treatment of authors.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can contribute any amount.  But, If you just can't that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please  get the word out and tell people about my campaign to get the first book in The Adventures of Peanut published.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends, family and acquaintances about the campaign and about the Series!

story:
**December 1, 2016: BOOK IS BEING PRINTED! Please refer to the "Updates" page for the latest news on the book's production and delivery.**

**Thanks to over 460 backers, we reached and exceeded our original goal. Thank you!**

We are keeping this campaign open, as we have a long list of projects (and costs) associated with our new book, Ancient Map for Modern Birth. First on the list is the e-book! We estimate this will cost between $4000-5000, so we are well on our way to making this a reality. The next item is a Spanish translation and distribution network, both in the U.S. and internationally. This is likely a $12,000-$15,000 project, which includes translation, design, printing, and marketing/distribution.
So, we are aiming for $50,000 total to make these projects happen. As of today, we are adding the e-book as a perk, for only $10 (and no shipping!). This is a special discounted pre-order price. Keep spreading the word! And keep reading to learn more about our vision for changing the conversation about birth in our culture...

1. About the Book

When Birthing From Within was published 18 years ago, it was hailed as a “landmark in the history of childbirth.” Since that time, Birthing From Within has been a leader in changing the conversation about birth. Some of the ideas Pam England presented that were seen as radical and controversial are now not only accepted and embraced, and have even gone mainstream. Now Pam England is ready to turn the childbirth preparation on its head—again!—with a book that presents the cohesive and evolved vision and model that has been developed and refined over many years of teaching, reflecting, and supporting thousands of parents and birth professionals around the world. This is the Ancient Map for Modern Birth.

Pam has been working on this book (with the helps of Virginia Bobro and many others) for nearly five years: the writing is done, all the illustrations are complete (take a peek at a few of them in the gallery), and the final proofreading and book design are underway. Publication date is just around the corner: January 2017. Become a backer of this campaign and you will be first in line to get your hands on this book! You can help make this happen, and we need and value your support!

Already, the Birthing From Within message has reached hundreds of thousands of families and professionals. Our trainings are in demand around the world, and BFW childbirth classes are offered in 20 countries around the world. There is demonstrated interest our approach to the childbirth preparation and healing. This book is eagerly awaited by those who are already a part of Birthing From Within.

Every pregnant woman and birth professional will benefit from the compelling blend of current research intertwined with processes and stories that support a woman’s determination, self-respect, and readiness to deal with any type of birth, in any setting (from home to operating room). Our map, inspired by ancient teachings, offer the modern woman a step-by-step guide to understanding her emotional, physical, and psychological journey through the childbearing year. Readers will enjoy in-depth exploration of the story of Inanna, the Laborinth™, as well as practical information, art, rituals and ceremonies, mindfulness practices, and meditations that together provide a rich and stimulating pathway for women to discover personal and collective meaning during the profound rite of passage that is birth. Take a peek at the Table of Contents here.

2. Why the book is self-published 

Did you know that Birthing From Within was self-published and is still one of the most successful and beloved childbirth books ever? Despite competing bids from several publishing houses, we decided to self-publish this new book. 

Here’s why: Ancient Map for Modern Birth is not like any other childbirth book out there. Self-publishing ensures creative control and a collaborative process between authors, artist, and designer. The complex and elegant interior design, including over 140 illustrations, is considerable and requires attention to detail by a skilled designer who really embraces our vision. We are so pleased with the look and feel of this book; what a joy it is to see it come to life in the way we envisioned.

3. Reviews

"This book reaches far beyond the typical pregnancy and childbirth book. It guides us to find that place inside every human being which connects us to an ancient way of knowing and way of being. When we are connected to that, we cannot get lost. The excitement I felt when reading this book was like embarking on a major journey.  Each chapter was filled with unexpected delights: a story, a remarkable illustration, a new practice. It was like finding a new favorite spot, which I hated to leave, but then getting to discover yet another one. The insights in this book teach us so much more than how to birth.  They teach us how to be.  If you are a parent, want to be a parent, know a parent, have a parent, then read this book to find your inner map for how to prepare for birth, how to be with birth, how to talk with people about birth, how to simply BE." --Carrie Kenner, Doula Trainer, Seattle, WA

"Pam England's wisdom helps women find their inner warrior, their empowering voice, their ability to trust their gut."  --Colleen Goidel, Doula & Mentor, Atlanta, GA

"This book really shows the greater vision of Birthing From Within, which is about awakening the spirit. As I read it, I am given a new lens, a new map, for guiding parents, and also for looking at my own births. This has been so healing on many levels. Thank you!"  --Michelle Beaulieu, Doula and Mentor, Sand Lake, NY
 

"Ancient Map for Modern Birth goes deeply into preparations for two rites of passage: childbirth and parenting. This book covers even more topics of interest to modern mothers and fathers (than Birthing From Within) and emphasizes the importance of staying flexible and open to the unknown possibilities and surprises that are a part of pregnancy, childbirth and parenting." --Rosanna Davis, CPM, Palo Alto, CA

4. Why your contribution matters

Ancient Map for Modern Birth is more than just another book on birth—it presents a fresh new paradigm for childbirth preparation. When you become a backer, you are a key to bringing our project into the hands of pregnant women and birth professionals as quickly as possible.

Supporters at every level not only helps raise funds for a timely production and printing of this unique and beautiful book, but also provide peace of mind to the authors so they can focus on bringing their message to the world.

When you back our campaign, you are taking an active part in changing how women see themselves, and how they are seen by others, during pregnancy and birth. An investment in this book is an investment in women—which is so important in today’s political climate.

Help us change the conversation about birth in our culture!

5. Pre-order your copy of Ancient Map for Modern Birth

 

 

$23 gets you a copy of Ancient Map for Modern Birth, hot off the presses. Our backers will be the first to get their hands on the new book!

$30 gets you a signed copy of Ancient Map for Modern Birth, as soon as they are available!

ALL Ancient Map book perks include: audio downloads of Pam telling the story of Inanna’s Descent into Laborland, leading a visualization, and teaching you pain-coping and mindfulness practices.

6. More perks!

We can’t produce this book without your support, so to show our gratitude for your contribution, we’re offering a variety of perks, including original artwork by Pam England. Check out the 20 levels of financial support, choose one, click—and the perk will be yours! Some are available in limited quantities (first-come, first-serve), so hurry! (Please check the estimated date of delivery of your perk).

7. Other ways you can help

Every contribution, whether $10 or $5000, helps us reach our goal in 30 days. So, too, does getting the word out about our project! Word-of-mouth and your excitement helps multiply the value of your support.

  • Please tell a friend, or 25 friends, or even a 100 friends, acquaintances and co-workers, clients, about Ancient Map for Modern Birth!
  • Get the word out by phone, email, and talking it up.
  • Post a message on your Facebook page.
  • Even better, post a link to the campaign video.
  • Tweet a link to our IndieGoGo page.
  • Share the perk pictures on Instagram!
  • Visit our website and blog to see all the other wonderful things we offer.

*Some people are not yet familiar with the power of crowd-funding. Explain how it works and motivate someone to check out our Ancient Map for Modern Birth campaign.

8. Where will funds go?

With the writing, editing, illustrations, and cover design complete, some of the money raised will go to pay bills already incurred (so we know exactly how much we need: these amounts won’t increase). The rest is designated for finishing the design, printing, shipping, and marketing expenses. Here’s how the $30,000 breaks down:

  • Editing: $4000 Actual: $10,000
  • Cover design: $1500  Actual: $3,000
  • Digital scanning and preparation of illustrations: $2500 Actual: $3,000
  • Interior book design, layout, and finishing touches: $5000  Actual: $6,000
  • Marketing (incl. IndieGogo fees): $7,000  Actual: $8,000
  • Printing: $10,000  Actual: $15,000

Our initial goal of $30,000 will cover the investment we have already made in bringing this book--our vision--to the public. We are looking forward to launching stretch goals for the e-book, translated editions, and other exciting related projects.  This is just the beginning—join the wave!

Thank you so much for your support!

www.BirthingFromWithin.com
