story:
About Fatty Boom Boom…

Fatty Boom Boom is an adorably witty children’s picture book for ages 7 and up. It will give children the opportunity to learn about self acceptance, the importance of acknowledging individualism and their own uniqueness. This thirty-four page picture book was inspired by my personal experiences with being bullied. I am the seventh, youngest and only American born child of a Jamaican-Maroon Indian and a Jamaican-Turk Jew.  

I was under the impression that I was an only child and was being raised as such in Brooklyn, New York. I didn't meet my four brothers and two sisters until I was three years old. When my parents completed filing for my siblings’ citizenship to bring them to the U.S. I was a chubby five year old. When they arrived they were quite mean and bullied me for years. To make matters worse despite being born in America, I was raised in a West Indian household and spoke Patois at school so I was bullied by American children for my accent. I remember the feelings of helplessness, rejection and loneliness that I felt and drew inspiration from those memories.

 The story utilizes the West Indian moniker, “fatty boom boom” which is an ambiguous term because it is deprecating yet it is also used as an endearing  term in Jamaica; but is the American equivalent to the derogatory word, fatso. In this endearing familial tale the lead character, Nemah is a loveable chubby cheetah cub. She has two brothers, Nato and Nokey. But only Nokey truly accepts her. Nato teases her for being overweight like the other cheetah cubs living in their Sout African habitat.

In spite of the ridicule and obvious physical obstacles, Nema surprises everyone with her limitless spunk and literally saves the day for one of her tormentors. Fatty Boom Boom is an adorable comical spin on an unsightly societal blot plaguing youngsters across the globe. The story is infused with positive messaging enabling children to grasp the importance of self esteem from early on.

Bullying incidents have escalated  and run the gamut from schools to the workplace. The most disconcerting underlying issue is that young children are deeply affected with emotional baggage carrying over into adulthood. In fact every seven minutes a child is bullied which contributes to the formulation of their psyche.

Fatty Boom Boom will aide children in learning self-worth and individuality. They will also learn that differences make the world an interesting place and bullying is just an attack on the very things that makes human beings special.

About The Author

 My name is Nurit Folkes and I’m  a published author of three adult fiction novels published by Teri Woods Publishing. The Sins trilogy includes Triangle of Sins, Rectangle of Sins which made the Essence best seller’s list and Circle of Sins. I am a proud parent, F.I.T. alumni and actively involved in the PACE for teens mentorship program.  I get involved to leave my imprint on the world.

Do Something.

Be A Part of The Fatty Boom Boom Movement. It highlights bullying and its affects, entertains, educates and will hopefully earn surmountable funds for outstanding charities devoted to eliminate bullying.

A percentage of all proceeds from sales and downloads for Fatty Boom Boom (including printed copies if stretch goal is reached) will be donated to the following charities respectively:

25% to St. Jude’s Children’s hospital® helping to care for children and their families dealing with the worst bully of them all, cancer.

 25% to Kind campaign®which focuses on girl-against-girl bullying.

Being part of the effort to educate and eradicate bullying is an honor and privilege. Please join us in doing your part. Spread the word and be a part of the solution.

We Need You

We know becoming a backer monetarily may be difficult so if you are skilled in printing, illustration/art, media marketing and promotions, web design, software and/or games application development then please consider donating your time and  expertise to the cause. If you become a “skills backer”  you will receive all of the rewards just like contributors who donate $1000, professional credit and also be listed in an acknowledgements page in the e-book and included in the hardcover print once the stretch goal is reached.  Your support is worth so much more than you can imagine.


How Your Contribution Will Make A Difference

We are psyched about the book and all of the branded items which will be sold on the interactive website to assist with the “Beat Bullying with Kindness” movement which will run in conjunction with the e-book release. A delightful Fatty Boom Boom mobile game app will be created once funding is appropriated and will be free to download in order to generate awareness and support. 

Your support will help us to hire a professional to illustrate the book appropriately with legal licensed material and images. My illustrations are crude; made with free online tools/images which may pose legal issues once Fatty Boom Boom is being sold or distributed.

T-shirts and plush stuffed Nema cheetah toys will be sold on the website to generate proceeds. The “Beat Bullying with Kindness” movement consists of promoting Fatty Boom Boom so donations can be submitted to charities dedicated to children. The following is what the Fatty Boom Boom/Beat Bullying with Kindness campaign needs in order to come to fruition and thrive:

BWN Ecommerce Web Design (Interactive Cart with Automated Digital Download for all e-book formats) - $485

J. Alston professional Illustration & claymation - $1,900 (31 pages/ Website & YouTube cartoon)  

Strategic Solutions Web banner & Favicon - $395

Social Identities Facebook/Twitter/YouTube Timeline package- $399

Elance [Arpit Williams top bid] Development of Fatty Boom Boom Mobile Game Application - $535

Vistaprint Custom T-Shirt 2-Designs - 500 Qty  Full Color - $5,650

BigZoo Custom stuffed Nema cheetah plush toys- 500 qty. $2,700




**Please use Paypal and enter T-shirt size in comments section. 

***Free Shipping within US only. Shipped once project is funded. 


Stretch Goals

$20,000 - HARD COVER!

At $20,000, the book will be published in hardcover format. This is a major goal we aspire to reach since children's books are truly meant to be in hardcover. 

$30,000 - CARTOON & ADVERTISING PROMOS!

At $30,000 a publicist will be hired to initiate advertising and promotional strategies; and the Fatty Boom Boom cartoon will be completed and offered to academic institutions for educational purposes.  


If we do not reach the goal your contributions will enable:

·  The Fatty Boom Boom E-book to be managed by Selz (e-sales/digital                  downloads management)

·  A basic website created using Wix (a limited free website builder with ads)

·  T-shirts, 100 qty. (basic text/no designs or color)

·  Email blast service/Facebook & Twitter promos for the e-book and “Beat            Bullying with Kindness” Campaign


The purpose of Fatty Boom Boom is not only to shed light on the bullying epidemic but to also help our youth to love the skin they’re in. The charities chosen for the Fatty Boom Boom “Beat Bullying with Kindness” campaign do so much for our children so it would be a dream to be able to submit donations in the high digit range after the launch of the “Beat Bullying with Kindness” movement and campaign.

Let's make a difference. 



The Team

Nurit Folkes - Author/illustrator

Nico Sante - Creative consultant

Victoria Campos 

Lauriston Simmonds 

Raphael Simmonds

About
Fatty Boom Boom…Fatty Boom Boom is an
adorably witty children’s picture
book for ages 7 and up. It will give children the opportunity to
learn about self acceptance, the importance of acknowledging individualism and
their own uniqueness. This thirty-four page picture book was inspired by my personal
experiences with being bullied. I am the seventh, youngest and only American
born child of a Jamaican-Maroon Indian and a Jamaican-Turk Jew.  I was under the impression that I was an only child and was being raised as such in Brooklyn, New York. I didn't
meet my four brothers and two sisters until I was three years old. When my parents completed
filing for my siblings’ citizenship to bring them to the U.S. I was a chubby
five year old. When they arrived they were quite mean and bullied me for years.
To make matters worse despite being born in America, I was raised in a West
Indian household and spoke Patois at school so I was bullied by American
children for my accent. I remember the feelings of helplessness, rejection and loneliness
that I felt and drew inspiration from those memories.
 The story utilizes the West Indian moniker, “fatty
boom boom” which is an ambiguous term because it is deprecating yet it is also used
as an endearing  term in Jamaica; but is the American equivalent to the
derogatory word, fatso. In this endearing familial tale the lead character,
Nemah is a loveable chubby cheetah cub. She has two brothers, Nato and Nokey. But only Nokey truly
accepts her. Nato teases her for being overweight like the other cheetah cubs living in their Sout  African habitat.

spite of the ridicule and obvious physical obstacles, Nema surprises everyone
with her limitless spunk and literally saves the day for one of her
tormentors. Fatty Boom Boom is an adorable comical spin on an unsightly
societal blot plaguing youngsters across the globe. The story is infused with
positive messaging enabling children to grasp the importance of self esteem
from early on.

story:
Mothered is an upcoming nostalgic/dystopian science fiction story written by Jan Jacob Mekes, based on an idea by Ado Ceric, whose artwork will also feature in the book.

You can pre-order your own copy of the book via this campaign - any help you're able to give would be much appreciated, and will ensure that this book is as good as it deserves to be.

You can help by funding (even if it's just one dollar) and spreading the word, about both this campaign and the book itself.

About the book

Mothered is about two children who live on a long-forgotten island. They live a happy and carefree life, laced with nostalgia. All that changes when the Maternopole, a dystopian society across the sea, gets wind of the island's existence and plans to annex it. The book will explore the clash between these two worlds, the text being accompanied by Ado Ceric' artwork. His series of illustrations, The Remnants of the Childhood, formed the inspiration for this (hopefully) wonderful story.

Sample chapter

So you can get a basic idea of the book, the first chapter is available to read online.

story:
A world in crisis

We write in a time of great uncertainty - with right-wing populism, isolationism and xenophobia gaining ground around the world.

Trump is the most striking example of this, but he is far from alone. His soul-mates in the Netherlands, Greece, Germany and France all sing the same unsavoury song.

And for those reading this, the most immediately dangerous of this gang is the fake "workers' friend" Theresa May, who spins a tale of concern for those suffering the consequences of Tory policies while working flat out to intensify them.

Socialists cannot be bystanders to the slow death of neoliberalism.

This political upheaval across the world offers an unmissable opportunity for socialist ideas to secure a foothold in the popular consciousness.

Public trust in the mainstream, corporate-owned media is at an all time low. And the need for an independent socialist media is at an all time high.

Give socialism a voice

The Scottish Socialist Voice has been in print for 20 years. Since November 1996, it has provided a platform to the anti-war movement, the anti-cuts movement, the radical independence movement and more.

We've hosted Voice Forums in Edinburgh to facilitate important left-wing discussions, with high-profile contributors from different parties and none.

And our paper played a crucial role in the Scottish independence and EU membership referendums by providing a space for alternative political ideas to be put forward.

We want to make the Scottish Socialist Voice an even more powerful voice for people struggling against injustice, discrimination and exploitation.

We need our supporters to dig deep to help us make a long-term investment in our future reporting. This is more important now than ever. We need new equipment, new software and a stronger financial base. Your contributions will go towards:

  • New computer equipment for editing and design
  • Desktop publishing software
  • Camera equipment to cover public events
  • Stickers and postcards to promote the Voice
  • Publishing costs for the Voice and books under a Voice imprint

We recently launched a new online subscriptions system that allows our readers to purchase the Voice in PDF and print editions.

We're expanding our online presence and want to carry on making the Voice relevant in the 21st Century. Fundraising is a crucial part of that.

If you can't contribute cash - you can also help in other ways:

  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • If you want to stock the Voice, call 07810205747

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jacques Maudy.

I am a freelance photographer. My photography partner Jimi Casaccia and I volunteered with the Yangon Heritage Trust in Burma to photo document the historical buildings of Rangoon.

Rangoon, now Yangon is the capital of Burma also called Myanmar. Thanks to 50 years of dictaorship and economic embargo Yangon is the LAST INTACT CITY in Asia. Its amazing architecture is at risk and I’m going to tell you why…

Our photos have had a lot of interest in the media. We decided to make a book, Yangon A City to Rescue, to hold the Myanmar ministers accountable to their promises.

The photos are done. The layout is ready. Now we need your help to print it and launch it. Three photo exhibitions are already planned where the book will be launched - In Yangon, Bangkok and Brisbane. More will be organised with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We travelled to Yangon in May and June 2012. We took the most comprehensive and compelling set of photos of Yangon and its beautiful people - see what the media says about our photos further down. The layout of the book is done and the book is ready to print. It is a 56 pages photo coffee table book 20 x 30 cm (7.87 x 11.81 inches). The book is part of the global campaign of awareness about the dangers that Yangon landscapes faces. It is part of the pressure on government ministers to issue conservation regulations to contain the developers. We need the funds to print "Yangon a City to Rescue" and cover the costs of the launch.

Donors get our warmest thanks, their names listed in the book and on the website, signed original limited serie prints on metallic paper to hang in their home or office and signed ciopies of the first edition of the book.

If we don't reach our goal the number of pages of the book will be reduced to 44 but the book will be printed no matter what.

The Impact

Since the Nobel prize and democracy fighter Aung San Suu Kyi was freed from her 15 years of house arrest, Myanmar has been on my radar. It seemed that the president Thein Sein had decided to lead his country towards democracy. I wanted to witness the hope of the Burmese people.

I came across a video clip on the net where Sonny Thein, one of the founders of the Yangon Heritage Trust, was describing the risks the heritage buildings of Yangon were now facing. If Myanmar headed towards democracy the western embargo would be soon lifted (tembargo has now been lifted since July 2012) and the skyline of Yangon would indeed be at risk. I contacted Sonny immediately and offered to volunteer with the Yangon Heritage Trust to document the historical buildings.

He wrote back: “Come now! We are holding an international conference on the 1st of June and we need to display the photos at the conference. The ministers and conservation experts will be here. Come now.” The monsoon was pouring down on Yangon.  There are at least 180 buildings worth saving in the city. In 6 days the task was impossible for a photographer alone. And here came the first miracle -  Jimi Casaccia, and Italian traveller, was couchsurfing at my place. We had become friends instantly. I forgot to tell you that Jimi is an amazing, extremely talented photographer. He jumped on board without thinking twice.

Myanmar was nothing like we expected. Beautiful people who give you their heart for a smile. Yangon was simmering with hope and energy.

With Jimi we agreed to treat all the pictures the same way. We wanted to grab the officials' attention and make them realize what would be lost if they didn’t listen to the advice of the experts. We didn’t want flat technical architectural photography. We wanted drama.

And here came the second miracle At the conference the Myanmar ministers committed to hold off any further building permits until the Yangon Heritage Trust issued guidelines of conservation. It was a win. We had the feeling that we had contributed to something worth the sweat.

So here comes the book. A book many Burmese people who fled the country under the dictators want to see. A book that will freeze time in 2013 and will hold the ministers accountable to their promises. A book that we can only print with your help.

Please, pledge a donation and get original prints and copies of the book.

Thank you for your support for "Yangon a City to Rescue"

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this on facebook and twitter. Share it with your friends and colleagues. Together we can save the heritage buildings of Yangon for the generations to come.

Use the Indiegogo tools to advertize this campaign.

Thank you!

What the media says:

AuroAsiaReview: "Jacques and Jimi have documented Yangon’s colonial buildings in a comprehensive suite of awe-inspiring images that have ever been produced of Yangon’s colonial buildings. Their photographs allow the majesty of these buildings to speak for themselves, and “are so vital that you’ll literally gasp at the majestic height buildings like the High Court,” claims the YHT."

Wall Street Journal: "Photographers Jacques Maudy and Jimi Casaccia traveled to Yangon in May and June to capture the structures on film before more change comes, in some cases sweet-talking guards and public officials to let them in. Mr. Maudy said he used filters and other effects in Photoshop to make the shots more visually arresting, so that officials would see the architectural treasures in a new way."

The Irrawaddy: "Maudy and Cassaccia have made the best possible use of Rangoon’s dank and overcast climate to soften shadows and bring out excellent details of the heritage buildings in arresting color. In addition, there are many fine examples of portraiture and Rangoon street scenes."

The Gulf Today: "…the result is a stunning body of images of these buildings.."


Culture 360: "The photographers, Australian Jacques Maudy and Italian Jimi Cassaccia, manage to depict a time-warp metropolis through their striking pictures while also sending a serious historical preservation message."

Check here for more media articles...

Complete Bio of Jacques and Jimi

story:
WHAT AM I RAISING MONEY FOR?

To self-publish my second book.

 

ABOUT MY BOOK

I am a tattoo artist and the majority of my clients are women. I have noticed that there are three main motivations that they have for getting tattoos:

1. Freedom

2. Grief

3. Connection

Under this umbrella of motivations there are celebratory sub-themes which include self-expression, awakening, a finalised divorce, escape from abuse, finding a 'tribe', recovery from addictions, coming out and coming of age, to name a few. And then there are those reasons which are yet to resolved or made peace with such as loss of a loved one, loss of a baby or loss of self; therefore, many of the designs I create are for memorial tattoos, images of hope, or covering of self-harm scars. 

Without disclosing any identities or confidential stories, I share these main themes and the way I relate to them myself. With so much darkness creeping to the fore in the recent Covid years, I have witnessed even more boldness and bravery by women who realise that life really is too short to stay in the shadows or play it small. Requests for full sleeves, large sternum pieces, mastectomy scar covers, and a focus on celestial, mystical and witchy designs, show me that a fierce feminine force is stepping up and She wants to be seen. 

 

WHERE THE BOOK TITLE CAME FROM

I began my tattoo apprenticeship in 2017 with a funny, kind and characterful Thai mentor. In 2020 I was asked to join ‘The Mansell Collection,’ and I now run a studio within the business, bringing some feminine energy and creativity to the male-heavy environment. Over the last four years I have gained a wealth of insight into the many secret worlds of women and why they want to get inked. They willingly suffer hours under the needle in order to brand their skin with art and affirmations. My mentor used to laugh and say to me: “No Pain, No Stain!” His words were more profound than he realised. 

 

MY READERS

No Pain, No Stain  is not a self-help book or a diary, rather, an enchanting, funny and deep thought-provoking story. It is a memoir which draws upon my own challenging life-experiences: my yearning for freedom, my battles with body image, my struggle to find harmony between what I feel called  to do in this world and what I have  to do to make a living. And it refers to the practice of tattooing to explore how withstanding pain and darkness is sometimes necessary—and even a voluntary act—in order to gain something permanent in our often superficial and disposable society.

 

MY PREVIOUS BOOK

Last year I self-published a memoir called I Must be a Mermaid : Deep Fear of Shallow Living, which retails on Amazon. On a small scale it was a massive success. I receive so many emotional reviews and DMs from readers who were extremely touched by my story and the level of honesty at which I wrote. It has become very clear who my audience are; they are women of all ages who are searching for more meaning, more magic and more freedom in their lives. They are women who are fed up with feeling ashamed of themselves or of their past, and gain comfort in my rawness about desires, dreams, sexuality, spirituality and unwillingness to conform. I have been so surprised by how most people tell me they read it in just one or two days, that they felt like I was writing their story in some way, that it has relieved anxiety—and I have been blown away by some who go as far as to say it has changed their lives, setting them on a new path. 

 

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT FOR

My last book was published in 2020 by a wonderful online company called Happy Self-Publishing. I was so impressed away by their friendly and 'go-the-extra-mile' approach. Its founder, Jyotsna Ramachandran is an inspiring woman, a really positive-minded entrepreneur who contacted me personally over Zoom to talk excitedly about my project.

I would absolutely LOVE to one day have a literary agent and gain a contact with a traditional publishing house who can market and distribute my books worldwide, not to  mention cover production costs. It's just not happened for me—yet. But the rebel in me refuses watch the years pass by while my work doesn't get out there.

It costs £800 to publish (doing my own editing), and I aim to have it completed by Spring 2022. However, it takes me a long time to save up the money, then more time to start the self-publishing process. My reason for starting a crowdfunding campaign now is so my readers (who are badgering me to write the second book!) can start enjoying and benefitting from it asap, rather than waiting another couple of years.

If you can contribute financially (£2 will make a difference) that would be amazing. If not, then I totally understand. Any sharing of this link would be most appreciated too.

 

ABOUT ME

Originally from Surrey in South East England, I went to Art and Design college before backpacking across the globe at eighteen with my bestie. I then studied for a three year Illustration degree in South Wales. After a couple of years living in London and a bit of an early-life-crisis, I moved to the Channel Islands to start afresh and be by the sea. Now, I am a tattoo artist and a writer, living with my husband and our two little Yorkshire terriers. This year I turn forty and I feel like I'm just getting started. 

 

LINKS:

If you'd like to know more about my writing style, please do have a read of my first book's reviews, using the Amazon shop link (or see one  review clips in the photo section). Amazon link (reviews are at the bottom of the page) :

https://www.amazon.co.uk/Must-Be-Mermaid-Shallo...

 

If you'd like to be kept updated on my progress, please follow me on Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/charlene_hickey_mermaid

 

or on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/CharleneHickeyMermaid

 

(Cover photography is by Sophie Darwin Photography.)


Thank you for taking the time to read all this!

Char xxx

story:
*Note: I have reached my goal of $5,500 to be published! Now, I am aiming for the next goal of $6,500 to publish a hard copy. 

 

Story of My Book

Saving Society with God, Nature, & Music is my story. Through personal experiences, I’ll reveal to you the gifts these treasures have to offer.

My name is Sarah Schott, and I am the author of Saving Society with God, Nature, & Music. I wrote this book because I want to make sure these cultures are not lost for future generations. They have the power to save society if only we are willing to immerse ourselves in them.

In reading this book, my hope is that you will find hope, for yourself and future generations. I want to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for God, nature, and music. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you grow and enrich your own life.

In this book, you'll learn about God, nature, and music, and the wonders they offer. You'll hear stories such as...

  • My grandma battling for her life in the hospital and how it affected my faith.
  • My travels and explorations across the country and how essential it is for us to explore our wild side.
  • My desire to play the violin and the challenges I overcame to become an accomplished musician.

No matter who you are, I promise this book is for you! Everyone can find something to connect to in this book.

Saving Society with God, Nature, & Music is a memoir that speaks to those who want to fill what is missing in their life and ensure a better world for future generations.

 

The Book - Saving Society with God, Nature, & Music

The book has an introduction and three parts.

The Introduction contains the introductory chapters titled “Dear Reader,” “How to Read this Book,” and “A Letter from Mom.” These chapters will help set the scene and guide you through the book.

Part 1 contains four chapters about God. These chapters explore my Christian faith and how Christianity has affected my life. You’ll take a deep dive into some tough topics that can show you freedom and never-ending love.

Part 2 contains four chapters about nature. From hunting to climbing a mountain, you’ll tag along on my outdoor adventures and see what life can be like when we unplug from technology.

Part 3 contains four chapters about music. These chapters unfold my journey of becoming a violinist. Through trials and tribulations, you’ll see the secretive treasures creating music has to offer.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the preorder tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copy Editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who preorder my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, a handwritten thank-you note, and a hand-crafted greeting card!
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the eBook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll publish an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Sarah Schott is an alumnus of The Ohio State University with a Bachelor of Science degree in natural resource management and a minor in community outreach education. She currently works for the Ohio Division of Wildlife where she shares her passion for the outdoors with people of all ages and backgrounds.

Sarah wrote this book because she wants to make a difference. The world cannot be changed overnight, but a difference can be made one person at a time. In a society where hope seems to be lost and busyness is taking over, Sarah wants to show you how God, nature, and music can slow you down and open up to life’s simple pleasures.

Sarah is a devoted, lifelong Christian Catholic, and avid hunter, angler, and outdoor enthusiast. She is also a passionate violinist and writer who loves to share her passions with others. Currently, Sarah resides in Columbus, Ohio with her boyfriend and adorable black Labrador retriever, Retta.

For more information, you can connect with Sarah Schott at sarahschott00@gmail.com and Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address: https://forms.gle/bvzSLKQ2pNPGcXQy8. I will calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via Venmo, PayPal, or another method of your choice.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs for your signed copies within each preorder tier.

The risk of delivering the presale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all presale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #SavingSocietyBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: #SavingSocietyBook
Instagram - @sarahschott_author / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @sarahschottauthor / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Sarah Schott

story:
My Campaign Is 100% Funded!
I am excited to share that I reached my 100% Funding Milestone on my Indiegogo book pre-order campaign! I am both thrilled and grateful for the response to this campaign — this would not be possible without you!

I still have 9 more days left in the campaign and hope to reach the next level of funding. If I am able to reach the $6,000 goal, I can also publish You Must Be A Jones as a hardcover book in April 2021.

Thank you so much for contributing and supporting the publication of my first book!

Lydia Cole

Story of My Book

You Must Be A Jones is my family’s story of how our parents, a committed and hardworking African American couple, created a happy and wholesome life and promising futures for their seven children despite the limitations of segregation and racism.

My name is Lydia Cole and I am the author of You Must Be A Jones. I wrote this book because I wanted to offer a personal perspective on life for an average African American family growing up during some of the country’s most significant periods of change.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you gain a glimpse into the lives of one large black family who refused to let racism and modest means keep them from reaching their goals. I want readers of this book to see the world through our eyes, as we lived it. To see our family and other African American families like ours who refused to be held down and held back. Readers will engage with themes about the impact of segregation and integration, the power of a close family and determined parents, the magic of growing up in a place where everyone knows your name (something mundane), and learn alongside my brothers and sisters about the importance of never giving up.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of values and families, and perseverance and race, through narratives such as:

  • Family was always primary for us. That was never truer than when my grandmother, Nana, died. Our uncle, Dede, lived with her. He would never be able to live alone after contracting Parkinson’s Disease while serving in the army. After my grandmother’s passing, Dede moved into our house — a four-bedroom house with one bathroom, where six children and two adults already lived. Our house was full but never crowded. We always found a way to be there for each other.
  • Our parents had a teamwork approach to raising the seven of us. Mom was the main disciplinarian, caring for us and the household. On the weekends, Dad took a more active role including handling the grocery shopping and taking some of us along. On those trips to the grocery store, my twin brother, younger sister and I would visit the five and dime store where we would have our first encounters with racism. We were around seven or eight years old when we started going there and an old white lady followed and watched us whenever we entered the store. We experienced racism at a young age.
  • Our brother, Mike, was one of four black students to integrate into the schools in the state of Virginia. Despite the hold of segregation being broken, it would take many years before black students felt included in the integrated junior and high school communities. When our sister Roz attended Stratford two years after Mike, she imagined that she would make friends. Not only did that not happen, the school’s assistant principal kept Roz from attending a regional sports day that her class had chosen for her to attend, claiming it would be better for her not to go.

You will love this book if you are interested in reading about the joys and challenges of black family life in 1950's and 1960's America.

You Must Be A Jones speaks to people who enjoy stories about the intersection of family life and history, and who want to grapple with the lived experience of black families in a segregated America. Readers who want to gain insight about the challenges faced by black families during segregation and still today, in a new way, will begin to understand what it means to be viewed as less-than and excluded for nothing more than the color of their skin.

Ultimately, I hope that You Must Be A Jones inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • As a parent, what is the key to raising self-confident, happy, caring children equipped to handle life’s challenges?
  • What role does a spiritual relationship play in preparing children for the future?
  • What is the real-life impact of living in a country that values one group of citizens over another?
  • What is the role of the public education system to teach history that includes all citizens’ contributions in the making of America?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing how to overcome the effects of racial inequity, leverage the benefits of educational opportunity, instill family values, and understand the magic inherent in a community that exemplifies a real-life “village” will change us all for the better.

The Book - You Must Be A Jones

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1: The Introduction + Chapters 1-7. Part One of You Must Be A Jones begins with the reader experiencing a Jones family Thanksgiving — one of our most important family gatherings. The story then takes the reader back in time to introduce our parents’ families, the Joneses and Greenes. You’ll learn how a profound loss for our mother changed her life, forcing her family to relocate back to Arlington, where our Dad also grew up. We see how Mom and Dad experience adversity as young people, and their choice to embrace hope and faith in tough times became foundational characteristics of life as they marry and start their family.

Part 2: Chapters 8-11. Part Two of our story is all about community and family. It's filled with heartwarming stories of growing up in a small African American neighborhood where everybody knows everyone else. It shines a light on our community's decades-long battle to provide the best public education to their children, as we confronted racism and segregation in our day-to-day life. Through it all, you'll see how our faith and involvement in the church was central to believing in a better tomorrow.

Part 3: Chapters 12-17. Part Three begins with Dad's life-long dream to send all of his children to college unfolding. As teenagers, we experience the tradeoffs that came with attending a school where our presence was often and easily ignored even after successfully integrating the Arlington County school system. It's a period of ongoing change with several of us going to college, some of us going to war, and all of us coming of age.

Part 4: Chapters 18-19. Part Four is dedicated to our parent's legacy and the realization of their dreams through their children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. My siblings and I remember our parents, our community, and the gift of love and devotion we were blessed to receive.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

I routinely looked at family albums, hoping to learn something that I didn’t know before. Story of My Book
You Must Be A Jones is my family’s story of how our parents, a committed and hardworking African American couple, created a happy and wholesome life and promising futures for their seven children despite the limitations of segregation and racism.
My name is Lydia Cole and I am the author of You Must Be A Jones. I wrote this book because I wanted to offer a personal perspective on life for an average African American family growing up during some of the country’s most significant periods of change.
My hope is that, in reading this book, you gain a glimpse into the lives of one large black family who refused to let racism and modest means keep them from reaching their goals. I want readers of this book to see the world through our eyes, as we lived it. To see our family and other African American families like ours who refused to be held down and held back. Readers will engage with themes about the impact of segregation and integration, the power of a close family and determined parents, the magic of growing up in a place where everyone knows your name (something mundane), and learn alongside my brothers and sisters about the importance of never giving up.
In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of values and families, and perseverance and race, through narratives such as:

Family was always primary for us. That was never truer than when my grandmother, Nana, died. Our uncle, Dede, lived with her. He would never be able to live alone after contracting Parkinson’s Disease while serving in the army. After my grandmother’s passing, Dede moved into our house — a four-bedroom house with one bathroom, where six children and two adults already lived. Our house was full but never crowded. We always found a way to be there for each other.
Our parents had a teamwork approach to raising the seven of us. Mom was the main disciplinarian, caring for us and the household. On the weekends, Dad took a more active role including handling the grocery shopping and taking some of us along. On those trips to the grocery store, my twin brother, younger sister and I would visit the five and dime store where we would have our first encounters with racism. We were around seven or eight years old when we started going there and an old white lady followed and watched us whenever we entered the store. We experienced racism at a young age.
Our brother, Mike, was one of four black students to integrate into the schools in the state of Virginia. Despite the hold of segregation being broken, it would take many years before black students felt included in the integrated junior and high school communities. When our sister Roz attended Stratford two years after Mike, she imagined that she would make friends. Not only did that not happen, the school’s assistant principal kept Roz from attending a regional sports day that her class had chosen for her to attend, claiming it would be better for her not to go.

You will love this book if you are interested in reading about the joys and challenges of black family life in 1950's and 1960's America.
You Must Be A Jones speaks to people who enjoy stories about the intersection of family life and history, and who want to grapple with the lived experience of black families in a segregated America. Readers who want to gain insight about the challenges faced by black families during segregation and still today, in a new way, will begin to understand what it means to be viewed as less-than and excluded for nothing more than the color of their skin.
Ultimately, I hope that You Must Be A Jones inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

As a parent, what is the key to raising self-confident, happy, caring children equipped to handle life’s challenges?
What role does a spiritual relationship play in preparing children for the future?
What is the real-life impact of living in a country that values one group of citizens over another?
What is the role of the public education system to teach history that includes all citizens’ contributions in the making of America?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing how to overcome the effects of racial inequity, leverage the benefits of educational opportunity, instill family values, and understand the magic inherent in a community that exemplifies a real-life “village” will change us all for the better.
The Book - You Must Be A Jones
The book is written in 4 Parts....
Part 1: The Introduction + Chapters 1-7. Part One of You Must Be A Jones begins with the reader experiencing a Jones family Thanksgiving — one of our most important family gatherings. The story then takes the reader back in time to introduce our parents’ families, the Joneses and Greenes. You’ll learn how a profound loss for our mother changed her life, forcing her family to relocate back to Arlington, where our Dad also grew up. We see how Mom and Dad experience adversity as young people, and their choice to embrace hope and faith in tough times became foundational characteristics of life as they marry and start their family.
Part 2: Chapters 8-11. Part Two of our story is all about community and family. It's filled with heartwarming stories of growing up in a small African American neighborhood where everybody knows everyone else. It shines a light on our community's decades-long battle to provide the best public education to their children, as we confronted racism and segregation in our day-to-day life. Through it all, you'll see how our faith and involvement in the church was central to believing in a better tomorrow.
Part 3: Chapters 12-17. Part Three begins with Dad's life-long dream to send all of his children to college unfolding. As teenagers, we experience the tradeoffs that came with attending a school where our presence was often and easily ignored even after successfully integrating the Arlington County school system. It's a period of ongoing change with several of us going to college, some of us going to war, and all of us coming of age.
Part 4: Chapters 18-19. Part Four is dedicated to our parent's legacy and the realization of their dreams through their children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. My siblings and I remember our parents, our community, and the gift of love and devotion we were blessed to receive.

story:
¿Qué?

La boca del lobo es una novela mestiza, con lo mejor del género negro y del suspense fantástico.

María, una joven de dieciocho años de edad y criada en un ambiente religioso y tradicional, se dispone a disfrutar por primera vez de un fin de semana con su pareja y amigos. Lo que debería ser un viaje de placer, a causa de un giro del destino, se convierte en una lucha feroz por salvar la vida. El peligro, que ya acechó a María cuando apenas contaba con ocho años y de lo que apenas guardaba recuerdo alguno, ha vuelto, con el único fin de terminar lo que empezó diez años atrás. Por eso, tendrá que pelear para poder acabar con el mal que se empeña en darle caza. Para ello, será necesario que busque ayuda y... quizá esa sea la peor idea de todas, pues aquellos que deberían ponerse de su lado tendrán otras intenciones. Tal vez, su empeño se materialice ocultar la verdad, cueste lo que cueste.

Todo ello, mientras los días pasan y una mortífera y nueva luna llena se adivina en el horizonte.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a José Antonio García Santos.

Aunque formado en el terreno de la economía, lleva varios años ligado a la literatura, terreno en el que ha ido cosechando algún que otro éxito con el paso del tiempo. Su género, podría calificarse de fronterizo, por encontrarse a caballo entre la novela negra y de terror. En 2.012 resultó ganador de la sección de relatos del Fanter Film Festival (www.abandomoviez.com), certamen del que fue segundo clasificado en las ediciones de 2.014 y 2.015. También en 2.012, fue elegido finalista en el III Certamen de Relatos de Terror de la Editorial Círculo Rojo, por lo que su relato «Segunda Oportunidad», apareció publicado en la antología Pasos en la Oscuridad. (Círculo Rojo, 2.012). Gracias a estos y otros certámenes, ha colaborado en las colecciones de relatos Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 2 (Ed. Círculo Rojo, 2.012) e Historias y relatos de ka-tet-corp.com Vol. 3 (Bubok, 2.014). Así mismo, ha participado en las antologías El Idioma del Miedo, (Amazon, 2014) y Fuga de Muerte, antología de relatos sobre el mal  (2.015). Es autor, además, de la colección de cuentos Retales (Seleer, 2.012)

En 2.016, resultó ganador de la IV Edición del Certamen de Novela Corta de Terror Ciudad de Utrera. Como resultado del mismo, salió publicada su primera novela, Travesía (Premium Editorial, 2.016). Cabe destacar que en la edición anterior, ya había resultado finalista con La boca del lobo, novela que gracias a tu ayuda, puede salir a la luz. Cabe destacar que, en 2.018, con Tandaia como editorial, el autor publicó Noir Francine, novela de género negro que recibió una buena aceptación por parte del público.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Las lágrimas que anegaban sus ojos no le impidieron ver lo que se mostraba ante ella. Se percató de la silueta de aquel animal y lo comprendió todo por fin. Había vuelto a su aventura de niña pequeña. No sabía cómo, pero volvía a las entrañas de aquella apestosa pesadilla. Estaba en el bosque, sola, aterrada y amenazada por esa repugnante mezcla de hombre y lobo. Durante un segundo, los ojos de víctima y verdugo se encontraron. María creyó percibir en la ambarina mirada de la bestia el reflejo de una sonrisa burlona. ¿Acaso ese engendro era capaz de reconocerla tantos años después?».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Antonio García Santos vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Story of My Book

To Hear a Girl Scream: A Memoir of Dreams and Insights in the 21st Century is a book that explores racial identity and growing up in the 2000s in the American South.

My name is Camryn Cobb and I am the author of To Hear a Girl Scream. I wrote this book because, as someone who is biracial, I feel that I have a unique perspective when it comes to race and how different cultures interact in America. It has always been a dream of mine to write a book, and this book contains my most intimate thoughts about what the world has looked like to me over the years.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that we as humans share more experiences than those that divide us. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social justice and equality. Ultimately, I want you to view this book as a tool to help you see the world in a more inclusive light.

In To Hear a Girl Scream, you'll learn about the importance of racial identity and how major events have affected young adults who are a part of Generation Z. Some stories from my book include:

  • “Mixed With Two,” in which I share my early experience of discovering I was biracial and understanding what race was
  • “Token Black Friends,“ where I share stories about the relationship between my childhood best friend and me as we grew up being the only people of color in predominately white spaces
  • “The 2016 Election,'” in which I explore my thoughts and feelings about this election cycle as a then-senior in high school, just shy of voter age
You will love this book if you’re interested in understanding what the world looks like to someone who is racially ambiguous or if you want to hear more about the change that young people desire.

To Hear a Girl Scream is a memoir-style book that speaks to young adults and open-minded souls who are looking at political optimism and challenging structural systems for the first time.

 

The Book - To Hear a Girl Scream


The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the Author’s Note and Chapters 1-5. In this section, as a young person bound by time, I discuss my dreams and worries concerning the world around me. I explore how the surplus of new opportunities contrasts with the disheartening lack of change I have encountered during my 20 years of life.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-9. In this section, I dive deep into how I have been shaped by my interactions with my loved ones and everyone around me. I offer keen insights about how my identity affects the way I am perceived by others and the way I navigate in American society.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-16. This section contains many of my stories and memories - from attending middle school to becoming a first-generation college student - while addressing the good, the bad, and the ugly of being a biracial minority in predominately white spaces.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...


About the Author


Camryn Cobb studies political research and communication in the advanced graduate program at the University of Georgia, where she is pursuing both a Bachelor of Family and Consumer Science and a Master of Science.

Camryn wrote this book because she (unknowingly) came into this world by making a statement. Being both white and black - two races historically pitted against each other in the South — she has learned to embrace this unique part of herself, and she’s eager to help different cultures and identities better coexist in the future.

Camryn is the first person to bring up political subjects or any other potentially uncomfortable conversational topics because she finds joy in authenticity and rawness. Her dreams span from encouraging her friends to think about the world in a new way to early-campaigning for the seat in the White House she will one day occupy.

For more information, you can connect with Camryn at camryncobb@uga.edu and www.linkedin.com/in/camryncobb/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ToHearAGirlScream and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via IndieGoGo at the top of the page!

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Camryn Cobb

I wrote this book because, as someone who is biracial, I feel that I have a unique perspective when it comes to race and how different cultures interact in America. It has always been a dream of mine to write a book, and this book contains my most intimate thoughts about what the world has looked like to me over the years.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that we as humans share more experiences than those that divide us. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social justice and equality. Ultimately, I want you to view this book as a tool to help you see the world in a more inclusive light.In To Hear a Girl Scream, you'll learn about the importance of racial identity and how major events have affected young adults who are a part of Generation Z. Some stories from my book include:

“Mixed With Two,” in which I share my early experience of discovering I was biracial and understanding what race was
“Token Black Friends,“ where I share stories about the relationship between my childhood best friend and me as we grew up being the only people of color in predominately white spaces
“The 2016 Election,'” in which I explore my thoughts and feelings about this election cycle as a then-senior in high school, just shy of voter age
You will love this book if you’re interested in understanding what the world looks like to someone who is racially ambiguous or if you want to hear more about the change that young people desire.To Hear a Girl Scream is a memoir-style book that speaks to young adults and open-minded souls who are looking at political optimism and challenging structural systems for the first time. 
The Book - To Hear a Girl Scream
The book is written in 3 Parts.Part 1 contains the Author’s Note and Chapters 1-5. In this section, as a young person bound by time, I discuss my dreams and worries concerning the world around me. I explore how the surplus of new opportunities contrasts with the disheartening lack of change I have encountered during my 20 years of life.Part 2 contains Chapters 6-9. In this section, I dive deep into how I have been shaped by my interactions with my loved ones and everyone around me. I offer keen insights about how my identity affects the way I am perceived by others and the way I navigate in American society.Part 3 contains Chapters 10-16. This section contains many of my stories and memories - from attending middle school to becoming a first-generation college student - while addressing the good, the bad, and the ugly of being a biracial minority in predominately white spaces. What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.
 When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...


About the Author
Camryn Cobb studies political research and communication in the advanced graduate program at the University of Georgia, where she is pursuing both a Bachelor of Family and Consumer Science and a Master of Science.Camryn wrote this book because she (unknowingly) came into this world by making a statement. Being both white and black - two races historically pitted against each other in the South — she has learned to embrace this unique part of herself, and she’s eager to help different cultures and identities better coexist in the future.Camryn is the first person to bring up political subjects or any other potentially uncomfortable conversational topics because she finds joy in authenticity and rawness. Her dreams span from encouraging her friends to think about the world in a new way to early-campaigning for the seat in the White House she will one day occupy.For more information, you can connect with Camryn at camryncobb@uga.edu and www.linkedin.com/in/camryncobb/. 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ToHearAGirlScream and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via IndieGoGo at the top of the page!
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Camryn Cobb

story:
ROCTBF is back!

 

The 14th Greater Rochester Teen Book Festival is being held on May 16, 2020 at RIT in Rochester!  Join us!!

Since being established in 2006, the Greater Rochester Teen Book Festival (TBF) has been an opportunity for public and school librarians to dedicate an event solely to teens, to encourage reading some of the best titles aimed at young adults, and to offer a place where readers can interact with award-winning authors. Our mission is to foster a community effort to celebrate and promote reading by connecting teens and authors.

TBF is committed to creating opportunities to celebrate the value of teens within our literary communities and focuses attention on the authors who write for them.

Your contributions help us keep this event and future festivals FREE to attend.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise at least $5000 to help defray the costs of funding TBF2020.  It takes about $60,000 to put on the festival.  The majority of our funding comes from sponsorships and donors like you!  

What do you get in return?

  • The knowledge that you are contributing to make TBF Magic happen!
  • Some fun, Indiegogo-only perks like author experiences, pins, autographing fast passes, and MORE!
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, every dollar still goes to the festival!

 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

  • Teens get a chance to meet authors that really resonate with them.  Whether they write themselves or not, for some teens it is their first opportunity to feel "heard" by someone who understands them.  
  • This is a labor of love for librarians and other adults who love working with teens.  The joy we get from seeing the faces of teens who feel at home with thousands of other readers is indescribable.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign on social media and encourage your friends and family to do the same!  Be a part of the TBF magic!

story:
When Our Haven Burned

From the top of his sleek tower, Aldrix Sterling looks down upon a city lit by his power, but darkened by his greed. Amidst a fierce battle between his energy company and environmentalists, he oscillates between addressing the demands of his position and the human consequences of his neglect. 

In the halls of power, Mayor Emerald Silva is determined to enact policies that will prevent others from sharing the fate of her lost home. But in an environment where many refuse to accept her as one of their own, she learns that making a difference may require some work in the shadows.

Freshly out of prison, Ezra is focused on a single thing: revenge. But as he comes to see the suffering in his community, he strives to both be part of the solution and eliminate the problem through any means necessary.

Told through an interconnected ensemble of perspectives, this collective narrative encompasses everyone from a brilliant dropout to a deaf father and a driven climate activist as they watch climate realities impact their communities in starkly different ways. As tensions in the city rise and destructive forces sweep through, every resident is forced to confront their own histories. And ultimately, they each find themselves caught between memories of the past and fear for the future as they try to keep their beloved city from burning in the present.

 

About the Author

Tyler Heggans is simply a human who wants to sit on a porch at age 80 and watch his grandchildren play, safe in the knowledge that they will have a future. 

He first developed the idea for this novel while walking on the streets of Madrid, wholly captivated by the destruction of a hurricane on the other side of an ocean. But in reality, this project was formed through a lifetime of friendships and interactions and experiences that led to an ever-curious outlook.

He wrote this book because he is hopelessly incompetent at most other creative arts. He is enamored with traveling, but can never seem to choose a destination. And while he loves languages, this process made him seriously doubt his ability to write in English. 

For more information, you can connect with Tyler at theggans830@gmail.com, LinkedIn and @theggans98 on Instagram.

Project Origin

When Our Haven Burned came about because while scientific research and data are critical to the climate conversation, I believe the stories of everyday people are also powerful forces for spurring action.

Whether you are new to the climate conversation, have worked in the space for 30 years or are simply looking for a good story, welcome. My hope is that as you journey through the events of this city with Ezra, Emerald, and Sterling, you will come to discover the ways in which you can use the talents and skills you already have to make a powerful impact on our shared future.

When Our Haven Burned speaks to those looking to delve into a work of literary fiction that challenges them to imagine the world we are building for the next generation while providing opportunities to envision a new path. 

Ultimately, I hope that When Our Haven Burned inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What is the moral weight of our inaction?
  • How will identity and class shape how future climate effects are felt?
  • How can we begin to address the cultural dynamics enmeshed in the climate crisis?

 

I am incredibly excited to explore these questions and more with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am proud to have my book published by New Degree Press. As a supporter, you are contributing to the following publishing services:

  • The Editor I am working closely with to polish my story for December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Both for physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to clean the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now in a range of tiers:
  • Access to the FlameKeepers Club, my author community who will receive exclusive access and peeks into the publishing process
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Handwritten thank-you note
  • Opportunity to be involved in the selection of my cover
  • Your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to provide early feedback.
  • Stickers, bookmarks, and other goodies!

 

Campaign Goals

  • Tier 1: Hit $6,500 and the ebook/paperback editions will be in your hands for the New Year! (this is the minimum needed)
  • Tier 2: Hit $7,500 and all individuals who pre-order have the option to receive a hardcover edition
  • Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and all pre-orders copies will be accompanied by character art!

*Please note: All pre-order options from digital to platinum are intended for individuals while the remainder are designated for groups and/or organizations.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
  1. Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  2. Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  3. Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the recipient, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't benefit!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most supporters at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #OurHaven and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Instragram - @theggans / @newdegreepress
Facebook - Tyler Heggans/ @NewDegreePress 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Tyler

story:
Who is Kerry Malone?

My first children’s book was released in October 2015. You can do it Joey! was meant to be a small project for my great-niece Tayla. When Meaghan Thomson came on board to do a couple of illustrations for me the project grew into a fully-fledged Indie publishing adventure! 

And what an adventure it has been, learning about the children’s publishing industry and meeting fabulous creators and booksellers. You can do it Joey! is in the homes of children and families all around the world.

It’s now time to produce new books and this series is special. The original idea for the series occurred at a particularly difficult time in my life when I had low vision, before a lot of surgery restored my eyesight. At a time when I was nearly blind and struggling with changes in my life I wrote a story about a little girl going to school for the first time wearing glasses. This story has morphed in Sophie’s series and some of her stories are based on my experiences as child who wore glasses from a young age.

The book and the series

Sophie Makes New Friends is the first book in my series of three chapter books for readers aged 6 - 9 years of age. Meaghan Thomson who illustrated You can do it Joey! is back to create more beautiful illustrations and design the series.

The series tells Sophie’s story as her family moves from the country to the city. She is anxious about making new friends in a big city school and has insecurities around wearing glasses. 

Sophie Makes New Friends

It’s Sophie’s first day at her new big city school. Without her old friends, who will sit with her at recess? Will she make new friends?

She eventually finds the courage to say hello to Phoebe. Will Phoebe convince Sophie to join the skipping team?

Sophie’s New Glasses

Sophie has made some friends at her new school and it’s not long until the netball season starts. 

Wearing glasses while playing netball in the rain has its challenges but when Sophie's glasses are broken during a game this creates a different set of problems. 

Sophie’s Party Invitation

Sophie has been invited to Phoebe’s birthday party at the pool and then a special sleepover afterwards. 

Sophie wants to go to Phoebe’s party but can’t wear her glasses in the pool. Will she be able to play and have fun with her friends? Will she ask her friends for help? 

How will the money raised be used?

The money raised will be put towards the cost of illustrating, designing and printing book one of the series, Sophie Makes New Friends. Illustrating and designing children's books takes a lot of skill and time and is an expensive process. Sophie’s story develops during the three books as she makes new friends and enjoys new experiences in the city and the dream is to release the series during the next two years.

Please have a look at the perks on the right hand side and if you are able to purchase one I would be eternally grateful. Your support will give me an idea of how many books I need to print and also help towards paying Meaghan for her beautiful work.

By pre-ordering your copy and/or copies for friends and family or your local school library, you will help bring this book and the series to life.

How long is the campaign?

The campaign will run until the 31st of July 2018 and Sophie Makes New Friends will be available in November 2018. 

Challenges

My biggest challenge is spreading the word about the campaign. This is where I need your help. My dream with the books is to reach children who, like Sophie, worry about making new friends and fitting in at a new school. 

I would love you to share the story and the link with your family and friends to help me spread the word about Sophie. 

Indiegogo has lots of share tools and I need you help to share this story far and wide!

Thank you

Thank you so much for your support and I can’t wait to share Sophie’s story with you.

Your support will help put copies of Sophie Makes New Friends into the hands of young readers who will hopefully fall in love with her story and want to know more.

Kerry

www.kerrymalone.com.au

If you have any questions please contact me at kerry@kerrymalone.com.au or follow along on the facebook page – www.facebook.com/kerrymaloneauthor

Image credit: All illustrations shown are by Meaghan Thomson and from Sophie Makes New Friends.
