My biggest challenge is spreading the word about the campaign. This is where I need your help. My dream with the books is to reach children who, like Sophie, worry about making new friends and fitting in at a new school. 

I would love you to share the story and the link with your family and friends to help me spread the word about Sophie. 
Indiegogo has lots of share tools and I need you help to share this story far and wide!
Thank youThank you so much for your support and I can’t wait to share Sophie’s story with you.Your support will help put copies of Sophie Makes New Friends into the hands of young readers who will hopefully fall in love with her story and want to know more.Kerrywww.kerrymalone.com.auIf you have any questions please contact me at kerry@kerrymalone.com.au or follow along on the facebook page – www.facebook.com/kerrymaloneauthorImage credit: All illustrations shown are by Meaghan Thomson and from Sophie Makes New Friends.

story:
At Safer Arizona we have come to witness a few disturbing realities in regards to our countries policy on marijuana prohibition. Our marijuana policy claims it is set in place to acomplish (but not limited to)

A) Get marijuana out of the hands of our kids.

B) Reduce crime, violence and get marijuana off the street.

C) Keep the citizens safe and protect them from unhealthy choices.

Upon examination of the true results of marijuana prohibition we have observed that the marijuana prohibition itself is exponentially damaging to society and we feel obligated to correct this error. In fact marijuana prohibition does the exact opposite by( but not limited to)

A) Allowing drug dealers to decide the age to have marijuana.

B) Pushing a globally established,high demand, multi-billion dollar industry on to the black market where people can’t sue over discrepancies so instead must resort to violence. This resulted in a massive increase in organized crime, gangs, gang violence, and sustains the mexican drug cartel war on our Arizona border which has claimed over 100,000 lives since 2006.

C) Promotes alcoholism, alcohol related diseases, death, violence, and sexual assault by removing the legal option to partake in a safer common alternative (marijuana) that has zero recorded overdose deaths or disease but instead has known medical qualities, promotes pacifism, and peace. Then by having this safer alternative be a crime it oppresses the citizens by turning ordinary people into criminals which destroys their futures and imprisons an enormous population of non violent people for making the safer choice all at the taxpayers expense.

To reverse this devastation the answer is simple. Legalize marijuana and regulate it similar to alcohol.  Safer Arizona is on organization of activists who seek to end marijuana prohibition for the safety of our community.

story:
Who Is Pioneers Press?

Pioneers Press is a Kansas-based publishing house and small-press distro focusing on survival and sustainability on the farm and in the city, in addition to health, gender, sexuality, social justice and food movements, and a cruelty-free lifestyle.

Why is Pioneers Press a different kind of publisher?

  • We're a handful of folks largely working from a farm
  • We work with domestic printers using low-impact & sustainable production
  • We publish and distribute the work of independent authors & artists

What Is Caveworld?

Caveworld is the second novel of American author and musician Adam Gnade. With your help, Pioneers plans to publish this 350-page trade paperback under its imprint, Punch Drunk Press, in December 2013—just a couple months from now!

About Caveworld:

     Adam Gnade's second novel, Caveworld, is a howl of desperation as its characters fight to find love and meaning in a society with which they feel out of step. Richly encyclopedic and set in the twin border towns of Tijuana and San Diego, the book tells two love stories separated by a gulf of twenty years. Caveworld is made up of the various events (both subtle and seismic) that change lives in an instant. 

     Gnade covers a lot of ground: sex and pervasive loneliness in teenage bedrooms, life-shaping horror in the Vietnam jungle, birth, school, work, marriage, depression, crime, murder, mood-flushed road trips crossing the continent, exile (whether on Mexican rooftop or country estate), and living rooms smoky with the sad and oft-times devastating absurdity of "sex, drugs, and rock 'n' roll." Equally influenced by Joan Didion's West Coast storytelling, Faulkner's Yoknapatawpha County, and James Joyce's early examinations of place, Gnade's Caveworld is an epic, sprawling saga of American life.

How will the funds be used?

  • About 80% will cover the print costs from our U.S.-based printer; and
  • The other 20% will cover artwork licensing, press mailing, and the rewards for our backers!

"Adam Gnade's body of work is haunting, inspirational, fierce, and tender. Few American writers have been able to give us all the pain and bullshit and euphoria of growing up, without either romanticizing it or trivializing it. Caveworld captures the search for life that all of us have felt, and are still feeling, and wrestles it to the ground with brutal beauty. I saw myself here, at times in ways that I'd rather have not, and you will too." —Will Potter, journalist and author of Green Is The New Red

"Here is a work of emotional havoc, horse sense, and deep deferential insight. Gnade's litanies on American life are a sand-shower blasting you clean with their dirt . . . moving through Caveworld you will see your own ghosts and have them exorcised." —Andrew Mears, of band Pet Moon, formerly of Youthmovies & Foals, author of Kettle Drum

How Will This Help Independent Publishing?

Pioneers is a small publisher, and we take a significant risk signing on to fund small, independent projects. Using crowdfunding to cover these initial costs will help us publish Caveworld, a title that we are truly excited about. We plan to use the sales from Caveworld to help fund our upcoming small press titles. Simply put, by backing this project, you help trigger the domino effect of future independent literature getting printed, too!

Any Support Means A Lot To Us

Support isn't just about the cash! We also graciously appreciate folks who:

  • Tell their friends about Pioneers Press and this Indiegogo campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word
  • Send us words of encouragement

Thank you all so, so much.

Sincerely,

—Pioneers Press

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE: Let us start by sending a heart-felt THANK YOU to all of our friends around the world!  With your support, we've achieved our initial funding goal!  We still have much to fundraise, so we appreciate all of your help in moving us closer to opening a truly great public library here in Damak, Nepal that will be enjoyed now and for generations to come.  Thank you for making a difference and for taking time to read my story here.


Books saved my life

My name is Bhesraj Neupane. I live in the town of Damak, in eastern Nepal. When I was 18 years old, just as I was about to head to university, I fell from the balcony of my home and landed on my back. I sustained a spinal cord injury from the fall, and when I became conscious a few days later, I was told some terrible news—I'd never be able to walk again. Those words sounded so unreal.  Like other people whose lives change instantly because of a split-second accident, I became angry at life, and very depressed. I remember thinking what a hopeful and happy person I was before the injury, and I wondered where that hope had gone and why it had left me.

But while in the hospital, a friend gave me a book to read, and that book really saved my life. As I read the first few pages, I realized that despite my condition, I was still fortunate to be able to read. I asked family and friends to bring more books when they visited, and by the end of my long hospital stay, I had read nearly 200 books. Reading really helped ease my pain, not by allowing me to escape it, but by making me realize that I still had value—that I could still contribute something. When I returned home, I was bound to a wheelchair but I realized there was a great opportunity in front of me: my town had no library, and my family had no money, but I had 200 books, so with those books I asked my parents if we could start our town's first library-- in our home.  With their support, we cleaned out a room of our house, asked neighbors to donate books and bookshelves, and officially opened Damak Public Library in December 2012.

How you can help us build a sustainable, fully-stocked library

Our library has been very well received by the community, and since our opening, we often have more than 50 visitors coming every day. Recently we asked our users how they envision the future of our library, and based on their feedback, we understand that we need a larger, more central space for our library, with at least several computers, desks and chairs in addition to more books so that we can best serve our community and keep the library growing for generations to come. There's things we're doing to make this happen, and there are things we are asking for your support given our limited resources here.

What we're doing ourselves:

  • Collecting used books from our community and throughout the region
  • Local fundraising: we've already raised funds with the gracious support of two international organizations based in Damak 
  • Have established a library card system so that books are not lost
  • Operate the library at minimal cost through our founder and a team of volunteers
  • Continue to promote the library by showcasing local talent (authors, artists, educators) at events throughout our community 

What we are fundraising and how $5,000 will get us started:

  • Rent for the new building location for the 1st and 2nd years = $2,400
  • 3 Desktop computers= $1,050
  • Additional books = $1,000
  • 2 battery inverter = $300
  • Computer tables, study tables and chairs = $250

How we'll utilize funds if we can exceed our minimum goal:

  • Additional rent for the building for the 3rd- 5th years = $3,600
  • Full-time staff member (salary for 2 years, based on local rates) = $2,800
  • Additional books = $2,000
  • 3 additional desktop computers = $1,000
  • Utilities for 3 additional years = $1,350
  • Scholarships for talented but financially needy students = $500
  • Additional book shelves, tables and chairs = $500

Faces of Damak Public Library: from young to young-at-heart

What if I can't help financially?

Just letting others know about our library and our fundraising project is a huge support! Thank you for sharing Bhesraj's story. Bhesraj has inspired so many people here, and we know that he will continue to motivate and encourage others around the world as people get to know him and what he is doing. Bhesraj is not only a good example for anyone who has a physical limitation, but he inspires us all to do something in our community and to make a positive difference in whatever ways we can.

Who we are and how to contact us

Damak Public Library is a registered non-profit organization (registration #1962) in the municipality of Damak, Nepal, and we are led by our founder Mr. Bhesraj Neupane as well as a 9-member committee who broadly represent the social and economic spectrum of our community. Our library is currently located in Damak-13, next to Everest Boarding School.

Please contact us by e-mail at damak.publiclibrary@gmail.com and by phone at either +977-984264-3513 (Mr. Bhesraj Neupane) or +977-980490-3316 (Mr. Brian Wahl). 

Follow our progress and see what your support means to us on our Facebook page at the link below.

Thank you again for all of your support and love!

Thank you again for making our library the best it can be. As you may have seen on the right side of this screen, there are many different levels of support (called "perks") from which you can donate, but we wanted to let you know that anything you can contribute, monetarily or otherwise, is deeply appreciated by Bhesraj and the community here.  The very fact that you're reading this, likely on the other side of the world, affirms our belief in the beauty of humanity.  After all, we can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.  We wish we could offer something in return for your generosity, but given our financial constraints here, we wanted to share in our "perks" beautiful quotes from authors whose books we've read and enjoyed.  This is the most symbolic and important gift we could think of given that you are helping us to buy books here for generations to share.

In closing, we'd like to quote one of our favorite authors, Randy Pausch, who wrote and gave "The Last Lecture" just before his death from pancreatic cancer in 2008.  Among the many valuable lessons he taught us, we think this one is especially true:

"Too many people go through life complaining about their problems. I've always believed that if you took one tenth the energy you put into complaining and applied it to solving the problem, you'd be surprised how well things can work out."

2015 Intel buys Altera for 15B $.
Intel wants to put Altera FPGA into their Processors.
You can make your own System On Chip.
With Processor and peripherals and put it all into an Grain of Sand. 
Priced below 2$.
You can do it now. Today.
DIPSY the GUIDE tells you HOW.

DIPSY the BOOK helps you to keep going on your way.

PERKS

DIY HARD KIT
The very first DIPSY boards I did assembly myself.
You want to try?
You really want to try?
Then this is your PERK to collect.

DIPSY DEVELOPER
You cant wait until DIPSY and tools go into full production?
We have some Hand Made DIPSY boards available NOW.
Included is DIPSY EPT - Emulator and Programmer Tool.

Start development today!

DIPSY the GUIDE
How it was made.
Why it was made.
What you can do with.
How you can use DIPSY with:
  • Arduino
  • TEENSY
  • Rasperry Pi
  • BeagleBone
  • Intel Edison
  • Intel Galileo

And many more use cases. This book will be electronic delivery only.

DIPSY the BOOK
A book about a KID.
I promise keep writing it while I write the GUIDE.
Tentative delivery: April 2016

Media


HackaDay
DIPSY as product is in the finals for the HackaDay 2015 Best Product Prize. 
There are 10 Finalists, DIPSY is amongst them.
A Grain of Sand.

story:
新文潮出版《WhyNot 不为什么》，一本属于新加坡的华文文学杂志。

文学杂志简介


　　新文潮于2012年12月7日，由5位热爱文学的新加坡南洋理工大学中文系生创社。新文潮是一个独立的民间团体，旨在培养新一代读者与作者，并试图重探新华文学的主体性。

　　不论是出版物，或举办的活动，一直都受到公众与媒体热烈的支持。新文潮出版的文学杂志《WhyNot 不为什么》，喜见有原创性、试验性质的作品，期待更多新一代为本土文学发声。杂志也设立专题，采访本地作家、文化工作者、艺术家，包括英培安、梁文福、杨君伟、冯啟明（Alvin Pang）、Joshua Ip（小叶子）等，希望从中汲取他们的经验与思维，启发新一代创作者与读者。

　　新文潮希望能成为新华文学的 “先锋”，并为第三代写作人开辟一条不同的创作道路。


款项用途

　　　

　　《WhyNot 不为什么》第四期已在排版当中，估计今年10月中可出版。发布会安排于新加坡作家节2015举行，杂志估计会在126页左右（部分彩色）。款项主要用途如下：

　　1. 印刷费（约SGD3000）

　　其余费用，新文潮已向艺理会申请部分赞助，再加上前几期的销售所得来补助。所以，我们把目标定为USD 2000（约SGD 2768.90），蒙各位文友前来鼓励。


为什么要支持？

　　理由一：培养新一代读者和作者
　　理由二：文学如爱情，不为什么
　　理由三：文学需要回到民间，属于你和我

　　其余费用，新文潮已向艺理会申请部分赞助，再加上前几期的销售所得来补助。所以，我们把目标定为USD 2000（约SGD 2768.90），蒙各位文友前来鼓励。
